P, p¹
/pi: ||; pi/noun [C,U] (plural P's;p's /pi:z ||; piz/) the sixteenth letter of the English alphabet 英语字母表的第十六个字母: ‘Pencil’ begins with (a) ‘P’. pencil以字母P开头。

p²
abbr
1 (plural pp) page 页: See p94. 见第94页。 pp 63-96 第63至96页
2 (Brit 英) (informal 非正式) penny, pence 便士: a 27p stamp 一枚27便士的邮票
3 P (on a road sign) parking （用于路标）停车处

p.a.
/pəˈrænəm ||; pɚˈænəm/abbr per annum; in or for a year 每年: salary £15000 p.a. 年薪15000英镑

pa
abbr per annum; in or for a year: salary £15000 pa

*pace¹
/peɪs ||; pes/noun
1 [U] [sing] pace (of sth) the speed at which you walk, run, etc or at which sth happens 速度；步调；步伐: to run at a steady / gentle pace 以稳定╱不疾不徐的速度跑步 I can't stand the pace of life in London. 我受不了伦敦那种生活节奏。 Students are encouraged to work at their own pace (= as fast or as slowly as they like). 学生被鼓励按照自己的步调来学习。
2 [C] the distance that you move when you take one step 一步；步幅: Take two paces forward and then stop. 向前走两步然后停下来。
keep pace (with sb/sth) to move or do sth at the same speed as sb/sth else; to change as quickly as sth else is changing 与…并驾齐驱；跟得上（某人或某事物）: Wages are not keeping pace with inflation. 工资增长跟不上通货膨胀。 set the pace to move or do sth at the speed that others must follow 定步调；树立榜样；带头: Pinto set the pace for the first three miles. 平托在最初的三英里跑在前面。
pace²
/peɪs ||; pes/verb [I,T] to walk up and down in the same area many times, especially because you are nervous or angry 来回踱步（尤指因为紧张或生气）

pacemaker
/ˈpeɪsmeɪkə(r) ||; ˈpesˌmekɚ/noun[C]
1 a machine that helps to make a person's heart beat regularly or more strongly 心脏起搏器；心律调整器
2 a person in a race who sets the speed that the others must follow （在速度赛中）定速度的人，带头的人

pachyderm
/ˈpækidɜ:m ||; ˈpækəˌdɝm/noun [C] (technical术语) a type of animal with a very thick skin, for example an elephant 厚皮动物（如象）

pacifier
/ˈpæsɪfaɪə(r) ||; ˈpæsəˌfaɪr/ (US 美) =DUMMY(3)

pacifism
/ˈpæsɪfɪzəm ||; ˈpæsəˌfɪzəm/noun [U] the belief that all wars are wrong and that you should not fight in them 和平主义；反战主义 ➔pacifist /-ɪst ||; -ɪst/ noun [C]

pacify
/ˈpæsɪfaɪ ||; ˈpæsəˌfaɪ/verb [T] (present participle pacifying third person singular present pacifies;past tense past participle pacified) to make sb who is angry or upset be calm or quiet 使平静；使安静；安抚

*pack¹
/pæk ||; pæk/noun[C]
1 a set of things that are supplied together for a particular purpose 一包；一盒: an information pack 信息包 These batteries are sold in packs of four. 这些电池以四个一包出售。 (figurative 比喻) Everything she told me was a pack of lies. 她对我说的是一派谎言。 ☞Look at the entries for package, packet and parcel. 参看package、packet及parcel。
2 (US 美) =PACKET(1)
3 a bag that you carry on your back 背包 [SYN] rucksack or backpack 同义词为rucksack或backpack
4 [with.sop] a group of wild animals that hunt together （一起猎食的）一群（野兽）: a pack of dogs/wolves 一群狗╱狼
5 a large group of similar people or things, especially one that you do not like or approve of 一帮；一伙；一批: a pack of journalists 一帮记者
6 (US 美 deck) a complete set of playing cards 一副纸牌 ☞ Look at the note and picture at card. 参看card的注释及插图。
*pack²
/pæk ||; pæk/verb
1 [I,T] to put your things into a suitcase, etc before you go away or go on holiday 收拾（行李）；打（包） · I'll have to pack my suitcase in the morning. 我得在早上收拾好手提箱。 Have you packed your toothbrush? 你把牙刷放进行李没有？ ☞ The expression do your packing means the same. 收拾行李也说do your packing。 [OPP] unpack 反义词为unpack
2 [I,T] to put things into containers so they can be stored, transported or sold 打（包）；装（箱） · I packed all my books into boxes. 我把所有的书都装进箱里了。 [OPP] unpack 反义词为unpack
3 [T] (often passive 常用于被动语态) (informal 非正式) to fill with people or things until crowded or full 填满；挤满；塞满: The train was absolutely packed. 火车上挤满了人。 The book is packed with useful information. 这本书里有许多有用的资料。 People packed the pavements, waiting for the president to arrive. 人行道上挤满了人，等候总统到来。
pack sth in(informal 非正式) to stop doing sth 停止做某事: I've packed in my job. 我已经收手不干了。 I've had enough of you boys arguing -- just pack it in, will you! 你们这些男孩子老是争吵，我已经受够了，别再吵了，好吗？ pack sth in/into sth to do a lot in a short time 在短时间内做很多事情: They packed a lot into their three days in Rome. 在罗马的三天，他们紧凑地安排了很多节目。 pack sth out (usually passive 通常用于被动语态) to fill sth with people 使某处挤满人: The bars are packed out every night. 酒吧里每晚都挤满人。 pack up(informal 非正式)
1 to finish working or doing sth 收工；结束工作: There was nothing else to do so we packed up and went home. 没有其他事情要做，所以我们收工回家。
2 (used about a machine, engine, etc) to stop working （指机器、引擎等）发生故障，失灵： My old car packed up last week so now I cycle to work. 上个星期我那辆老爷车坏了，所以我现在骑自行车上班。

*package
/ˈpækɪdʒ ||; ˈpækɪdʒ/noun[C]
1 (Brit 英) something, or a number of things, covered in paper or in a box 包；包裹: There's a large package on the table for you. 桌上有一个给你的大包裹。 ☞Look at the entries for pack, packet and parcel. 参看pack、packet及parcel。
2 a number of things that must be bought or accepted together （要一起买下或接受的）整套，组件，软件包，套装软件: a word-processing package 一套文字处理软件包 a financial aid package 一揽子财政援助方案
3 (US 美) =PACKET(1)andPARCEL package verb · Goods that are attractively packaged sell more quickly. 包装吸引的货物卖得更快。

ˈpackage holiday
(US 美 package tour) noun [C] a holiday that is organized by a company for a fixed price that includes the cost of travel, hotels, etc 包价旅游

packaging
/ˈpækɪdʒɪŋ ||; ˈpækɪdʒɪŋ/noun [U] all the materials (boxes, bags, paper, etc) that are used to cover or protect goods before they are sold 包装材料（如箱子、袋子、纸张等）

ˌpacked ˈlunch
noun [C] food that you prepare at home and take with you to eat at work or school 自备午餐；自备便当

packer
/ˈpækə(r) ||; ˈpækɚ/noun [C] a person, company or machine that puts goods, especially food, into boxes, plastic, paper, etc to be sold 包装工人，包装公司，包装机器（尤指包装食品的）

*packet
/ˈpækɪt ||; ˈpækɪt/noun
1 (US 美 packpackage) [C] a small box, bag, etc in which things are packed to be sold in a shop （包装商品的）盒，包，袋: a packet of sweets/biscuits/crisps 一包糖果；一盒饼干；一袋炸马铃薯片 a cigarette packet 香烟盒 ☞Look at the entries for pack, package and parcel. 参看pack、package及parcel。
2 [sing] (spoken 口语) a large amount of money 一大笔钱: That new kitchen must have cost them a packet. 那间新厨房一定让他们花了一大笔钱。
3 [C] (computing计算机技术) an amount of data that is sent through a computer NETWORK 信息包；数据包

packing
/ˈpækɪŋ ||; ˈpækɪŋ/noun[U]
1 the act of putting your clothes, possessions, etc into boxes or cases in order to take or send them somewhere 装箱；打包；收拾行李: We're going on holiday tomorrow so I'll do my packing tonight. 我们明天要去度假，因此今晚我要收拾行李。
2 (Brit 英) soft material that you use to stop things from being damaged or broken when you are sending them somewhere 包装衬垫: The price of the book includes postage and packing. 这本书的价格包括邮资及包装材料。

ˈpacking case
noun [C] a wooden box that you put things in before they are sent somewhere or stored 装货箱

ˈpack rat
noun [C] (US, informal 美，非正式) a person who collects and stores a lot of things that he/she does not really need 收藏无用东西的人

pact
/pækt ||; pækt/noun [C] a formal agreement between two or more people, groups or countries （个人、组织或国家间的）协议，契约，协议，条约

*pad¹
/pæd ||; pæd/noun[C]
1 a thick piece of soft material, used for cleaning or protecting sth or to make sth a different shape 软垫；护垫；衬垫: Remove eye make-up with cleanser and a cotton-wool pad. 用洁肤液和棉块擦去眼影。 a jacket with shoulder pads 有垫肩的短上衣
2 a number of pieces of paper that are fastened together at one end 拍纸簿；便笺簿: a notepad 拍纸簿
3 the place where a spacecraft takes off 航天器发射台: a launch pad 发射台
4 the soft part on the bottom of the feet of some animals, for example dogs and cats 肉掌（某些动物，如猫、狗足底的脂肪组织块） ☞picture on page C1 见C1页插图
pad²
/pæd ||; pæd/verb (padding;padded)
1 [T] pad sth (with sth) (usually passive 通常用于被动语态) to fill or cover sth with soft material in order to protect it, make it larger or more comfortable, etc （用柔软材料）填塞，覆盖: I sent the photograph frame in a padded envelope. 我把照片框装在衬有填料的信封里寄出。
2 [I] pad about, along, around, etc to walk quietly, especially because you are not wearing shoes （尤指没有穿鞋）放轻脚步走: He got up and padded into the bathroom. 他起了床，轻轻走进浴室。
pad sth out to make a book, speech, etc longer by adding things that are not necessary （加入不必要的内容）把（书、演说等）拉长，硬凑字数

padding
/ˈpædɪŋ ||; ˈpædɪŋ/noun [U] soft material that is put inside sth to protect it or to make it larger, more comfortable, etc 垫料；衬料

paddle¹
/ˈpædl ||; ˈpædḷ/noun [C] a short pole that is flat and wide at one or both ends and that you use for moving a small boat through water 短桨 ☞ Look at oar. 参看oar。 ☞picture at boat 见boat插图
paddle²
/ˈpædl ||; ˈpædḷ/verb
1 [I,T] to move a small boat through water using a short pole that is flat and wide at one or both ends 用短桨划（船）: We paddled down the river. 我们划船顺流而下。 ☞ Look at row. 参看row。
2 [I] to walk in water that is not very deep 涉水；在浅水中行走: We paddled in the stream. 我们在溪中行走。 ☞picture on page C8 见C8页插图

ˈpaddle steamer
noun [C] an old-fashioned type of boat driven by steam and moved forward by a large wheel or wheels at the side 明轮船

paddock
/ˈpædək ||; ˈpædək/noun [C] a small field where horses are kept 小型马场

paddy
/ˈpædi ||; ˈpædɪ/ (also paddy field) noun [C] (plural paddies) a field that is covered with water in which rice is grown 稻田

padlock
/ˈpædlɒk ||; ˈpædˌlɑk/noun [C] a type of lock that you can use for fastening gates, bicycles, etc 挂锁；扣锁 padlock verb [T] padlock sth (to sth) I padlocked my bicycle to a post. 我用扣锁把自行车锁到一根柱子上。

paed-
/pi:d ||; pid/ (US 美 ped-) prefix (used in nouns and adjectives 用于构成名词及形容词) connected with children 与儿童有关的: paediatrics 儿科学

paediatrician
/ˌpi:dɪəˈtrɪʃn ||; ˌpidɪəˈtrɪʃən/ (US 美 pediatrician) noun [C] a doctor who deals with the diseases of children 儿科医生

paediatrics
/ˌpi:diˈætrɪks ||; ˌpidɪˈætrɪks/ (US 美 pediatrics) noun [U] the area of medicine connected with the diseases of children 儿科学；小儿科 ➔paediatric(US 美 pediatric) adj

paedophile
/ˈpi:dəʊfaɪl ||; ˈpidofaɪl/ (US 美 pedo-) noun [C] a person who is sexually attracted to children 恋童癖患者

paedophilia
/ˌpi:dəˈfɪliə ||; ˌpidəˈfɪlɪə/ (US 美 pedo-) noun [U] the condition of being sexually attracted to children; sexual activity with children 恋童癖

paella
/paɪˈelə ||; pɑˈɛlə/noun [U] [C] a Spanish dish made with rice, meat, fish and vegetables 西班牙什锦饭（用大米、肉、鱼和蔬菜做的）

pagan
/ˈpeɪgən ||; ˈpegən/adj having religious beliefs that do not belong to any of the main religions 异教的；非主要宗教的 pagan noun [C]

*page¹
/peɪdʒ ||; pedʒ/noun[C]
1 (abbr p) one or both sides of a piece of paper in a book, magazine, etc （书、杂志等的）页，面: The letter was three pages long. 这封信有三页长。 Turn over the page. 翻到下一页。 Turn to page 12 of your book. 翻到书的第12页。 the front pageof a newspaper 报纸的头版
2 (computing计算机技术) a section of data or information that can be shown on a computer screen at any one time 页；页面 ☞ Look at home page. 参看home page。
page²
/peɪdʒ ||; pedʒ/verb [T] to call sb by sending a message to a small machine(a pager)that he/she carries, or by calling his/her name publicly through a device fixed to the wall(a loudspeaker) （用呼叫机或挂壁扬声器）传呼

pageant
/ˈpædʒənt ||; ˈpædʒənt/noun[C]
1 a type of public entertainment at which people dress in clothes from past times and give outdoor performances of scenes from history 盛装游行（穿着传统服装，在户外表现历史场面）
2 (US 美) =BEAUTY CONTEST

pageantry
/ˈpædʒəntri/noun [U] the feeling and appearance of a big, colourful ceremony 庆典；盛况: Millions of people enjoyed the pageantry of the Olympic opening ceremony on television. 数百万人通过电视观看奥运会的开幕盛况。

pager
/ˈpeɪdʒə(r) ||; ˈpedʒɚ/noun [C] a small machine that you carry, that makes a sound when sb sends you a message 传呼机；BP机；呼叫器 [SYN] bleeper 同义词为bleeper

pagoda
/pəˈgəʊdə ||; pəˈgodə/noun [C] a religious building(temple)in India or East Asia in the form of a tall tower with several levels, each of which has its own roof （印度及东亚的）宝塔，塔式寺庙

paid
past tense, past participle ofPAY¹

ˈpaid-up
adj (only before a noun 只用于名词前) having paid all the money that you owe, for example to become a member of a club 已付清的；已缴费的: He's a fully paid-up member of Friends of the Earth. 他是地球之友协会已缴清会费的会员。

*pain¹
/peɪn ||; pen/noun
1 [C,U] the unpleasant feeling that you have when a part of your body has been hurt or when you are ill 痛；疼: to be in pain 感到疼痛 He screamed with pain. 他痛得尖叫起来。 chest pains 胸口疼痛 ☞We use ache for a long, continuous pain and pain for sudden, short, sharp periods of pain. Therefore we usually say I've got earache/backache/toothache/a headache but He was admitted to hospital with pains in his chest.For the use of ‘a’ or ‘an’ with ache, look at the note at ache. 持久的痛叫做ache，突然间短促的剧痛叫做pain。因此通常说：I've got earache／backache／toothache／a headache.我耳痛╱背痛╱牙痛╱头痛。但要说：He was admitted to hospital with pains in his chest.他突然胸口痛而住院。有关ache跟a或an连用的问题，参看ache的注释。
2 [U] sadness that you feel because sth bad has happened 痛苦；悲痛: the pain of losing a parent 丧父╱母之痛
be a pain (in the neck)(spoken 口语) a person, thing or situation that makes you angry or annoyed 恼人、烦人的人、事物或情况
pain²
/peɪn ||; pen/verb [T] (formal 正式) to make sb feel sad or upset 使痛苦；使难过: It pains me to think how much money we've wasted. 一想到我们浪费了多少钱，我心里就很难过。

pained
/peɪnd ||; pend/adj showing that you are sad or upset 痛苦的；难过的: a pained expression 痛苦的表情

*painful
/ˈpeɪnfl ||; ˈpenfəl/adj painful (for sb) (to do sth)
1 that causes pain or hurts 疼痛的；痛苦的: A wasp sting can be very painful. 给黄蜂螫到很痛的。
2 making you feel upset or embarrassed 令人难过的；令人尴尬的: The break-up of their marriage was very painful for the children. 他们婚姻破裂对孩子们来说是很痛苦的。 ➔painfully /-fəli ||; -fəlɪ/ adv

painkiller
/ˈpeɪnkɪlə(r) ||; ˈpenˌkɪlɚ/noun [C] a drug that is used for reducing pain 止痛药

painless
/ˈpeɪnləs ||; ˈpenləs/adj that does not cause pain 无痛的；不引起痛苦的: The animals' death is quick and painless. 这些动物死得快而无痛苦。 ➔painlessly adv

pains
/peɪnz ||; penz/noun be at/take (great) pains to do sth;take (great) pains (with/over sth) to make a special effort to do sth well 努力，煞费苦心（做某事）: He was at pains to hide his true feelings. 他努力掩饰真正的感受。

painstaking
/ˈpeɪnzteɪkɪŋ ||; ˈpenzˌtekɪŋ/adj very careful and taking a long time 十分仔细的；精心的；费心的: The painstaking search of the wreckage gave us clues as to the cause of the crash. 仔仔细细检查残骸后，我们获得了失事原因的线索。 ➔painstakingly adv

*paint¹
/peɪnt ||; pent/noun
1 [U] coloured liquid that you put onto a surface to decorate or protect it 油漆；涂料: green/orange/yellow paint 绿漆；橙漆；黄漆 The door will need another coat of paint. 这扇门需要再涂一道漆。
2 [U] coloured liquid that you can use to make a picture （作画的）颜料: oil paint 油画颜料 watercolour paint 水彩画颜料
3 paints [pl] a collection of tubes or blocks of paint that an artist uses for painting pictures 一套颜料
*paint²
/peɪnt ||; pent/verb[I,T]
1 to put paint onto a surface or an object 油漆；髹 · We painted the fence. 我们漆了栅栏。 The walls were painted pink. 墙壁刷成了粉红色。
2 to make a picture of sb/sth using paints （用颜料）画，绘画 · We painted some animals on the wall. 我们在这面墙上画了一些动物。 ☞picture at sport 见sport插图

paintbox
/ˈpeɪntbɒks ||; ˈpentˌbɑks/noun [C] a box that contains blocks or tubes of paint of many colours 颜料盒

paintbrush
/ˈpeɪntbrʌʃ ||; ˈpentˌbrʌʃ/noun [C] a brush that you use for painting with 画笔；油漆刷子 ☞picture at brush 见brush插图

*painter
/ˈpeɪntə(r) ||; ˈpentɚ/noun[C]
1 a person whose job is to paint buildings, walls, etc 油漆工
2 a person who paints pictures 画家

*painting
/ˈpeɪntɪŋ ||; ˈpentɪŋ/noun
1 [C] a picture that sb has painted 画: a famous painting by Van Gogh 凡高的名画 ☞A drawing is similar to a painting, but is done using pencils, pens or crayons instead of paints. drawing与painting相似，但drawing是指用铅笔、钢笔或蜡笔而不是用颜料画的画。
2 [U] the act of painting pictures or buildings 绘画；上油漆: She studies Indian painting. 她研究印度绘画。

ˈpaint thinner
noun [U] a liquid that is used to make paint more liquid or to remove paint from brushes or surfaces 涂料稀释剂

paintwork
/ˈpeɪntwɜ:k ||; ˈpentˌwɝk/noun [U] a painted surface, especially on a vehicle （尤指车辆的）油漆面

*pair¹
/peə(r) ||; pɛr/noun[C]
1 two things of the same type that are used or worn together 一对；一双: a pair of shoes/gloves/earrings 一双鞋子；一双手套；一对耳环
2 a thing that consists of two parts that are joined together 一件由相连的两部份组成的东西: a pair of scissors/glasses/trousers 一把剪刀；一副眼镜；一条裤子
3 [with.p] two people or animals that are doing sth together 一起做某事的两个人或两只动物: These boxers have fought several times, and tonight the pair meet again. 这两名拳击选手过去多次交手，今晚将再次相遇。 ☞We use couple to refer to two people who are married or in a relationship together. couple指夫妇或两个相爱的人。
in pairs two at a time 成对；成双: These earrings are only sold in pairs. 这些耳环只成对出售。 The students were working in pairs. 学生们两人一组学习。
pair²
/peə(r) ||; pɛr/verb pair (sb/sth) off (with sb) to come together, especially to form a romantic relationship; to bring two people together for this purpose （使）配对，成双（尤指使两人结成情侣）: She's always trying to pair me off with her brother. 她老是想把我介绍给她的弟弟。 pair up (with sb) to join together with another person or group to work, play a game, etc （在工作、游戏等中跟另一人或另一组）搭挡，连手: I paired up with another student and we did the project together. 我跟另一个同学搭档，一起做这个项目。

pajamas
(US 美) =PYJAMAS

*palace
/ˈpæləs ||; ˈpælɪs/noun [C] a large house that is or was the home of a king or queen 皇宫；宫殿

palaeontologist
/ˌpæliɒnˈtɒlədʒɪst; US ˌpeɪl- ||; ˌpelɪɑnˈtɑlədʒɪst/ (US 美 paleo-) noun [C] a person who studies very old dead animals or plants in FOSSILS 古生物学家

palaeontology
/ˌpæliɒnˈtɒlədʒi; US ˌpeɪl- ||; ˌpelɪɑnˈtɑlədʒɪ/ (US 美 paleo-) noun [U] the scientific study of FOSSILS 古生物学

palate
/ˈpælət ||; ˈpælɪt/noun [C] the top part of the inside of your mouth 腭

*pale
/peɪl ||; pel/adj
1 (used about a person or his/her face) having skin that is light in colour, often because of fear or illness （指人或其脸色因害怕或生病而）苍白的: She has a pale complexion. 她脸色苍白。 I felt myself go/turn pale with fear. 我觉得自己吓得脸色苍白。 ☞noun pallor. 名词为pallor。 ☞Compare pallid. 与pallid比较。
2 not bright or strong in colour （颜色）浅的，淡的: a pale yellow dress 浅黄色的连衣裙 [OPP] dark 反义词为dark pale verb [I]

palette
/pælət ||; ˈpælət/noun [C] a board or flat object on which an artist mixes different colours of paint together 调色板

palindrome
/pælɪndrəʊm ||; ˈpælɪnˌdrom/noun [C] a word or phrase that is the same when it is read backward, such as ‘level’ or ‘nurses run’ 回文﹙正反读都一样的词语﹚

pall
/pɔ:l ||; pɔl/verb [I] to become less interesting or important 变得乏味；变得不大重要: After a few months, the excitement of his new job began to pall. 几个月后，他新工作的刺激感开始消退。

ˈpall-bearer
noun [C] a person who helps to carry the box containing a dead person's body (casket) at a funeral 抬棺者；扶灵者

pallid
/ˈpælɪd ||; ˈpælɪd/adj (used about a person or his/her face) light in colour, especially because of illness （指人或其脸色）苍白的（尤指因生病）: His pallid complexion made him look unhealthy. 他脸色苍白，因此显得不健康。 ☞Compare pale. 与pale比较。

pallor
/ˈpælə(r) ||; ˈpælɚ/noun [U] pale colouring of the face, especially because of illness or fear （因生病或恐惧）脸色苍白

palm¹
/pɑ:m ||; pɑm/noun[C]
1 the flat, inner surface of your hand 手掌；掌心；手心: She held the coins tightly in the palm of her hand. 她把那些硬币紧紧握在手心里。 ☞picture at body 见body插图
2 (also palm tree) a tall straight type of tree that grows in hot countries. Palms have a lot of large leaves at the top but no branches. 棕榈树 ☞picture on page C2 见C2页插图
palm²
/pɑ:m ||; pɑm/verb palm sb off (with sth)(informal 非正式) to persuade sb to believe sth that is not true in order to stop him/her asking questions or complaining （用…）搪塞某人 palm sth off (on sb) to persuade sb to accept sth that he/she does not want 把…推给某人: She's always palming off the worst jobs on her assistant. 她总是把最糟糕的活儿打发给助手。

ˈpalm oil
noun [U] oil that we get from the fruit of a PALM TREEthat is used in cooking and in making soap, candles, etc 棕榈油

palmtop
/ˈpɑ:mtɒp ||; ˈpɑmˌtɑp/noun [C] (computing计算机技术) a very small computer that can be held on the PALM(= the flat inner surface) of one hand 掌上型计算机 ☞Compare desktop and laptop. 与desktop及laptop比较。

palsy
/ˈpɔ:lzi ||; ˈpɔlzɪ/ →CEREBRAL PALSY

paltry
/ˈpɔ:ltri ||; ˈpɔltrɪ/adj too small to be considered important or useful 微不足道的；无价值的: a paltry sum of money 一笔少得可怜的钱

pamper
/ˈpæmpə(r) ||; ˈpæmpɚ/verb [T] to take care of sb very well and make him/her feel as comfortable as possible 纵容；娇养；溺爱

pamphlet
/ˈpæmflət ||; ˈpæmflɪt/noun [C] a very thin book with a paper cover containing information about a particular subject 小册子

*pan
/pæn ||; pæn/noun [C] a metal container with a handle or handles that is used for cooking food in; the contents of a pan （有柄的）平底锅；锅中物: Cook the spaghetti in a large pan of boiling water. 把意大利面条放在一大锅沸水里煮。

pan-
/pæn ||; pæn/prefix (used in adjectives and nouns 用于构成形容词及名词) including all of sth; connected with the whole of sth 全；与整个有关: pan-African 泛非

pancake
/ˈpænkeɪk ||; ˈpæŋˌkek/noun [C] a type of very thin round cake that is made by frying a mixture of flour, milk and eggs (batter) 薄煎饼 ☞picture on page C4 见C4页插图

ˈPancake Day
(also ˌShrove ˈTuesday) a Tuesday in February when people in Britain traditionally eat pancakes. Pancake Day is the day before the period of Lent begins. 薄煎饼日（在二月某星期二，大斋期前一日，英国人这一天按传统吃薄煎饼）

pancreas
/ˈpæŋkriəs ||; ˈpæŋkrɪəs/noun [C] an organ near the stomach that produces the substance that controls the amount of sugar in the blood(insulin)and which helps your body to deal with(digest)the food you eat 胰（胃附近的器官，能控制血液中胰岛素的量，帮助消化食物） ➔pancreatic /ˌpæŋkriˈætɪk ||; ˌpæŋkrɪˈætɪk/ adj

panda
/ˈpændə ||; ˈpændə/noun [C] a large black and white bear that comes from China 大熊猫

pandemic
/pænˈdemɪk ||; pænˈdɛmɪk/noun [C] a disease that spreads over a whole country or the whole world 大流行病 pandemic adj ☞Compare endemic and epidemic. 与endemic及epidemic比较。

pandemonium
/ˌpændəˈməʊniəm ||; ˌpændɪˈmonɪəm/noun [U] a state of great noise and confusion 骚动；喧扰；大混乱

pander
/ˈpændə(r) ||; ˈpændɚ/verb pander to sb/sth to do or say exactly what sb wants especially when this is not reasonable 迎合；逢迎: He refuses to pander to his boss's demands. 他拒绝迎合他老板的要求。

p. and p.
abbr (Brit 英) postage and packing 邮资及包装费: price: £29 incl p. and p. 价格为29英镑，包括邮资及包装费

pane
/peɪn ||; pen/noun [C] a piece of glass in a window, etc （窗等的）大玻璃片: a windowpane 窗玻璃 ☞picture on page C7 见C7页插图

panel
/ˈpænl ||; ˈpænḷ/noun[C]
1 a square or rectangular piece of wood, metal or glass that forms part of a door or wall （门、墙等的）镶板，嵌板，护墙板
2 [with.sop] a group of people who give their advice or opinions about sth; a group of people who discuss topics of interest on television or radio （在电视、广播节目中发表看法或讨论问题的）专家小组，讨论小组: a panel of judges (= in a competition) （比赛的）评判小组 a panel game (= a TV game show with two teams) 小组猜谜，小组智力竞赛（由两队参加的电视游戏节目）
3 a flat surface that contains the equipment for controlling a vehicle, machine, etc 仪表板；控制板: a control/display panel 控制板；显示板

panelling
/ˈpænəlɪŋ ||; ˈpænḷɪŋ/ (US 美 paneling) noun [U] square or rectangular pieces of wood used to cover and decorate walls, ceilings, etc 镶板；嵌板

panellist
/ˈpænəlɪst ||; ˈpænḷɪst/ (US 美 panelist) noun [C] a member of a panel(2) 专家小组或讨论小组的成员

pang
/pæŋ ||; pæŋ/noun [C] [usu.pl] a sudden strong feeling of emotional or physical pain （身心上突如其来的）一阵痛苦或剧痛: a pang of jealousy 一股强烈的妒意 hunger pangs 饥饿引致的剧痛

*panic
/ˈpænɪk ||; ˈpænɪk/noun [C,U] a sudden feeling of fear that cannot be controlled and stops you from thinking clearly 恐慌；惊慌: People fled in panic as the fire spread. 大火蔓延，人们仓皇逃走。 There was a mad panic when the alarm went off. 警报响起时，大家都惊慌失措。 panic verb [I] (panicking;panicked) Stay calm and don't panic. 保持冷静，不要惊慌。

ˈpanic-stricken
/ˈpænɪk strɪkn ||; ˈpænɪk ˌstrɪkən/adj very frightened in a way that stops you from thinking clearly 惶恐不安的

panorama
/ˌpænəˈrɑ:mə; US -ˈræmə ||; ˌpænəˈræmə/noun [C] a view over a wide area of land 全景 ➔panoramic /ˌpænəˈræmɪk ||; ˌpænəˈræmɪk/ adj

pant
/pænt ||; pænt/verb [I] to breathe quickly, for example after running or because it is very hot 喘气；喘息 pant noun [C]

panther
/ˈpænθə(r) ||; ˈpænθɚ/noun [C] a large wild animal of the cat family with black fur 豹；黑豹 ☞picture at lion 见lion插图

panties
/ˈpæntiz ||; ˈpæntɪz/ (especially US 尤为美) =KNICKERS

pantomime
/ˈpæntəmaɪm ||; ˈpæntəˌmaɪm/noun[C,U]
1 (informal 非正式panto /ˈpæntəʊ ||; ˈpænto/) (Brit 英) a type of play for children, with music, dancing and jokes, that is usually performed at Christmas. Pantomimes are based on traditional children's stories (fairy stories). 童话剧（通常在圣诞节期间演出，取材于童话故事，有音乐、舞蹈和笑话）
2 (US 美) =MIME

pantry
/ˈpæntri ||; ˈpæntrɪ/noun [C] (plural pantries) a small room where food is kept 食品贮藏室 [SYN] larder 同义词为larder

*pants
/pænts ||; pænts/noun[pl]
1 (Brit 英) =UNDERPANTS
2 (US 美) =TROUSERS

pantyhose
/ˈpæntihəʊz ||; ˈpæntɪˌhoz/ (US 美) =TIGHTS

papa
/pəˈpɑ:; US ˈpɑ:pə ||; ˈpɑpə/noun [C] (especially US, old-fashioned 尤为美，旧) father 爸爸

paparazzi
/ˌpæpəˈrætsi ||; ˌpɑpəˈrɑtsi/noun [pl] photographers who follow famous people around in order to get pictures of them to sell to a newspaper or magazine 巴巴拉兹，狗仔队（专门追逐名人偷拍照片后卖给报刊的摄影人员）

papaya
/pəˈpaɪə ||; pəˈpaɪə/ (also pawpaw /ˈpɔ:pɔ: ||; ˈpɔpɔ/) noun [C] a large tropical fruit which is sweet and orange inside and has small black seeds 番木瓜；木瓜 ☞picture on page C3 见C3页插图

*paper
/ˈpeɪpə(r) ||; ˈpepɚ/noun
1 [U] a material made in thin sheets that you use for writing or drawing on, covering things, etc 纸；纸张: a piece/sheet of paper 一张纸 a paper handkerchief 纸巾 Types of paper include filter paper, tissue paper, toilet paper and writing paper. 纸的品种包括滤纸(filter paper)、手巾纸(tissue paper)、卫生纸(toilet paper)和书写纸(writing paper)。
2 [C] = NEWSPAPER(1) Where's today's paper? 今天的报纸在哪儿？ You buy a paper at a paper shop or newsagent's. 在书报店或报刊店(paper shop／newsagent's)可买到报纸。
3 papers [pl] important letters or pieces of paper that have information written on them 证件；文件: The document you want is somewhere in the pile of papers on her desk. 你想要的文件大概就在她书桌上那堆文件里面。
4 [C] the written questions or the written answers in an exam 试卷（包括试题卷和答卷）: The history exam is divided into three papers. 历史考试分为三份试卷。
5 [C] a piece of writing on a particular subject that is written for specialists 论文: At the conference, the Professor presented a paper on Sri Lankan poetry. 那位教授在会议上发表了一篇关于斯里兰卡诗歌的论文。
on paper
1 in writing 书面；用文字表达: I've had nothing on paper to say that I've been accepted. 我没有接到任何书面通知说我已被录取了。
2 as an idea, but not in a real situation; in theory 概念上；理论上: The scheme seems fine on paper, but would it work in practice? 这个方案理论上不错，但实际上是否可行呢？

paperback
/ˈpeɪpəbæk ||; ˈpepɚˌbæk/noun [C,U] a book that has a paper cover 平装本: The novel is available in paperback. 这本小说有平装本售卖。 ☞Look at hardback. 参看hardback。

ˈpaper boy
noun [C] a boy who takes newspapers to people's houses 送报男童；报童

ˈpaper clip
noun [C] a small piece of bent wire that is used for holding pieces of paper together 回形针；曲别针 ☞picture at stationery 见stationery插图

ˈpaper girl
noun [C] a girl who takes newspapers to people's houses 送报女童

paperweight
/ˈpeɪpəweɪt ||; ˈpepɚˌwet/noun [C] a small heavy object that you put on top of loose papers to keep them in place 镇纸；压纸物

paperwork
/ˈpeɪpəwɜ:k ||; ˈpepɚˌwɝk/noun[U]
1 the written work that is part of a job, such as writing letters and reports and filling in forms, etc 文书工作: I hate doing paperwork. 我讨厌做文书工作。
2 documents that need to be prepared, collected, etc in order for a piece of business to be completed （为完成一项业务所需准备、搜集的）文件: Some of the paperwork is missing from this file. 这档案里少了一些文件。

papier mâché
/ˌpæpieɪ ˈmæʃeɪ; US ˌpeɪpər məˈʃeɪ ||; ˌpepɚ məˈʃe/noun [U] paper mixed with wet glue, that becomes hard when it dries and is used to make decorations, etc 制型纸板

paprika
/ˈpæprɪkə; US pəˈpri:kə ||; pəˈprikə/noun [U] a red powder made from a sweet red pepper that you can use in cooking 辣椒粉

papyrus
/pəˈpaɪrəs ||; pəˈpaɪrəs/noun (plural papyri /pəˈpaɪri: ||; pəˈpaɪraɪ/)
1 [U] a tall plant with a thick STEM (= the main central part of the plant) that grows in water 纸莎草
2 [U] paper made from the STEMS of the papyrus plant, used in ancient Egypt for writing and drawing on 纸莎草纸
3 [C] a document or piece of paper made of papyrus 纸莎草纸的文件；一张纸莎草纸

par
/pɑ:(r) ||; pɑr/noun [U] (in golf) the standard number of times a player should hit the ball in order to complete a particular hole or series of holes （高尔夫球）标准击球杆数，标准杆 below par(informal 非正式) not as good or as well as usual 在一般水平以下；不佳 on a par with sb/sth of an equal level, standard, etc to sb/sth else 与…平起平坐；与…水平相同；程度或水平与…相同: Is a teacher's salary on a par with a doctor's? 教师的薪水跟医生的差不多吗？

par.
(also para.) abbr paragraph （文章的）段落，段

para-
/ˈpærə ||; ˈpærə/prefix (used in nouns and adjectives 用于构成名词及形容词)
1 beyond 超越；外: paranormal 超常
2 similar to but not official or not fully qualified 相似；接近；准相似；准: a paramedic 医务辅助人员 paramilitary 准军事

parable
/ˈpærəbl ||; ˈpærəbḷ/noun [C] a short story that teaches a lesson, especially one told by Jesus in the Bible （尤指圣经里的）寓言

parabola
/pəˈræbələ ||; pəˈræbələ/noun [C] a curve like the path of an object that is thrown through the air and falls back to earth 拋物线 ➔parabolic /ˌpærəˈbɒlɪk ||; ˌpærəˈbɑlɪk/ adj parabolic curves 拋物线

parachute
/ˈpærəʃu:t ||; ˈpærəˌʃut/noun [C] a piece of equipment that opens and lets the person fall to the ground slowly when he/she jumps from a plane 降落伞 parachute verb [I]

parade
/pəˈreɪd ||; pəˈred/noun [C] an occasion when a group of people stand or walk in a line so that people can look at them 游行；检阅: a military parade 阅兵仪式 a fashion parade 时装表演

paradise
/ˈpærədaɪs ||; ˈpærəˌdaɪs/noun
1 oftenParadise [U] the perfect place where some people think that good people go after they die 天堂；天国 [SYN] heaven 同义词为heaven
2 [C] a perfect place 乐土；乐园: This beach is a paradise for windsurfers. 这个海滩是帆板运动爱好者的乐园。

paradox
/ˈpærədɒks ||; ˈpærəˌdɑks/noun [C] a situation or statement with two or more parts that seem strange or impossible together 看似矛盾的情况；似是而非的说法；吊诡: It's a paradox that some countries produce too much food while in other countries people are starving. 有些国家生产太多食品，而另一些国家的人却在挨饿，真是矛盾。 ➔paradoxical /ˌpærəˈdɒksɪkl ||; ˌpærəˈdɑksɪkḷ/ adj ➔paradoxically /ˌpærəˈdɒksɪkli ||; ˌpærəˈdɑksɪklɪ/ adv

paraffin
/ˈpærəfɪn ||; ˈpærəfɪn/ (US 美 kerosene) noun [U] a type of oil that is burned to produce heat or light 煤油

paragliding
/pærəglaɪdɪŋ ||; ˈpærəˌglaɪdɪŋ/noun [U] a sport in which you wear sth similar to a parachute and jump from an airplane or a high place and are carried along by the wind before coming down to earth 滑翔伞运动: to go paragliding 去参加滑翔伞运动

*paragraph
/ˈpærəgrɑ:f; US -græf ||; ˈpærəˌgræf/noun [C] a part of a piece of writing that consists of one or more sentences. A paragraph always starts on a new line. （文章的）段落，段

parakeet
/ˈpærəki:t ||; ˈpærəˌkit/noun [C] a small bird usually with green feathers and a long tail that lives in hot countries 长尾小鹦鹉

paralegal
/ˌpærəˈli:gl ||; ˌpærəˈligḷ/noun [C] (US 美) a person who is trained to help a lawyer 律师助理

*parallel¹
/ˈpærəlel ||; ˈpærəˌlɛl/adj adv
1 parallel (to sth) (used about two lines, etc) with the same distance between them for all their length （指两条线等）平行: parallel lines 并行线 The railway runs parallel to the road. 该铁路与公路平行。 ☞picture at line 见line插图
2 similar and happening at the same time 类似并同时发生的: The two brothers followed parallel careers in different companies. 两兄弟在不同的公司从事类似的职业。
parallel²
/ˈpærəlel ||; ˈpærəˌlɛl/noun [C,U] a person, thing or situation that is similar to another one in a different situation, place or time 相似的人、事物或情况: The government's huge election victory is without parallel this century. 政府在选举中取得的巨大胜利在本世纪无与伦比。

parallelogram
/ˌpærəˈleləgræm ||; ˌpærəˈlɛləˌgræm/noun [C] (technical术语) a flat shape with four straight sides. The opposite sides are parallel and equal to each other. 平行四边形

paralyse
/ˈpærəlaɪz ||; ˈpærəˌlaɪz/ (US 美 paralyze) verb [T]
1 to make a person unable to move his/her body or a part of it 使瘫痪；使麻痹: Miriam is paralysed from the waist down. 米里亚姆下半身瘫痪。
2 to make sb/sth unable to work in a normal way 使不能正常工作或运作 ➔paralysis /pəˈræləsɪs ||; pəˈræləsɪs/ noun [U]: The disease can cause paralysis or even death. 这种疾病能导致瘫痪，甚至死亡。 There has been complete paralysis of the railway system. 铁路系统已经完全瘫痪。

paramedic
/ˌpærəˈmedɪk ||; ˌpærəˈmɛdɪk/noun [C] a person who has had special training in treating people who are hurt or ill, but who is not a doctor or nurse 医务辅助人员；护理人员

parameter
/pəˈræmɪtə(r) ||; pəˈræmətɚ/noun [C] [usu.pl] (formal 正式) something that decides or limits the way in which sth can be done 起决定或限定作用的因素；界限: to set/define the parameters 设定╱明确界限 We had to work within the parameters that had already been established. 我们必须在已经确立的范围内工作。

paramilitary
/ˌpærəˈmɪlətri; US -terɪ ||; ˌpærəˈmɪlɪˌtɛrɪ/adj organized in the same way as, but not belonging to, an official army 准军事的；半军队性质的: a paramilitary group 准军事团体

paramount
/ˈpærəmaʊnt ||; ˈpærəˌmaυnt/adj (formal 正式) most important 首要的: Safety is paramount in car design. 汽车设计首重安全。

paranoia
/ˌpærəˈnɔɪə ||; ˌpærəˈnɔɪə/noun[U]
1 a type of mental illness in which you wrongly believe that other people want to harm you 妄想症；偏执狂
2 (informal 非正式) a feeling of fear and suspicion of other people 多疑症；疑神疑鬼

paranoid
/ˈpærənɔɪd ||; ˈpærəˌnɔɪd/adj wrongly believing that other people are trying to harm you or are saying bad things about you 有妄想狂或倾向的；多疑的

paraphernalia
/ˌpærəfəˈneɪliə ||; ˌpærəfəˈnelɪə/noun [U] a large number of different objects that you need for a particular purpose （进行某活动所需的大量不同）器材，装备

paraphrase
/ˈpærəfreɪz ||; ˈpærəˌfrez/verb [T] to express sth again using different words so that it is easier to understand 释义；用较浅白的语词转述 paraphrase noun [C]

parascending
/pærəsendɪŋ ||; ˈpærəˌsɛndɪŋ/noun [U] a sport in which you wear a parachute and are pulled along behind a boat so that you rise up into the air ﹙汽船牵引的﹚伞翼滑翔运动

parasite
/ˈpærəsaɪt ||; ˈpærəˌsaɪt/noun [C] a plant or an animal that lives in or on another plant or animal and gets its food from it. Parasites sometimes cause disease. 寄生植物；寄生虫 ➔parasitic /ˌpærəˈsɪtɪk ||; ˌpærəˈsɪtɪk/ adj

parasol
/ˈpærəsɒl ||; ˈpærəˌsɔl/noun [C] an umbrella that you use to protect yourself from the sun 阳伞 ☞picture on page C8 见C8页插图

paratroops
/ˈpærətru:ps ||; ˈpærəˌtrups/noun [pl] soldiers who are trained to jump from planes using a PARACHUTE(= a piece of equipment that opens to help them fall slowly) 伞兵；空降兵

*parcel
/ˈpɑ:sl ||; ˈpɑrsḷ/ (US also 美亦作 package) noun [C] something that is covered in brown paper and sent to sb 包裹 ☞Look at the entries for pack, package and packet. 参看pack、package及packet。

parched
/pɑ:tʃt ||; pɑrtʃt/adj very hot and dry, or very thirsty 燥热的；焦干的；焦渴的: Can I have a drink? I'm parched! 可以给我一点喝的吗？我渴得要命！
*pardon²
/ˈpɑ:dn ||; ˈpɑrdṇ/noun [C,U] an official decision not to punish sb for a crime 赦免；原谅；饶恕 ☞ I beg your pardon is a formal way of saying ‘sorry’ Oh, I do beg your pardon. I had no idea this was your seat. It can also be used when you want to ask somebody to repeat what he/she has said because you did not understand. I beg your pardon用于正式场合，表示对不起：Oh, I do beg your pardon. I had no idea this was your seat.哦，请你原谅，我不知道这个座位是你的。听不到或听不明白而请对方重复所说的话时亦可用I beg your pardon。 pardon verb [T] pardon sb (for sth/doing sth)

pardon¹
/ˈpɑ:dn ||; ˈpɑrdṇ/ (also ˌpardon ˈme) exclamation
1 used for asking sb to repeat what he/she has just said because you did not hear or understand it （用于因听不到或听不明白而请对方重复刚才所说的话）请再说一遍
2 used by some people to mean sorry or excuse me （有些人也用于表示歉意）对不起

pare
/peə(r) ||; pɛr/verb[T]
1 pare sth (off/away) to remove the thin outer layer of sth 削或剥去…的皮: First, pare the rind from the lemon. 首先，你要将柠檬削皮。 She pared the apple. 她把苹果削了皮。
2 pare sth (back/down) to gradually reduce the size or amount of sth 逐步缩减或减少: The training budget has been pared back to a minimum. 培训预算已被削减到最低水平。 The workforce has been pared to the bone (= reduced to the lowest possible level). 职工人数已减至最低程度。
3 (especially Brit 尤为英) to cut away the edges of sth, especially your nails, in order to make them smooth 修去（边缘）

*parent
/ˈpeərənt ||; ˈpɛrənt/noun[C]
1 a person's mother or father 父亲；母亲
A single parent is a mother or father who is bringing up his/her child or children alone, without the other parent. A foster-parent is a person who looks after a child who is not legally his/her own. 单亲(single parent)家庭的父亲或母亲独自抚养子女。寄养父或寄养母(foster-parent)领养并照顾依法而言并非他们的孩子。
2 a company that owns smaller companies of the same type （有许多分公司的）母公司，总公司: a parent company 母公司

parentage
/ˈpeərəntɪdʒ ||; ˈpɛrəntɪdʒ/noun [U] (formal 正式) the origin of a person's parents and who they are 出身；门第: a young American of German parentage 德裔美国青年 Nothing is known of her parentage and background. 她的出身和背景都不清楚。

parental
/pəˈrentl ||; pəˈrɛntḷ/adj (only before a noun 只用于名词前) of a parent or parents 父亲的；母亲的；父母的: parental support/advice 父母的养育╱忠告

parentheses
/pəˈrenθəsi:z ||; pəˈrɛnθəˌsiz/ (especially US 尤为美) =BRACKET¹(1)

parenthesis
/pəˈrenθəsɪs/noun in parenthesis as an extra comment or piece of information 题外话；枝节内容

parenthood
/ˈpeərənthʊd ||; ˈpɛrəntˌhυd/noun [U] the state of being a parent 父母身分

ˌparent-ˈteacher association
=PTA

parish
/ˈpærɪʃ ||; ˈpærɪʃ/noun [C] an area or a district which has its own church; the people who live in this area （有自己教堂的）教区，堂区；教区居民: the parish church 教区教堂 ➔parishioner /pəˈrɪʃənə(r) ||; pəˈrɪʃənɚ/ noun [C]

ˌparish ˈcouncil
noun [C] [with.sop] a division of local government which looks after the interests of a very small area, especially a village 行政堂区委员会

parity
/ˈpærəti ||; ˈpærətɪ/noun[U]
1 (formal 正式)parity (with sb/sth);parity (between A and B) the state of being equal, especially the state of having equal pay or position 平等，相等（尤指工资、地位）: Prison officers are demanding pay parity with the police force. 狱警要求跟警察同工同酬。
2 (technical术语) (in finance) the fact of the units of money of two different countries being equal （经济）平价（指两国货币的汇率相等）: to achieve parity with the dollar 实现与美元平价

*park¹
/pɑ:k ||; pɑrk/noun[C]
1 an open area in a town, often with grass or trees, where people can go to walk, play, etc 公园: Let's go for a walk in the park. 我们去公园散步吧。
2 (in compounds 用于构成复合词) a large area of land that is used for a special purpose 作特定用途的大片地区: a national park 国家公园 a business park 商业园区 a theme park 主题乐园
*park²
/pɑ:k ||; pɑrk/verb [I,T] to leave the vehicle that you are driving somewhere for period a time 停放（车辆）；停车: You can't park in the centre of town. 市中心不准停车。 Somebody's parked their car in front of the exit. 有人把车停在出口处。

parka
/ˈpɑ:kə/noun [C] a warm jacket or coat with a part for covering your head (a hood) 连帽风雪大衣

parking
/ˈpɑ:kɪŋ ||; ˈpɑrkɪŋ/noun [U] the action of leaving a car, lorry, etc somewhere for a time 停放（车辆）；停车: The sign said ‘No Parking’. 告示牌上写着“不准停车”。 ☞A place where many cars can be parked and left is called a car park. A place where one car can be parked is called a parking space. 停车场叫做car park。停一辆车的车位叫做parking space。

ˈparking lot
(US 美) =CAR PARK

ˈparking meter
noun [C] a metal post that you put coins into to pay for parking a car in the space beside it for a period of time 停车计时收费器

ˈparking ticket
noun [C] a piece of paper that orders you to pay money (a fine) for parking your car where it is not allowed 违例停车罚款单

Parkinson's disease
/ˈpɑ:kɪnsnz dɪzi:z ||; ˈpɑrkɪnsṇz dɪˌziz/noun [U] a disease that gets worse over a period of time and causes the muscles to become weak and the arms and legs to shake 帕金森氏病；震颤性麻痹症

*parliament
/ˈpɑ:ləmənt ||; ˈpɑrləmənt/noun[C]
1 the group of people who are elected to make and change the laws of a country 议会；国会 When parliament is singular it can be used with either a singular or plural verb. 作单数时，parliament可与单数或复数动词连用。
2 Parliament [sing] the parliament of the United Kingdom 英国议会: a Member of Parliament (MP) 议会议员
The UK Parliament consists of the House of Lords, whose members have been appointed rather than elected, and the House of Commons, whose members have been elected by the people to represent areas of the country (called constituencies). 英国议会包括上议院(House of Lords)及下议院(House of Commons)。上议院由委任而是非选举产生的议员组成；下议院议员由民选产生，代表全国各选区(constituency)。
parliamentary
/ˌpɑ:ləˈmentri ||; ˌpɑrləˈmɛntrɪ/adj (only before a noun 只用于名词前) connected with parliament 议会的；国会的

parlour ( US 美 parlor)
/pɑ:lə(r) ||; ˈpɑrlɚ/noun[C]
1 (in compounds 用于构成复合词) a shop that provides a particular type of goods or services ﹙专营某种商品或业务的﹚店铺: an ice cream parlour 冰淇淋店 a beauty parlour 美容院
2 (old-fashioned 旧) a living room in a house 起居室；客厅

parody
/ˈpærədi ||; ˈpærədɪ/noun [C,U] (plural parodies) a piece of writing, speech or music that copies the style of sb/sth in a funny way （诙谐）模仿作品: a parody of a spy novel 一部模仿间谍小说的作品 parody verb [T] (present participle parodying third person singular present parodies;past tense past participle parodied)

parole
/pəˈrəʊl ||; pəˈrol/noun [U] permission that is given to a prisoner to leave prison early on the condition that he/she behaves well 假释（暂时释放刑期未满的犯人，条件为假释期间表现良好）: He's going to be released on parole. 他将得到假释。

parrot
/ˈpærət ||; ˈpærət/noun [C] a type of tropical bird with a curved beak and usually with very bright feathers. Parrots that are kept as pets can be trained to copy what people say. 鹦鹉

ˈparrot-fashion
adv without understanding the meaning of sth 鹦鹉学舌地；机械地: to learn sth parrot-fashion 机械式地学习

parsley
/ˈpɑ:sli ||; ˈpɑrslɪ/noun [U] a plant (herb) with very small leaves that are used for adding taste to or decorating food 欧芹，洋芫荽（一种草本植物，用于调味或装饰菜肴）

parsnip
/ˈpɑ:snɪp ||; ˈpɑrsnɪp/noun [C] a long thin white vegetable, that grows under the ground 欧洲防风根；欧洲萝卜；金菜萝卜 ☞picture on page C3 见C3页插图

*part¹
/pɑ:t ||; pɑrt/noun
1 [C,U] (a) part (of sth) one of the pieces, areas, periods, things, etc that together with others forms the whole of sth; some, but not all of sth 一部份；部份: Which part of Spain do you come from? 你从西班牙的哪个地区来？ The film is good in parts. 这部电影有几个片断不错。 spare partsfor a car 汽车备用零件 a part of the body 身体的部位 Part of the problem is lack of information. 问题之一是缺乏信息。 I enjoy being part of a team. 我喜欢成为队中的一份子。
2 [C] a role or character in a play, film, etc （戏剧、电影等的）角色: He played the part of Macbeth. 他演麦克佩斯的角色。 I had a small part in the school play. 我在学校话剧中扮演一个小角色。
3 parts [pl] a region or area 地区: Are you from these parts? 你是这些地区的人吗？
4 [C] a section of a book, television series, etc （书、电视系列节目等的）部，篇，集: You can see part two of this programme at the same time next week. 下周同一时间可以收看这个节目的第二集。
5 [C] an amount or quantity (of a liquid or substance) （液体或物质的）份，分量: Use one part cleaning fluid to ten parts water. 用一份清涤剂对十份水。
the best/better part of sth most of sth; more than half of sth, especially a period of time （某事物的）绝大部份，大部份（尤指时间）: They've lived here for the best part of forty years. 四十年来，他们大部份时间都住在这里。 for the most part usually or mostly 通常；多半 for my, his, their, etc part speaking for myself, etc; personally 就我自己╱他╱他们…来说 have/play a part (in sth) to be involved in sth 参与；参加 in part not completely 不完全；部份；某种程度上: The accident was, in part, the fault of the driver. 这起事故在某种程度上是司机的过失。 on the part of sb/on sb's part made, done or felt by sb 某人所做；就某人而言: There is concern on the part of the teachers that class sizes will increase. 教师方面都担心班级的人数会增加。 I'm sorry. It was a mistake on my part. 我很抱歉，那是我的错。 take part (in sth) to join with other people in an activity 参加，参与（活动）: Everybody took part in the discussion. 人人都参与讨论。
part²
/pɑ:t ||; pɑrt/verb
1 [I,T] (formal 正式)part (sb) (from sb) to leave or go away from sb; to separate people or things 离开（某人）；使分开: We exchanged telephone numbers when we parted. 我们分手时交换了电话号码。 He hates being parted from his children for long. 他不愿跟子女分开太久。
2 [I,T] to move apart; to make things or people move apart （使）分开 · Her lips were slightly parted. 她的嘴唇微微张开。
3 [T] to separate the hair on the head with a comb so as to make a clear line 把（头发）向两边分开梳理: She parts her hair in the middle. 她把头发中分。 ☞ Look at parting. 参看parting。
part company (with sb/sth) to go different ways or to separate after being together （与…）分手，分道扬镳 part with sth to give or sell sth to sb 把…送人；把…卖掉: When we went to live in Italy, we had to part with our horses. 我们到意大利居住前，只好把马匹卖掉。
part³
/pɑ:t ||; pɑrt/adv not completely one thing and not completely another 部份: She's part Russian and part Chinese. 她有俄罗斯血统，也有中国血统。

ˌpart exˈchange
noun [U] a way of buying sth, such as a car, in which you give your old one as some of the payment for a more expensive one 部份抵价交易法，折价贴换（一种购物方式，比如买汽车，可将旧汽车抵作购买较高价的新汽车的部份款项）

partial
/ˈpɑ:ʃl ||; ˈpɑrʃəl/adj
1 not complete 部份的；不完全的: The project was only a partial success. 这个项目只是部份成功而已。
2 (old-fashioned 旧)partial to sb/sth liking sth very much 极爱的；偏爱的: He's very partial to ice cream. 他特别爱吃冰淇淋。 ➔partially adv

partiality
/ˌpɑ:ʃiˈæləti ||; ˌpɑrʃɪˈælətɪ/noun [U] (formal 正式) the unfair support of one person, team, etc above another 偏袒；偏心: The referee was accused of partiality towards the home team. 裁判被指责偏袒主队。 [OPP] impartiality 反义词为impartiality ☞Look at impartial. 参看impartial。

participant
/pɑ:ˈtɪsɪpənt ||; pɑrˈtɪsəpənt/noun [C] a person who takes part in sth 参加者；参与者

participate
/pɑ:ˈtɪsɪpeɪt ||; pɑrˈtɪsəˌpet/verb [I] participate (in sth) to take part or become involved in sth 参加；参与: Students are encouraged to participate in sporting activities. 校方鼓励学生参与体育活动。 ➔participation /pɑ:ˌtɪsɪˈpeɪʃn ||; pɑrˌtɪsəˈpeʃən/ noun [U]

participle
/ˈpɑ:tɪsɪpl;ˌpɑ:ˈtɪsipl||; ˈpɑrtəˌsɪpḷ/noun [C] (grammar语法) a word that is formed from a verb and that ends in -ing (present participle) or -ed, -en, etc (past participle). Participles are used to form tenses of the verb, or as adjectives. 分词（由动词变化而成，以-ing结尾者为现在分词；以-ed、-en等结尾者为过去分词。分词或用于表示时态，或作形容词）: ‘Hurrying’ and ‘hurried’ are the present and past participles of ‘hurry’. hurrying及hurried分别是hurry的现在分词和过去分词。

particle
/ˈpɑ:tɪkl ||; ˈpɑrtɪkḷ/noun[C]
1 a very small piece; a bit 微粒；一点儿: dust particles 尘埃 ☞Look at alpha particle. 参看alpha particle。
2 (grammar语法) a small word that is not as important as a noun, verb or adjective 小品词（如介词、副词等）；介副词: In the phrasal verb ‘break down’, ‘down’ is an adverbial particle. 在短语动词break down中，down是副词小品词。

*particular
/pəˈtɪkjələ(r) ||; pəˈtɪkjəlɚ/adj
1 (only before a noun 只用于名词前) used to emphasize that you are talking about one person, thing, time, etc and not about others 特定的: Is there any particular dish you enjoy making? 有没有哪种特定的菜肴你喜欢做？
2 (only before a noun 只用于名词前) greater than usual; special 特别的；特殊的；分外的: This article is of particular interest to me. 我对这篇文章分外有兴趣。
3 connected with one person or thing and not with others 与某人或某物有关的: Everybody has their own particular problems. 人人都有自己的问题。
4 particular (about/over sth) (not before a noun 不用于名词前) difficult to please 难以取悦的；挑剔的: Some people are extremely particular about what they eat. 有些人对吃的东西极其挑剔。 ☞ Look at fussy. 参看fussy。
in particular especially 尤其；特别: Is there anything in particular you'd like to do this weekend? 这个周末你有没有什么特别想做的事呢？

*particularly
/pəˈtɪkjələli ||; pɚˈtɪkjəlɚlɪ/adv especially; more than usual or more than others 尤其；特别: I'm particularly interested in Indian history. 我对印度历史特别感兴趣。 The match was excellent, particularly the second half. 这场比赛很精彩，尤其是下半场。

particulars
/pəˈtɪkjələz ||; pəˈtɪkjəlɚz/noun [pl] (formal 正式) facts or details about sb/sth 细节；细目；详情: The police took down all the particulars about the missing child. 警方记下那名失踪小孩的所有详细资料。

parting
/ˈpɑ:tɪŋ ||; ˈpɑrtɪŋ/noun
1 [C,U] saying goodbye to, or being separated from, another person (usually for quite a long time) 告别，离别，分开，分离（通常指长时间的）
2 [C] the line in a person's hair where it is divided in two with a comb 头发的分界线；分缝: a side/centre parting 侧分；中分 ☞Look at part. 参看part。 ☞picture at hair 见hair插图

partisan¹
/ˌpɑ:tɪˈzæn; US ˈpɑ:tɪzæn ||; ˈpɑrtəzṇ/adj showing too much support for one person, group or idea, especially without considering it carefully 有派性的；偏袒的: Most newspapers are politically partisan. 大多数报纸在政治上偏袒一方。 ➔partisanship noun [U]
partisan²
/ˌpɑ:tɪˈzæn; US ˈpɑ:tɪzæn ||; ˈpɑrtəzṇ/noun[C]
1 a person who strongly supports a particular leader, group or idea 热情的支持者
2 a member of an armed group that is fighting secretly against enemy soldiers who have taken control of its country 游击队员

partition
/pɑ:ˈtɪʃn ||; pɑrˈtɪʃən/noun
1 [C] something that divides a room, office etc into two or more parts, especially a thin or temporary wall （把房间、办公室等隔开的）隔板
2 [U] the division of a country into two or more countries （国家的）分割，划分 partition verb [T] to partition a country/room 分割一个国家；分隔一个房间

partly
/ˈpɑ:tli ||; ˈpɑrtlɪ/adv not completely 某种程度上；不完全；部份: She was only partly responsible for the mistake. 这次失误她只该负部份责任。

*partner
/ˈpɑ:tnə(r) ||; ˈpɑrtnɚ/noun[C]
1 the person that you are married to or live with as if you are married 配偶；同居伴侣
2 one of the people who owns a business 合伙人；股东: business partners 生意合伙人
3 a person that you are doing an activity with as a team, for example dancing or playing a game 舞伴；（游戏的）搭档，拍档
4 a country or an organization that has an agreement with another 伙伴（国家之间或机构之间有协议的） partner verb · Hales partnered his brother in the doubles, and they won the gold medal. 黑尔斯在双打中与他弟弟搭档，结果他们赢得金牌。

partnership
/ˈpɑ:tnəʃɪp ||; ˈpɑrtnɚˌʃɪp/noun
1 [U] the state of being a partner in business 合伙；合股: Simona went into partnership with her sister and opened a shop in Rome. 西蒙娜与她妹妹合伙在罗马开店。
2 [C] a relationship between two people, organizations, etc （两个人、组织等的）伙伴关系: Marriage is a partnership for life. 婚姻是终身的关系。
3 [C] a business owned by two or more people 合伙企业

ˌpart of ˈspeech
noun [C] (grammar语法) one of the groups that words are divided into, for example noun, verb, adjective, etc 词类（如名词、动词、形容词等）

partridge
/ˈpɑ:trɪdʒ ||; ˈpɑrtrɪdʒ/noun [C] a brown bird with a round body and a short tail, that people hunt for sport or food 山鹑

ˌpart-ˈtime
adj adv for only a part of the working day or week 兼职（的）；半职（的）；部份时间工作（的）: She's got a part-time job. 她有一份兼职。 ☞ Look at full-time. 参看full-time。

ˈpart-way
adv some of the way 半途；部份地: Ann was already part-way through her speech when Ed came in. 埃德到达的时候安的讲演已经进行一段时间了。

*party
/ˈpɑ:ti ||; ˈpɑrtɪ/noun [C] (plural parties)
1 a social occasion to which people are invited in order to eat, drink and enjoy themselves 聚会；宴会；派对: When we've moved into our new house we're going to have a party. 我们搬进新房子时会办个派对。 a birthday/dinner party 生日派对；餐会
2 (also Party) a group of people who have the same political aims and ideas and who are trying to win elections to parliament, etc 政党
The two main political parties in Great Britain are the Labour Party (left-wing) and the Conservative (or Tory) Party (right-wing). There is also a centre party called the Liberal Democrats and some other smaller parties. In the United States the main political parties are the Republicans and the Democrats. 英国的两大政党是工党(Labour Party)（左翼）及保守党(Conservative／Tory Party)（右翼）。还有一个中间派的自由民主党(Liberal Democrats)及其他一些较小的政党。美国的主要政党是共和党(Republicans)及民主党(Democrats)。
3 (often in compounds 常用于构成复合词) a group of people who are working, travelling, etc together （一同工作、旅游等的）一群人，一队人，一行人: a party of tourists 旅游团
4 (formal 正式) one of the people or groups of people involved in a legal case （诉讼的）一方: the guilty/innocent party 有罪╱无罪的一方 ☞ Look at third party. 参看third party。

ˈparty animal
noun [C] (slang 俚语) a person who goes to a lot of parties and often drinks a lot of alcohol and behaves in a loud, excited way 热中于参加聚会的人

party-pooper
/pɑ:ti pu:pə(r) ||; ˈpɑrtɪ ˌpupɚ/noun [C] (informal 非正式) a person who spoils the fun for other people 令众人扫兴者

*pass¹
/pɑ:s; US pæs ||; pæs/verb
1 [I,T] to move past or to the other side of sb/sth 通过；经过: The street was crowded and the two buses couldn't pass. 街道很挤，那两辆公共汽车无法驶过。 I passed him in the street but he didn't say hello. 我在街上从他身边走过，但他没有跟我打招呼。 The number of children at the school has passed 500. 那所学校的学童数目已超过500人。
The past tense of pass is passed not past which is an adjective or a preposition The summer months passed slowly. The past week was very hot. Our house is just past the church. pass的过去时为passed，不是past；past是形容词或介词：The summer months passed slowly.夏季慢慢过去了。·The past week was very hot.过去这星期很热。·Our house is just past the church.我们的房子过了教堂便是。
2 [I,T] pass (sth) along, down, through, etc (sth) to go or move, or make sth move, in the direction mentioned （沿某方向）走，移动；使（沿某方向）移动: A plane passed overhead. 一架飞机从上空飞过。 We'll have to pass the wire through the window. 我们得把电线从窗子穿过去。
3 [T] pass sth (to sb) to give sth to sb 递；传递: Could you pass (me) the salt, please? 请把盐递给我好吗？
4 [I,T] pass (sth) (to sb) (in some sports) to kick, hit or throw the ball to sb on your own team （某些体育运动）传球（给队友）
5 [I] (used about time) to go by （指时间）过去: At least a year has passed since I last saw them. 自从我上次见过他们至今，最少已过了一年。 It was a long journey but the time passed very quickly. 这是一次漫长的旅行，但时间过得很快。
6 [T] to spend time, especially when you are bored or waiting for sth 打发时间，消磨时间（尤指在觉得烦闷或等候的时候）: I'll have to think of something to do to pass the time in hospital. 我得找些事情做，以消磨在医院的时间。
7 [I,T] to achieve the necessary standard in an exam, test, etc （考试、测验等）及格: Good luck in the exam! I'm sure you'll pass. 祝你考试成功！我相信你一定会过关的。 [OPP] fail 反义词为fail
8 [T] to test sb/sth and say that he/she/it is good enough 评定…为及格；使过关或及格: The examiner passed most of the students. 主考人评定大部份学生及格。
9 [T] to officially approve a law, etc by voting 以表决正式通过（法案等）: One of the functions of Parliament is to pass new laws. 英国议会的功能之一就是通过新的法律。
10 [T] pass sth (on sb/sth) to give an opinion, a judgement, etc 提出意见；对…加以评判；宣判: The judge passed sentence on the young man (= said what his punishment would be). 法官对这个年轻人作出判决。
11 [I] to be allowed or accepted 获得许可；获接受: I didn't like what they were saying but I let it pass. 我不喜欢他们说的话，但我没有加以评论。
pass the buck (to sb) to make sb else responsible for a difficult situation 把责任推诿（给某人）；归咎（于某人） pass water(formal 正式) to get rid of waste liquid from your body 小便 pass away used as a polite way of saying ‘die’ 去世 pass by (sb/sth) to go past 经过；路过: I pass by your house on the way to work. 我上班途中经过你家。 pass sth down to give or teach sth to people who will live after you have died 把…留传 pass for sb/sth to be accepted as sb/sth that he/she/it is not 被误作: His mother looks so young she'd pass for his sister. 他的母亲看上去真年轻，人家还会以为她是他姐姐。 pass sb/sth off (as sb/sth) to say that a person or a thing is sth that he/she/it is not 将…冒充；假冒: He tried to pass the work off as his own. 他想把该作品冒充为自己的作品。 pass sth on (to sb) to give sth to sb else, especially after you have been given it or used it yourself 把…传给（另一人）（尤其指自己收到或用过后）: Could you pass the message on to Mr Roberts? 你可以把这个信息告知罗伯茨先生吗？ pass out to become unconscious 失去知觉；昏倒 [SYN] faint 同义词为faint [OPP] come round/to 反义词为come round／to
*pass²
/pɑ:s; US pæs ||; pæs/noun[C]
1 a successful result in an exam 考试及格；考试过关: The pass mark is 50%. 50%为及格分数。 Grades A, B and C are passes. A、B、C级表示及格。 [OPP] fail 反义词为fail
2 an official piece of paper that gives you permission to enter or leave a building, travel on a bus or train, etc 通行证；乘车证: Show your student pass when you buy a ticket. 买票时要出示学生证。
3 the act of kicking, hitting or throwing the ball to sb on your own team in some sports 传球
4 a road or way over or through mountains 山路；隘口；山口: a mountain pass 山路

passable
/ˈpɑ:səbl; US ˈpæs- ||; ˈpæsəbḷ/adj
1 good enough but not very good 过得去的；尚可的: My French is not brilliant but it's passable. 我的法语不十分出色，但还过得去。
2 (not before a noun 不用于名词前) (used about roads, rivers, etc) possible to use or cross; not blocked （指道路、河流等）可通行，可通车，可通航 [OPP] impassable 反义词为impassable

*passage
/ˈpæsɪdʒ ||; ˈpæsɪdʒ/noun
1 [C] (also passageway) a long, narrow way with walls on either side that connects one place with another 通道；走廊: a secret underground passage 一条秘密地下通道
2 [C] a tube in your body which air, liquid, etc can pass through （人体内的）道: the nasal passages 鼻腔
3 [C] a short part of a book, a speech or a piece of music （书、演说、乐曲的）段，节: The students were given a passage from the novel to study. 老师从小说中抽出一段给学生研读。
4 [sing] the process of passing 通过；经过；消逝；过去: His painful memories faded with the passage of time. 随着时间的流逝，他痛苦的回忆也渐渐消失了。

*passenger
/ˈpæsɪndʒə(r) ||; ˈpæsṇdʒɚ/noun [C] a person who is travelling in a car, bus, train, plane, etc but who is not driving it or working on it 乘客

ˌpasser-ˈby
noun [C] (plural passers-by) a person who is walking past sb/sth 过路人；路人

passing¹
/ˈpɑ:sɪŋ; US ˈpæs- ||; ˈpæsɪŋ/adj (only before a noun 只用于名词前)
1 lasting for only a short time; brief 短暂的；片刻的: a passing phase/thought/interest 短暂的时期；片刻的想法；一时的兴趣
2 going past 经过的: I stopped a passing car and asked for help. 我拦下一辆路过的汽车求助。
passing²
/ˈpɑ:sɪŋ ||; ˈpæsɪŋ/noun [U] the process of going by 经过；过去；流逝: the passing of time 时间的流逝 in passing done or said quickly, while you are thinking or talking about sth else 顺便；附带；粗略地: He mentioned the house in passing but he didn't give any details. 他顺带提到那幢房子，但没有详述。

passion
/ˈpæʃn ||; ˈpæʃən/noun
1 [C,U] (a) very strong feeling, especially of love, hate or anger 强烈的情感，激情（尤指爱、恨或愤怒）: He was a violent man, controlled by his passions. 他性情暴烈，感情用事。
2 [sing] a passion (for sb) very strong sexual love or attraction 强烈的情欲或吸引力: He longed to tell Sashi of his passion for her. 他渴望告诉萨希他对她的爱慕。
3 [sing] a passion for sth a very strong liking for or interest in sth 酷爱；热爱: He has a passion for history. 他酷爱历史。

passionate
/ˈpæʃənət ||; ˈpæʃənɪt/adj
1 showing or caused by very strong feelings 慷慨激昂的: The President gave a passionate speech about crime. 总统就犯罪问题发表了慷慨激昂的演说。
2 showing or feeling very strong love or sexual attraction 热恋的；情欲强烈的: a passionate kiss 热吻 ➔passionately adv He believes passionately in democracy. 他热诚信奉民主。

passive
/ˈpæsɪv ||; ˈpæsɪv/adj
1 showing no reaction, feeling or interest; not active 冷漠的；不关心的；被动的: Some people prefer to play a passive role in meetings. 有些人在会议上宁可表现得消极被动。
2 used about the form of a verb or a sentence when the subject of the sentence is affected by the action of the verb （用于动词形式或句子）被动语态的，被动式的: In the sentence ‘He was bitten by a dog’, the verb is passive. 在He was bitten by a dog这句中，动词是被动式。 You can also say: ‘The verb is in the passive’. 表示动词是被动式，可说The verb is in the passive。 ☞Look at active. 参看active。 ➔passively adv

passive smoking ( also ˌsecondary ˈsmoking)
noun [U] the act of breathing in smoke from other people's cigarettes 被动吸烟；吸二手烟

Passover
/ˈpɑ:səʊvə(r) ||; ˈpæsˌovɚ/noun [sing] the most important Jewish festival, which takes place in spring and lasts seven or eight days 逾越节（犹太人最重要的节日，在每年春天，持续七至八天）

*passport
/ˈpɑ:spɔ:t; US ˈpæs- ||; ˈpæsˌpɔrt/noun[C]
1 an official document that identifies you as a citizen of a particular country and that you have to show when you enter or leave a country 护照
You apply for or renew your passport at the passport office. This office issues new passports. 在护照办事处(passport office)可以申请(apply for)或更换(renew)护照。该办事处负责发放(issue)新护照。
2 a passport to sth a thing that makes it possible to achieve sth …的手段、门路或途径: a passport to success 达到成功的手段

password
/ˈpɑ:swɜ:d; US ˈpæs- ||; ˈpæsˌwɝd/noun[C]
1 a secret word or phrase that you need to know in order to be allowed into a place （进入某处的）口令，密码
2 a series of letters or numbers that you must type into a computer or computer system in order to be able to use it （使用计算机时需要输入的）密码: Please enter your password. 请输入密码。

*past¹
/pɑ:st; US pæst ||; pæst/adj
1 already gone; belonging to a time before the present 已经过去的；过去的；以前的: in past centuries/times 过去的世纪╱时代 I'd rather forget some of my past mistakes. 我宁愿忘记自己过去的一些错误。
2 (only before a noun 只用于名词前) just finished; last 刚结束的；刚过去的: He's had to work very hard during the past year. 他在过去一年里不得不辛勤工作。
*past²
/pɑ:st; US pæst ||; pæst/prep adv
1 (used when telling the time) after; later than （用于说明时间）晚于，过: It's ten (minutes) past three. 现在是三点十分。 It was past midnight when we got home. 我们到家的时候已过半夜。
2 from one side to the other of sb/sth; further than or on the other side of sb/sth 从旁边或前面…经过；到另一边: He walked straight past me. 他从我面前径自走了过去。 She looked right past me without realizing who I was. 她的目光就从我身上扫过，没有发觉我是谁。
3 above or further than a certain point, limit or age 超过（某一点、限度或年龄）: Unemployment is now past the 2 million mark. 现在失业人数已经突破200万大关。 I'm so tired that I'm past caring (= I don't care any more) what we eat. 我累得没有心思理会我们要吃什么。
not put it past sb (to do sth) (used with would 与would连用) to think sb is capable of doing sth bad 认为某人很可能会做坏事: I wouldn't put it past him to do a thing like that. 我认为他很可能干出那种事。 past it(informal 非正式) too old 年纪太大；已经不行了
*past³
/pɑ:st ||; pæst/noun
1 the past [sing] the time that has gone by; the things that happened before now 过去；过去发生的事；往事: in the recent/distant past 在不久以前；在很久以前 The art of writing letters seems to be a thing of the past. 写信艺术似乎已经成为往事了。
2 [C] a person's life and career before now （一个人的）过去: We know nothing about his past. 我们对他的过去一无所知。
3 the past [sing] =THE PAST TENSE

pasta
/ˈpæstə; US ˈpɑ:stə ||; ˈpɑstə/noun [U] an Italian food made from flour, eggs and water, formed into different shapes, cooked, and usually served with a sauce 意大利面食

paste¹
/peɪst ||; pest/noun
1 [C,U] a soft, wet mixture, usually made of a powder and a liquid and sometimes used for sticking things 糊状物；浆糊: wallpaper paste 糊墙纸用的浆糊 Mix the flour and milk into a paste. 将面粉和牛奶混成糊状。
2 [U] (usually used in compound nouns 通常用于构成复合名词) a soft mixture of food that you can spread onto bread, etc （涂面包等的）酱: fish/chicken paste 鱼肉酱；鸡肉酱
paste²
/peɪst ||; pest/verb[T]
1 to stick sth to sth else using paste or a similar substance(glue) （用浆糊或胶水）黏，贴，糊: He pasted the picture into his book. 他把图片贴在书上。
2 (computing计算机技术) to copy or move text into a document from somewhere else （计算机）黏贴，贴上: This function allows you to cut and paste text. 有了这个功能，你就可以剪贴文字。

pastel
/ˈpæstl; US pæˈstel ||; pæsˈtɛl/adj (used about colours) pale; not strong （指颜色）淡的，柔和的

pasteurized
/ˈpɑ:stʃəraɪzd; US ˈpæs- ||; ˈpæstʃərˌaɪzd/ (also -ised) adj (used about milk or cream) free from bacteria because it has been heated and then cooled （指牛奶或奶油）已加热杀菌的

pastiche
/pæˈsti:ʃ ||; pæsˈtiʃ/noun (written 书面语)
1 [C] a work of art, piece of writing, etc that is created by deliberately copying the style of sb/sth else （文学、艺术等的）模仿作品: a pastiche of the classic detective story 经典侦探小说的模仿作品
2 [C] a work of art, etc that consists of a variety of different styles 混成的艺术作品
3 [U] the art of creating a pastiche 创作模仿作品的艺术

pastime
/ˈpɑ:staɪm; US ˈpæs- ||; ˈpæsˌtaɪm/noun [C] something that you enjoy doing when you are not working 消遣；娱乐 [SYN] hobby 同义词为hobby

pastoral
/ˈpɑ:stərəl; US ˈpæs- ||; ˈpæstərəl/adj
1 (connected with the work of a priest or a teacher) giving help and advice on personal matters rather than on matters of religion or education （与牧师或教师的工作有关）对个人（而非宗教或学校教育上的）问题提供协助与指点的
2 connected with pleasant country life 田园生活的；乡村生活的

ˌpast parˈticiple
→PARTICIPLE

pastrami
/pæˈstrɑ:mi ||; pəˈstrɑmɪ/noun [U] spicy smoked beef that is usually eaten cold in thin slices 五香熏牛肉

pastry
/ˈpeɪstri ||; ˈpestrɪ/noun (plural pastries)
1 [U] a mixture of flour, fat and water that is rolled out flat and cooked as a base or covering for pies, etc （用面粉、油及水混合而成的）油酥面团
2 [C] a small cake made with pastry 用油酥面团制成的糕点；酥皮糕点；酥

pasture
/ˈpɑ:stʃə(r); US ˈpæs- ||; ˈpæstʃɚ/noun [C,U] a field or land covered with grass, where cows, etc can feed 牧场

pasty
/ˈpæsti ||; ˈpæstɪ/noun [C] (plural pasties) (Brit 英) a small pie containing meat and/or vegetables 肉馅饼；菜馅饼；菜肉馅饼

pat¹
/pæt ||; pæt/verb [T] (patting;patted) to touch sb/sth gently with a flat hand, especially as a sign of friendship, care, etc （用手掌）轻拍（尤指表示友好、关心等）
pat²
/pæt ||; pæt/noun [C] a gentle friendly touch with a flat hand （用手掌）轻拍: He gave her knee an affectionate pat. 他亲昵地拍了拍她的膝盖。 a pat on the back (for sth/doing sth) approval for sth good that a person has done 赞同；赞扬: She deserves a pat on the back for all her hard work. 她的辛勤值得赞扬。
pat³
/pæt ||; pæt/adj adv (only before a noun 只用在名词前) (used about an answer, comment, etc) said in a quick or simple way that does not sound natural or realistic （指回答、评论等）牵强的

patch¹
/pætʃ ||; pætʃ/noun[C]
1 a patch (of sth) a part of a surface that is different in some way from the area around it （与周围表面不同的）一块: Drive carefully. There are patches of ice on the roads. 小心驾驶。路上有几处结着冰。 a bald patch 头上秃顶的一块
2 a piece of material that you use to cover a hole in clothes, etc 补钉；补丁: I sewed patches on the knees of my jeans. 我在牛仔裤的膝部打了几个补丁。
3 a small piece of material that you wear over one eye, usually because the eye is damaged 眼罩
4 a small piece of land, especially for growing vegetables or fruit 一小块地（尤指用来种蔬果的）: a vegetable patch 一块菜地
go through a bad patch (especially Brit 尤为英) (informal 非正式) to experience a difficult or unhappy period of time 经历一段艰难或不快乐的时间 not a patch on sb/sth (especially Brit 尤为英) (informal 非正式) not nearly as good as sb/sth 比不上；远不如: Her new book isn't a patch on her others. 她的新书不如她其余的作品好。
patch²
/pætʃ ||; pætʃ/verb [T] to cover a hole in clothes, etc with a piece of material in order to repair it 打补丁；补缀: patched jeans 补过的牛仔裤 patch sth up
1 to repair sth, especially in a temporary way by adding a new piece of material 修补
2 to stop arguing with sb and to be friends again 和解: Have you tried to patch things up with her? 你有没有想要跟她和解？

patchwork
/ˈpætʃwɜ:k ||; ˈpætʃˌwɝk/noun [U] a type of sewing in which small pieces of cloth of different colours and patterns are sewn together 拼缝，百衲（用不同颜色和花纹的布块拼凑起来）

patchy
/ˈpætʃi ||; ˈpætʃɪ/adj
1 existing or happening in some places but not others 散落零碎的；局部的: patchy fog/clouds/rain 部份地区出现的雾╱云╱雨
2 not complete; good in some parts but not in others 不一致的；不完整的；零碎的；一鳞半爪的: My knowledge of German is rather patchy. 我对德语一知半解。

patella
/pəˈtelə ||; pəˈtɛlə/ (technical术语)=KNEECAP

patent¹
/ˈpeɪtnt; US ˈpætnt ||; ˈpætṇt/adj (formal 正式) clear; obvious 清楚的；明显的: a patent lie 明显的谎言 ➔patently adv
patent²
/ˈpætnt;ˈpeɪtnt; US ˈpætnt ||; ˈpætṇt/noun [C,U] the official right to be the only person to make, use or sell a product or an invention; the document that shows this is your right 专利权；专利证书 patent verb [T]

ˌpatent ˈleather
noun [U] a type of leather with a hard, shiny surface, used especially for making shoes and bags 漆皮

paternal
/pəˈtɜ:nl ||; pəˈtɝnḷ/adj (only before a noun 只用于名词前)
1 behaving as a father would behave; connected with being a father 父亲般的；与父亲有关的
2 related through the father's side of the family 父系的: my paternal grandparents 我的祖父母 ☞ Look at maternal. 参看maternal。

paternalism
/pəˈtɜ:nəlɪzəm ||; pəˈtɝnḷˌɪzəm/noun [U] (technical术语) the system in which a government or an employer protects the people who are governed or employed by providing them with what they need, but does not give them any responsibility or freedom of choice 家长式管理制度 ➔paternalistic /pəˌtɜ:nəˈlɪstɪk ||; pəˌtɝnḷˈɪstɪk/(also paternalist) adj a paternalistic employer/state 家长式雇主；家长式统治的国家

paternity
/pəˈtɜ:nəti ||; pəˈtɝnətɪ/noun [U] the fact of being the father of a child 父亲的身分: paternity leave (= time that the father of a new baby is allowed to have away from work) 父亲假，陪产假（父亲在孩子刚出生时享有的假期） ☞Look at maternity. 参看maternity。

*path
/pɑ:θ; US pæθ ||; pæθ/noun[C]
1 a way across a piece of land that is made by or used by people walking 小路；小径；步道: the garden path 花园小径 Pathway is similar in meaning There was a narrow pathway leading down the cliff.Look also at footpath. pathway与path的意义相近：There was a narrow pathway leading down the cliff.有一条狭窄的小径顺悬崖而下。另参看footpath。
2 the line along which sb/sth moves; the space in front of sb/sth as he/she/it moves 路线；路径: He threw himself into the path of an oncoming vehicle. 他突然扑倒在一辆驶来的汽车前面。 ☞Look at flight path. 参看flight path。 ☞picture at diffract 见diffract插图

pathetic
/pəˈθetɪk ||; pəˈθɛtɪk/adj
1 causing you to feel pity or sadness 引起怜悯的；可怜的；可悲的: the pathetic cries of the hungry children 饥饿儿童可怜的哭声
2 (informal 非正式) very bad, weak or useless 差劲的；软弱的；无用的: What a pathetic performance! The team deserved to lose. 多么差劲的表现！这支球队输得活该。 ➔pathetically /-kli ||; -klɪ/ adv

paˌthetic ˈfallacy
noun [U] [sing] (technical术语) (used in art and literature) the act of describing animals and things as having human feelings （指文学艺术）感情的误置（指赋予动物及无生命事物以人的感情）

patho-
/ˈpæθəʊ ||; ˈpæθo/prefix (used in nouns, adjectives and adverbs 用于构成名词、形容词及副词) connected with disease 与疾病有关: pathology 病理学

pathological
/ˌpæθəˈlɒdʒɪkl ||; ˌpæθəˈlɑdʒɪkḷ/adj
1 caused by feelings that you cannot control; not reasonable or sensible 病态的；由不能控制的感情引致的；不合理的: He's a pathological liar (= he cannot stop lying). 他是个病态说谎者。 pathological fear/hatred/violence 病态的恐惧╱仇恨╱暴力
2 caused by or connected with disease or illness 由疾病引致的；与疾病有关的: pathological depression 由疾病引起的消沉
3 (medical医学) connected with pathology 病理学的 ➔pathologically /-kli ||; -klɪ/ adv

pathologist
/pəˈθɒlədʒɪst ||; pəˈθɑlədʒɪst/noun [C] a doctor who is an expert in pathology, and examines dead bodies to find out why a person has died 病理学家（研究死因的医学专家）

pathology
/pəˈθɒlədʒi ||; pəˈθɑlədʒɪ/noun [U] (medical医学) the scientific study of diseases of the body 病理学

pathos
/ˈpeɪθɒs ||; ˈpeθɑs/noun [U] (in literature 文学) the power of a performance, description, etc to produce feelings of sadness or pity （表演、描述等激起的）悲伤或怜悯的感染力，伤感力

*patience
/ˈpeɪʃns ||; ˈpeʃəns/noun[U]
1 patience (with sb/sth) the quality of being able to stay calm and not get angry, especially when there is a difficulty or you have to wait a long time 忍耐；耐心；耐性: I've got no patience with people who don't even try. 我对那些试都不肯试一下的人没有耐性。 to lose patiencewith sb 对某人失去耐心 [OPP] impatience 反义词为impatience
2 (US 美 solitaire) a card game for only one player 单人纸牌游戏；通关（一人独玩的纸牌戏）

*patient¹
/ˈpeɪʃnt ||; ˈpeʃənt/adj patient (with sb/sth) able to stay calm and not get angry, especially when there is a difficulty or you have to wait a long time 有耐性的；有耐心的；能忍耐的: She's very patient with young children. 她对小孩子很有耐心。 [OPP] impatient 反义词为impatient ➔patiently adv to wait patiently 耐心等候
*patient²
/ˈpeɪʃnt ||; ˈpeʃənt/noun [C] a person who is receiving medical treatment 病人；患者: a hospital patient 住院病人 He's one of Dr Waters' patients. 他是沃特斯医生的一个病人。

patio
/ˈpætiəʊ ||; ˈpɑtɪˌo/noun [C] (plural patios /-əʊz ||; -ˌoz/) a flat, hard area, usually behind a house, where people can sit, eat, etc outside 庭院；院子 ☞Look at balcony, veranda and terrace. 参看balcony、veranda及terrace。 ☞picture on page C7 见C7页插图

patriarch
/ˈpeɪtriɑ:k ||; ˈpetrɪˌɑrk/noun [C] a man who is the head of a family or social group 家长；（社会团体的）首领 ☞Compare matriarch. 与matriarch比较。

patriarchal
/ˌpeɪtriˈɑ:kl ||; ˌpetrɪˈɑrkḷ/adj (used about a society or system 指社会或制度) controlled by men rather than women; passing power, property, etc from father to son rather than from mother to daughter 父权制的；由男性控制的 ☞Compare matriarchal. 与matriarchal比较。

patriarchy
/ˈpeɪtriɑ:ki ||; ˈpetrɪˌɑrkɪ/noun [C,U] (plural patriarchies) a social system that gives power and control to men rather than women 父权制 ☞Compare matriarchy. 与matriarchy比较。

patricide
/ˈpætrɪsaɪd ||; ˈpætrɪˌsaɪd/noun [U] (formal 正式) the crime of killing your father 弒父罪 ☞Compare matricide. 与matricide比较。

patriot
/ˈpeɪtriət;ˈpæt-; US ˈpeɪt- ||; ˈpetrɪət/noun [C] a person who loves his/her country and is ready to defend it against an enemy 爱国者 ➔patriotism /ˈpeɪtriətɪzəm ;ˈpæt-||; ˈpetrɪətˌɪzəm/ noun [U]

patriotic
/ˌpeɪtriˈɒtɪk;ˌpæt-; US ˌpeɪt- ||; ˌpetrɪˈɑtɪk/adj having or showing great love for your country 爱国的 ➔patriotically /-kli ||; -klɪ/ adv

patrol¹
/pəˈtrəʊl ||; pəˈtrol/verb [I,T] (patrolling;patrolled) to go round an area, a building, etc at regular times to make sure that it is safe and that nothing is wrong 巡逻；巡查
patrol²
/pəˈtrəʊl ||; pəˈtrol/noun
1 [C,U] the act of going round an area, building, etc at regular times to make sure that it is safe and that nothing is wrong 巡逻；巡查: a police car on patrol in the area 一辆在该地区巡逻的警车
2 [C] a group of soldiers, vehicles, etc that patrol sth 一队巡逻兵；一队巡逻车辆: a naval/police patrol 海军巡逻队；警察巡逻队 a patrol car/boat 巡逻车；巡逻艇

patron
/ˈpeɪtrən ||; ˈpetrən/noun[C]
1 a person who gives money and support to artists, writers and musicians （艺术家、作家、音乐家的）赞助人，资助人: a patron of the arts 艺术资助人
2 a famous person who supports an organization such as a charity and whose name is used in advertising it 赞助慈善机构等的名人（以其名义来为这类机构做广告） ☞Look at sponsor. 参看sponsor。
3 (formal 正式) a person who uses a particular shop, theatre, restaurant, etc 主顾；顾客: This car park is for patrons only. 这个停车场只供顾客使用。

patronage
/ˈpætrənɪdʒ;ˈpeɪt- ||; ˈpætrənɪdʒ; ˈpet-/noun [U] (formal 正式)
1 the support, especially financial, that is given to a person or an organization by a patron 赞助；资助: Patronage of the arts comes mainly from businesses and private individuals. 对艺术的资助主要来自企业及个人。
2 the system by which an important person gives help or a job to sb in return for his/her support 恩施或恩惠制度
3 (especially US 尤为美) the support that a person gives a shop, restaurant, etc by spending money there （对商店、旅馆等的）惠顾，光顾

patronize
/ˈpætrənaɪz; US ˈpeɪt- ||; ˈpetrənˌaɪz/ (also -ise) verb [T]
1 to treat sb in a way that shows that you think you are better, more intelligent, experienced, etc than he/she is 以降尊纡贵的态度对待（某人）
2 (formal 正式) to be a regular customer of a shop, restaurant, etc （经常）光顾，惠顾 ➔patronizing(also -ising) adj I really hate that patronizing smile of hers. 我真讨厌她那降尊纡贵般的笑容。 ➔patronizingly(also -isingly) adv

ˌpatron ˈsaint
noun [C] a religious being who is believed by Christians to protect a particular place or people doing a particular activity 主保圣人；守护圣徒；守护神

patter
/ˈpætə(r) ||; ˈpætɚ/noun
1 [sing] the sound of many quick light steps or knocks on a surface 急而轻的脚步声或敲击声: the patter of the children's feet on the stairs 孩子们走过楼梯时的啪嗒啪嗒声
2 [U] [sing] fast continuous talk by sb who is trying to sell you sth or entertain you 招揽生意的不停叫喊声: sales patter 推销叫喊声 patter verb [I]

*pattern
/ˈpætn ||; ˈpætɚn/noun[C]
1 the way in which sth happens, develops, or is done （事物发生、发展或完成的）方式，模式: Her days all seemed to follow the same pattern. 她的生活似乎千篇一律。 changing patterns of behaviour/work/weather 变化着的行为／工作╱天气形态
2 an arrangement of lines, shapes, colours, etc as a design 图案；花纹；花样: a shirt with a floral pattern on it 有花卉图案的衬衫 [SYN] design 同义词为design
3 a design, a set of instructions or a shape to cut around that you use in order to make sth 式样；纸样；模型

patterned
/ˈpætənd ||; ˈpætɚnd/adj decorated with a pattern(2) 有图案的；有花纹的

*pause¹
/pɔ:z ||; pɔz/noun
1 [C] a pause (in sth) a short period of time during which sb stops talking or stops what he/she is doing 暂停；停顿: He continued playing for twenty minutes without a pause. 他连续演奏二十分钟没有停过。 ☞Look at the note at interval. 参看interval的注释。
2 (also pause button) [U] a control on a video player, etc that allows you to stop playing or recording for a short time （录象机等上的）暂停键: Can you press pause to stop the tape while I go and make a cup of tea? 我去泡杯茶，你可不可以单击暂停键，让磁带停下来？
pause²
/pɔ:z ||; pɔz/verb [I] pause (for sth) to stop talking or doing sth for a short time before continuing 使暂停；使停顿

pave
/peɪv ||; pev/verb [T] pave sth (with sth) (often passive 常用于被动语态) to cover an area of ground with flat stones (paving stones) or bricks （用石板或砖）铺地

pavement
/ˈpeɪvmənt ||; ˈpevmənt/ (US 美 sidewalk) noun [C] a hard flat area at the side of a road for people to walk on 人行道 ☞picture at roundabout 见roundabout插图

pavilion
/pəˈvɪliən ||; pəˈvɪljən/noun [C] (Brit 英) a building at a sports ground where players can change their clothes （运动场的）更衣室

ˈpaving stone
noun [C] a flat piece of stone that is used for covering the ground 铺路石板 ☞picture on page C7 见C7页插图

*paw¹
/pɔ: ||; pɔ/noun [C] the foot of animals such as dogs, cats, bears, etc （狗、猫、熊等动物的）脚爪，爪子 ☞picture on page C1 见C1页插图
paw²
/pɔ: ||; pɔ/verb [I,T] paw (at) sth (used about an animal) to touch or scratch sb/sth several times with a paw （指动物）用爪子触或抓: The dog pawed at my sleeve. 那狗用脚爪抓我的袖子。

pawn¹
/pɔ:n ||; pɔn/noun[C]
1 (in the game of chess) one of the eight pieces that are of least value and importance （国际象棋）兵，卒
2 a person who is used or controlled by other more powerful people 被人利用或控制的人；爪牙
pawn²
/pɔ:n ||; pɔn/verb [T] to leave a valuable object with a pawnbroker in return for money. If you cannot pay back the money after a certain period, the object can be sold or kept. 典当；抵押；质押

pawnbroker
/ˈpɔ:nbrəʊkə(r) ||; ˈpɔnˌbrokɚ/noun [C] a person who lends money to people when they leave sth of value with him/her 当铺老板

*pay¹
/peɪ ||; pe/verb (past tense past participle paid)
1 [I,T] pay (sb) (for sth);pay (sb) sth (for sth) to give sb money for work, goods, services, etc 付钱；支付: She is very well paid. 她薪金优厚。 The work's finished but we haven't paid for it yet. 工作完成了，但我们还没有付钱呢。 We paid the dealer £3000 for the car. 我们付给汽车商3000英镑买这辆汽车。
2 [T] pay sth (to sb) to give the money that you owe for sth 缴付: Have you paid her the rent yet? 你付给她房租了没有？ to pay a bill/fine 付账单；付罚金
3 [I,T] to make a profit; to be worth doing 赚钱；值得做；划算 · It would pay you to get professional advice before making a decision. 做决定之前，征询一下专业人士的意见会有好处。
4 [I] pay (for sth) to suffer or be punished because of your beliefs or actions （因信仰或行为而）受罪，受惩罚: You'll pay for that remark! 你会为说那种话而受惩罚！
be paid in arrears→ARREARS pay attention (to sb/sth) to listen carefully to or to take notice of sb/sth 用心聆听；留意；注意 pay sb a compliment;pay a compliment to sb to say that you like sth about sb 赞美（某人） pay your respects (to sb)(formal 正式) to visit sb as a sign of respect 拜访（某人）以示敬意: Hundreds came to pay their last respects to her (= to go to her funeral). 有几百人来参加她的葬礼。 pay tribute to sb/sth to say good things about sb/sth and show your respect for sb/sth 对某人或某事物表示称赞及敬意 put paid to sth to destroy or finish sth 毁灭；结束: The bad weather put paid to our picnic. 恶劣的天气把我们的野餐搞砸了。 pay sth back (to sb) to give money back to sb that you borrowed from him/her 把钱还给某人: Can you lend me £5? I'll pay you back/I'll pay it back to you on Friday. 你可以借5英镑给我吗？我星期五还给你。 pay sb back (for sth) to punish sb for making you or sb else suffer 报复: What a mean trick! I'll pay you back one day. 多么卑劣的花招！终有一天我会回敬你的。 pay off(informal 非正式) to be successful 取得成功；得到好结果: All her hard work has paid off! She passed her exam. 她的辛勤努力已得到回报！她考及格了。 pay sth off to pay all the money that you owe for sth 还清，偿清（债务）: to pay off a debt/mortgage 还清债务╱抵押贷款 pay up(informal 非正式) to pay the money that you owe 还清欠款: If you don't pay up, we'll take you to court. 如果你不清还欠款，我们就告你。
*pay²
/peɪ ||; pe/noun [U] money that you get regularly for work that you have done 工资；薪金 ☞ Pay is the general word for money that you get regularly for work that you have done. Wages are paid weekly or daily in cash. A salary is paid monthly, directly into a bank account. You pay a fee for professional services, for example to a doctor, lawyer, etc. Payment is money for work that you do once or not regularly. Your income is all the money you get regularly, both for work you have done, and as interest on money you have saved. pay泛指工资。wage指每日或每周以现金支付的工资。salary按月支付，直接转入银行账户。fee指专业服务的费用，如付给医生、律师等。payment为一次性或不定期工作所得的报酬。income指全部固定收入，包括工资和存款利息。

payable
/ˈpeɪəbl ||; ˈpeəbḷ/adj that should or must be paid 应缴付的: A 10% deposit is payable in advance. 必须先缴付10%订金。 Make the cheque payable to Pauline Nolan. 支票抬头写波林．诺兰。

payback
/peɪbæk ||; ˈpeˌbæk/noun
1 [U] (informal 非正式) something that you do to punish sb who has hurt you, made you suffer, etc 报复 [SYN]revenge 同义词为revenge
2 [C,U] the profit or an advantage that you receive later from money you have put into sth or sth you have done; the time it takes to receive this 投资的回报；投资回收期: Now is a good time to invest because the long-term paybacks can be large. 因为现在长期投资回报可能比较可观，所以是投资的好时间。 a 10-year payback period * 10 年的投资回收期
it's payback time (informal 非正式) used to say that you are now going to make sb suffer because of sth bad he/she did to you 现在该遭到报应了

ˈpay day
noun [C,U] the day on which you get paid for work you have done 发薪日；发工资日: Can I wait until pay day to give you the money for my ticket? 我能等到发工资的时候还给你票钱吗？

PAYE
/ˌpi: eɪ waɪ ˈi: ||; ˌpi e waɪ ˈi/abbr pay as you earn; a British system of paying tax in which money is taken from the money you earn by your employer and paid to the government （老板从雇员薪金中扣除所得税的）英国所得税预扣法

payee
/ˌpeɪˈi: ||; peˈi/noun [C] (written 书面语) a person that money, especially a cheque, is paid to （尤指支票的）收款人，受付人

payer
/peɪə(r) ||; ˈpeɚ/noun [C] a person who pays for sth 付款人；交款人: to be a good/prompt/slow/late payer 守信的付款人；付款及时/拖拉的人；逾期付款者

*payment
/ˈpeɪmənt ||; ˈpemənt/noun payment (for sth)
1 [U] the act of paying sb or of being paid 支付；付款；取得报酬: I did the work last month but I haven't had any payment for it yet. 我上月做那项工作，但还没有收到报酬。 ☞Look at the note at pay ². 参看pay^2的注释。
2 [C] an amount of money that you must pay 应付金额: They asked for a payment of £100 as a deposit. 他们要求付100英镑作为订金。

ˈpay-off
noun [C]
1 (informal 非正式) a payment of money that is made to someone, often illegally 贿赂
2 an advantage or a reward from sth you have done 回报；报偿

payout
/peɪaʊt ||; ˈpeˌaut/noun [C] a large amount of money that is given to sb 付出的巨款

payroll
/ˈpeɪrəʊl ||; ˈpeˌrol/noun
1 [C] a list of people employed by a company showing the amount of money to be paid to each of them 工资表: There are 70 people on the payroll. 工资表上有70人。
2 [usu.sing] the total amount paid by a company to its employees 发放工资总额

PC
/ˌpi: ˈsi: ||; ˌpi ˈsi/abbr
1 (computing计算机技术) personal computer; a computer that is designed for one person to use at work or at home 个人电脑；个人计算机
