2 police constable; an officer of the lowest position （职级最低的）警察，警员
3 = POLITICALLY CORRECT

PDA
/ˌpi: di: ˈeɪ ||; ˌpi ˌdi ˈe/abbr personal digital assistant; a hand-held computer for storing information and accessing the Internet 个人数字助理；掌上计算机

PE
/ˌpi: ˈi: ||; ˌpi ˈi/abbr physical education 体育: a PE lesson 体育课

pea
/pi: ||; pi/noun [C] a small round green seed that is eaten as a vegetable. A number of peas grow together in a long thin case (a pod). 豌豆 ☞picture on page C3 见C3页插图

*peace
/pi:s ||; pis/noun[U]
1 a situation or a period of time in which there is no war or violence in a country or area 和平；太平；安宁；承平时期: The two communities now manage to live in peace together. 两个小区如今终于能和平相处。 A UN force has been sent in to keep the peace. 一支联合国部队已经奉派去维持和平。
2 the state of being calm or quiet 宁静；安静: He longed to escape from the city to the peace and quiet of the countryside. 他渴望离开城市，到乡间享受宁静。

*peaceful
/ˈpi:sfl ||; ˈpisfəl/adj
1 not wanting or involving war, violence or argument 和平的；太平的；平和的: a peaceful protest/demonstration/solution 和平抗议╱示威╱解决办法
2 calm and quiet 宁静；安静: a peaceful village 宁静的乡村 ➔peacefully /-fəli ||; -fəlɪ/ adv The siege ended peacefully. 这次围攻以和平方式收场。 ➔peacefulness noun [U]

peacekeeping
/ˈpi:ski:pɪŋ ||; ˈpisˌkipɪŋ/adj (only before a noun 只用于名词前) intended to help keep the peace and prevent war or violence in a place where this is likely 维持和平的: a United Nations peacekeeping force 联合国维持和平部队

peacetime
/ˈpi:staɪm ||; ˈpisˌtaɪm/noun [U] a period when a country is not at war 和平时期；平时（与战时相对）

peach
/pi:tʃ ||; pitʃ/noun
1 [C] a soft round fruit with orange-red skin. A peach is soft inside and has a large stone in its centre. 桃；桃子 ☞picture on page C3 见C3页插图
2 [U] a pinkish-orange colour 桃色

peachy
/pi:tʃi ||; ˈpitʃɪ/adj (peachier; peachiest) (especially US, informal 尤为美，非正式) very good or nice 很好的；顺利的: Everything's just peachy here. 这里一切很好。

peacock
/ˈpi:kɒk ||; ˈpiˌkɑk/noun [C] a large bird with beautiful long blue and green tail feathers that it can lift up and spread out 孔雀

peak¹
/pi:k ||; pik/noun[C]
1 the point at which sth is the highest, best, strongest, etc 顶点；顶峰；最高点: a man at the peak of his career 处于事业顶峰的男子
2 the pointed top of a mountain 山峰；顶峰；山顶: snow-covered peaks 白雪覆盖的山峰 ☞pictures at glacial and on page C8 见glacial及 C8页插图
3 the rigid front part of a cap that sticks out above your eyes 帽舌 ☞picture at hat 见hat插图
peak²
/pi:k ||; pik/adj (only before a noun 只用于名词前) used to describe the highest level of sth, or a time when the greatest number of people are doing or using sth 最高水平的；最大数量的；顶峰时期的；尖峰的: Summer is the peak period for most hotels. 夏季是大部份旅馆的旺季。 The athletes are all in peak condition. 这些运动员都处于最佳状态。 ☞Look at off-peak. 参看off-peak。
peak³
/pi:k ||; pik/verb [I] to reach the highest point or value 到达最高峰或最高点: Sales peak just before Christmas. 销售额在圣诞节前达到高峰。

peal
/pi:l ||; pil/noun [C] the loud ringing of a bell or bells 响亮的钟声 (figurative 比喻) peals of laughter 阵阵大笑声 peal verb [I]

peanut
/ˈpi:nʌt ||; ˈpiˌnʌt/noun
1 (also groundnut /ˈgraʊndnʌt ||; ˈgraυndˌnʌt/) [C] a nut that grows under the ground that we eat 花生；落花生 ☞picture at nut 见nut插图
2 peanuts [pl] (informal 非正式) a very small amount of money 极少的钱: We get paid peanuts for doing this job. 我们干这活儿报酬很少。

pear
/peə(r) ||; pɛr/noun [C] a fruit that has a yellow or green skin and is white inside. Pears are thinner at the top than at the bottom. 梨 ☞picture on page C3 见C3页插图

*pearl
/pɜ:l ||; pɝl/noun [C] a small, hard, round, white object that grows inside the shell of a type of shellfish (an oyster). Pearls are used to make jewellery 珍珠: pearl earrings 珍珠耳环

ˈpear-shaped
adj shaped like a pear 梨形的；像梨一样的 go pear-shaped Brit, informal 英，非正式) go wrong 出毛病；出问题

peasant
/ˈpeznt ||; ˈpɛzṇt/noun [C] (used especially in past times) a person who owns or rents a small piece of land on which he/she grows food and keeps animals in order to feed his/her family （尤指过去）农民，农夫，雇农 Peasant is considered offensive nowadays. 现今认为peasant一词意带冒犯。

peat
/pi:t ||; pit/noun [U] a soft black or brown natural substance that is formed from dead plants just under the surface of the ground in cool, wet places. It can be burned as a fuel or put on the garden to make plants grow better. 泥炭，泥煤（由腐烂植物在地表下湿冷处形成的天然物质，可用作燃料或肥料）

pebble
/ˈpebl ||; ˈpɛbḷ/noun [C] a smooth round stone that is found in or near water （水中或近水处的）卵石，小圆石

pecan
/ˈpi:kən ||; ˈpikæn/noun [C] a type of nut that we eat 美洲山核桃 ☞picture at nut 见nut插图

peck
/pek ||; pɛk/verb[I,T]
1 peck (at) sth (used about a bird) to eat or bite sth with its beak （指禽鸟）啄食，啄
2 (informal 非正式) to kiss sb quickly and lightly 匆匆轻吻: She pecked him on the cheek and then left. 她在他脸颊上匆匆吻了一下便走了。 peck noun [C]

peckish
/ˈpekɪʃ ||; ˈpɛkɪʃ/adj (informal 非正式) hungry 饥饿的

pectoral
/ˈpektərəl ||; ˈpɛktərəl/adj on or connected with the chest or breast of a fish or animal 在鱼或动物胸部的；与鱼或动物的胸有关的: pectoral fins 胸鳍 ☞Compare dorsal and ventral. 与dorsal及ventral比较。

pectorals
/ˈpektərəlz ||; ˈpɛktərəlz/ (informal 非正式pecs /peks ||; pɛks/) noun [pl] the muscles of the chest 胸肌

peculiar
/pɪˈkju:liə(r) ||; pɪˈkjuljɚ/adj
1 unusual or strange 奇特的；奇怪的: There's a very peculiar smell in here. 这里有一种很怪异的气味。 [SYN] odd 同义词为odd
2 peculiar to sb/sth only belonging to one person or found in one place 特有的；独有的；独特的: a species of bird peculiar to South East Asia 一种东南亚特有的鸟类

peculiarity
/pɪˌkju:liˈærəti ||; pɪˌkjulɪˈærətɪ/noun (plural peculiarities)
1 [C] a strange or unusual characteristic, quality or habit 特点；特质；怪癖: There are some peculiarities in her behaviour. 她有一些怪癖。
2 [C] a characteristic or a quality that only belongs to one particular person, thing or place 特点；特质: the cultural peculiarities of the English 英格兰人的文化特点
3 [U] the quality of being strange or unusual 奇怪；古怪

peculiarly
/pɪˈkju:liəli ||; pɪˈkjuljɚlɪ/adv
1 in a strange and unusual way 古怪地；奇特地: Luke is behaving very peculiarly. 卢克的举止很古怪。
2 especially; very 尤其；很: Lilian's laugh can be peculiarly annoying. 利莲的笑声可能特别恼人。
3 in a way that is especially typical of one person, thing or place 以…特有的方式: a peculiarly French custom 独特的法国习俗

ped-
(US 美) =PAED-

pedagogical
/ˌpedəˈgɒdʒɪkl ||; ˌpɛdəˈgɑdʒɪkḷ/adj connected with ways of teaching 与教学法有关的

pedal
/ˈpedl ||; ˈpɛdḷ/noun [C] the part of a bicycle or other machine that you push with your foot in order to make it move or work （自行车或其他机器的）踏板 ☞picture at bicycle 见Ｓ９页插图 pedal verb [I,T] (pedalling;pedalled (US 美) pedaling;pedaled) She had to pedal hard to get up the hill. 她得用力踩踏板才能骑自行车上山。

pedantic
/pɪˈdæntɪk ||; pɪˈdæntɪk/adj too worried about rules or details 迂腐的；太拘泥于规则或细节的 ➔pedantically /-kli ||; -klɪ/ adv

peddle
/pedl ||; ˈpɛdḷ/verb[T]
1 to try to sell things by going from house to house or from place to place 挨户兜售；四处销售: to peddle illegal drugs 贩卖毒品
2 to spread an idea or story in order to get people to accept it, even though it might not be true 宣传；传播
➔peddler noun [C]

pedestal
/ˈpedɪstl ||; ˈpɛdɪstḷ/noun [C] the base on which a column, statue, etc stands 柱基；（雕像等的）基座

pedestrian
/pəˈdestriən ||; pəˈdɛstrɪən/noun [C] a person who is walking in the street (not travelling in a vehicle) 行人 ☞Look at motorist. 参看motorist。

peˌdestrian ˈcrossing
(US 美 crosswalk) noun [C] a place for pedestrians to cross the road 人行横道；行人穿越道 ☞Look at zebra crossing. 参看zebra crossing。 ☞picture at roundabout 见roundabout插图

pediatrician
(US 美) =PAEDIATRICIAN

pediatrics
(US 美) =PAEDIATRICS

pedigree¹
/ˈpedɪgri: ||; ˈpɛdəˌgri/noun[C]
1 an official record of the parents, grandfather, grandmother, etc from which an animal has been bred （动物的）系谱，血统书 ☞Look at mongrel. 参看mongrel。
2 a person's family history, especially when this is impressive （尤指显赫的）血统，出身，背景
pedigree²
/ˈpedɪgri: ||; ˈpɛdəˌgri/adj (only before a noun 只用于名词前) (used about an animal) of high quality because the parents, grandfather, grandmother, etc are all of the same breed and specially chosen （指动物）纯种的

pedophile
(US 美) =PAEDOPHILE

pee
/pi: ||; pi/verb [I] (informal 非正式) to get rid of waste water from your body; to urinate 小便 pee noun [U] [sing]

peek
/pi:k ||; pik/verb [I] (informal 非正式)peek (at sth) to look at sth quickly and secretly because you should not be looking at it 很快地看一眼；偷看；窥视: No peeking at your presents before your birthday! 你在生日前不准偷看礼物！ peek noun [sing] to have a quick peek 飞快地偷看一眼

peel¹
/pi:l ||; pil/verb
1 [T] to take the skin off a fruit or vegetable 削去，剥去（水果或蔬菜的皮）: Could you peel the potatoes, please? 请你削去土豆皮好吗？
2 [I,T] peel (sth) (off/away/back) to come off or to take sth off a surface in one piece or in small pieces 剥落；脱落；剥掉 · I peeled off the price label before handing her the book. 我撕去价格卷标把书给她。
keep your eyes peeled/skinned (for sb/sth)→EYE¹
peel²
/pi:l ||; pil/noun [U] the skin of a fruit or vegetable （水果或蔬菜的）皮: apple/potato peel 苹果皮；马铃薯皮 ☞picture on page C3 见C3页插图 ☞Look at rind and skin. 参看rind及skin。

peeler
/ˈpi:lə(r) ||; ˈpilɚ/noun [C] a special knife for taking the skin off fruit and vegetables （削水果和蔬菜皮的）削皮刀: a potato peeler 土豆削皮刀 ☞picture at kitchen 见kitchen插图

peep¹
/pi:p ||; pip/verb[I]
1 peep (at sth) to look at sth quickly and secretly, especially through a small opening （尤指从小孔里）很快地看，偷看，窥视
2 to be in a position where a small part of sb/sth can be seen 隐约露出；露出一小部份: The moon is peeping out from behind the clouds. 月亮从云层后面露出脸来。
peep²
/pi:p ||; pip/noun [sing] (informal 非正式)
1 a quick look 一瞥: Have a peep in the bedroom and see if the baby is asleep. 去卧室看一看小宝宝是不是睡着了。
2 a sound 声音: There hasn't been a peep out of the children for hours. 孩子们已有好几小时一声不响了。

peer¹
/pɪə(r) ||; pɪr/noun[C]
1 a person who is of the same age or position in society as you 年龄或地位相同的人；同侪: Children hate to look stupid in front of their peers. 孩子不愿意在同伴面前显得傻乎乎。
2 (Brit 英) a member of the top level of society (the nobility) 贵族；有爵位的人
peer²
/pɪə(r) ||; pɪr/verb [I] peer (at sb/sth) to look closely or carefully at sb/sth, for example because you cannot see very well 凝视；仔细看: He peered at the photo, but it was blurred. 他盯着那张照片看，但照片变得模模糊糊了。

peerage
/ˈpɪərɪdʒ ||; ˈpɪrɪdʒ/noun
1 [with.sop] all the peers¹(2) as a group 贵族（总称）
2 [C] the social position (rank) of a peer¹(2) 爵位

ˈpeer group
noun [C] a group of people who are all of the same age and social position 同龄群体；同辈群体

peeved
/pi:vd ||; pivd/adj (informal 非正式) quite angry or annoyed 生气的；恼怒的

peevish
/ˈpi:vɪʃ ||; ˈpivɪʃ/adj easily annoyed by things that are not important 容易为小事生气的；脾气坏的 ➔peevishly adv

peg¹
/peg ||; pɛg/noun[C]
1 a piece of wood, metal, etc on a wall or door that you hang your coat on （墙上或门上挂衣服的）挂钩
2 (also tent peg) a piece of metal that you push into the ground to keep one of the ropes of a tent in place 系帐篷绳子的桩 ☞picture at tent 见tent插图
3 (also clothes peg) (US 美 clothes pin) a type of small wooden or plastic object used for fastening wet clothes to a clothes line （晾衣服用的）衣夹
peg²
/peg ||; pɛg/verb [T] (pegging;pegged)
1 peg sth (out) to fix sth with a peg 用挂钩或夹子固定
2 peg sth (at/to sth) to fix or keep sth at a certain level 使固定在（某水平）: Wage increases were pegged at 5%. 薪金增幅限于5%。

pelican
/ˈpelɪkən ||; ˈpɛlɪkən/noun [C] a large bird that lives near water in warm countries. A pelican has a large beak that it uses for catching and holding fish. 鹈鹕

pellet
/ˈpelɪt ||; ˈpɛlɪt/noun[C]
1 a small hard ball of any substance, often of soft material that has become hard 坚硬小球（多指用软物做成的）
2 a very small metal ball that is fired from a gun 小弹丸；子弹: shotgun pellets 猎枪子弹

pelt
/pelt ||; pɛlt/verb
1 [T] to attack sb/sth by throwing things （投掷物件）攻击
2 [I] pelt (down) (used about rain) to fall very heavily （指雨）下得很大: It's absolutely pelting down. 天下着倾盆大雨。
3 [I] (informal 非正式) to run very fast 很快地跑: Some kids pelted past us. 几个孩子从我们身边飞奔而过。

pelvis
/ˈpelvɪs ||; ˈpɛlvɪs/noun [C] (plural pelvises) the set of wide bones at the bottom of your back, to which your leg bones are joined 骨盆 ☞picture at body 见body插图 ➔pelvic /ˈpelvɪk ||; ˈpɛlvɪk/ adj

*pen
/pen ||; pɛn/noun[C]
1 an object that you use for writing in ink （用墨水的）笔，钢笔: a ballpoint/felt-tip/marker/fountain pen 圆珠笔；毡头笔；记号笔；自来水笔
2 a small piece of ground with a fence around it that is used for keeping animals in （牲畜的）圈，围栏

penal
/ˈpi:nl ||; ˈpinḷ/adj (only before a noun 只用于名词前) connected with punishment by law 与刑罚有关的: the penal system 刑罚制度

ˈpenal code
noun [C, usually sing] a system of laws connected with crime and punishment 刑法典

penalize
/ˈpi:nəlaɪz ||; ˈpinḷˌaɪz/ (also -ise) verb [T]
1 to punish sb for breaking a law or rule 惩罚（犯法或犯规的人）
2 to cause sb to have a disadvantage 使处于不利地位: Children should not be penalized because their parents cannot afford to pay. 儿童不应因父母付不起钱而受到不公平对待。

penalty
/ˈpenəlti ||; ˈpɛnḷtɪ/noun [C] (plural penalties)
1 a punishment for breaking a law, rule or contract 处罚；惩罚；刑罚: the death penalty 死刑 What's the maximum penalty for smuggling drugs? 走私毒品最严厉的处罚是什么？
2 a disadvantage or sth unpleasant that happens as the result of sth （某事导致的）不利、不愉快情况或后果: I didn't work hard enough and I paid the penalty. I failed all my exams. 我没有用功，因而自食其果，各科考试都不及格。
3 (in sport) a punishment for one team and an advantage for the other team because a rule has been broken （体育）对犯规队伍的处罚: The referee awarded a penalty to the home team. 裁判判给主队一个罚球。

penance
/ˈpenəns ||; ˈpɛnəns/noun [C,U] a punishment that you give yourself to show you are sorry for doing sth wrong 自我赎罪的苦行

*pence
plural ofPENNY

*pencil¹
/ˈpensl ||; ˈpɛnsḷ/noun [C,U] an object that you use for writing or drawing. Pencils are usually made of wood and contain a thin stick of a black or coloured substance 铅笔: Bring a pencil and paper with you. 随身带上铅笔和纸。 Write in pencil, not ink. 用铅笔写，不要用墨水笔。 ☞picture at stationery 见stationery插图
pencil²
/ˈpensl ||; ˈpɛnsḷ/verb [T] (pencilling;pencilled (US 美) penciling;penciled) to write or draw sth with a pencil 用铅笔写或画 pencil sth/sb in to write down the details of an arrangement that might have to be changed later 添入，填入（以后可能得改变的细节）: Shall we pencil the next meeting in for the fourteenth? 我们是不是添一句，下次会议在十四日召开？

ˈpencil case
noun [C] a small bag or box that you keep pens, pencils, etc in 铅笔盒；笔袋

ˈpencil sharpener
noun [C] an instrument that you use for making pencils sharp 卷笔刀 ☞picture at stationery 见stationery插图

pendant
/ˈpendənt ||; ˈpɛndənt/noun [C] a small attractive object that you wear on a chain around your neck （项链的）垂饰，坠子

pending
/ˈpendɪŋ ||; ˈpɛndɪŋ/adj prep (formal 正式)
1 waiting to be done or decided 待办；待决: The judge's decision is still pending. 法官仍未作出裁决。
2 until sth happens 直至；在…之前: He took over the leadership pending the elections. 他接任领袖一职，直到选举为止。

pendulum
/ˈpendjələm; US -dʒʊləm ||; ˈpɛndʒələm/noun[C]
1 a chain or stick with a heavy weight at the bottom that moves regularly from side to side to work a clock 摆；摆锤；钟摆
2 a way of describing a situation that changes from one thing to its opposite （局面）摇摆不定: Since last year's election, the pendulum of public opinion has swung against the government. 自去年的选举以来，舆论转向反对政府。

penetrate
/ˈpenɪtreɪt ||; ˈpɛnəˌtret/verb[I,T]
1 to go through or into sth, especially when this is difficult （尤指很不容易地）进入，渗入，穿过，穿透: The knife penetrated ten centimetres into his chest. 刀子刺入他的胸膛达十厘米深。
2 to manage to understand sth difficult 设法了解，明白（难懂之物）: Scientists have still not penetrated the workings of the brain. 科学家仍没有搞清大脑的运作机理。
3 to be understood or realized 被了解；被领悟: I was back at home when the meaning of her words finally penetrated. 我回到家后，她话的意思我总算明白。 ➔penetration /ˌpenɪˈtreɪʃn ||; ˌpɛnəˈtreʃən/ noun [U]

penetrating
/ˈpenɪtreɪtɪŋ ||; ˈpɛnɪˌtretɪŋ/adj
1 (used about sb's eyes or of a way of looking) making you feel uncomfortable because it seems sb knows what you are thinking （指眼神或看人的方式）尖锐的，犀利的: a penetrating look/stare/gaze 会意的神情╱注视╱凝视 penetrating blue eyes 敏锐的蓝眼睛
2 showing that you have understood sth completely and quickly （显得）有洞察力的，敏锐的: a penetrating question/comment 深刻的问题╱评论
3 that can be heard, felt, smelled, etc a long way away 有穿透力；有渗透力的；强烈的

penfriend
/ˈpenfrend ||; ˈpɛnˌfrɛnd/ (especially US 尤为美 pen pal) noun [C] a person that you become friendly with by exchanging letters, often a person that you have never met （不见面的）通信朋友；笔友

penguin
/ˈpeŋgwɪn ||; ˈpɛŋgwɪn/noun [C] a black and white seabird that cannot fly and that lives in the Antarctic 企鹅

penicillin
/ˌpenɪˈsɪlɪn ||; ˌpɛnɪˈsɪlɪn/noun [U] a substance that is used as a medicine (an antibiotic)for preventing and treating diseases and infections caused by bacteria 青霉素，盘尼西林（一种抗生素）

peninsula
/pəˈnɪnsjələ; US -nsələ ||; pəˈnɪnsələ/noun [C] an area of land that is almost surrounded by water 半岛

penis
/ˈpi:nɪs ||; ˈpinɪs/noun [C] the male sex organ that is used for getting rid of waste liquid and having sex 阴茎

penitent
/ˈpenɪtənt ||; ˈpɛnətənt/adj (formal 正式) sorry for having done sth wrong 悔过的；后悔的；忏悔的

penitentiary
/ˌpenɪˈtenʃəri ||; ˌpɛnəˈtɛnʃərɪ/noun [C] (plural penitentiaries) (US 美) a prison 监狱

penknife
/ˈpennaɪf ||; ˈpɛnˌnaɪf/noun [C] (plural penknives) a small knife with parts used for cutting (blades), opening bottles, etc that fold safely away when not being used 小折刀

penniless
/ˈpeniləs ||; ˈpɛnɪlɪs/adj having no money; poor 一文不名的；贫穷的

*penny
/ˈpeni ||; ˈpɛnɪ/noun [C] (plural pence /pens ||; pɛns/or pennies)
1 (abbr p) a small brown British coin. There are a hundred pence in a pound. 便士（英国辅币，一英镑等于一百便士）: a fifty-pence piece/coin 一枚五十便士硬币
2 (US 美) a cent 一分（钱）

*pension
/ˈpenʃn ||; ˈpɛnʃən/noun [C] money that is paid regularly by a government or company to sb who has stopped working (retired) because of old age or who cannot work because he/she is ill （给年老退休的人的）退休金；（给因病不能工作的人的）抚恤金 ➔pensioner=OLD-AGE PENSIONER

penta-
/ˈpentə ||; ˈpɛntə/prefix (used in nouns, adjectives and adverbs 用于构成名词、形容词及副词) five; having five 五；有五（个）: pentathlon 五项全能

pentagon
/ˈpentəgən; US -gɒn ||; ˈpɛntəˌgɑn/noun
1 [C] a shape that has five straight and equal sides 五边形；五角形
2 the Pentagon [sing] a large government building near Washington DC in the US that contains the main offices of the US military forces; the military officials who work there 五角大楼（美国国防部办公大楼）；美国国防部人员

pentathlon
/penˈtæθlən ||; pɛnˈtæθlən/noun [C] a sports competition in which you have to take part in five different events 五项全能运动

penthouse
/ˈpenthaʊs ||; ˈpɛntˌhaυs/noun [C] an expensive flat at the top of a tall building （高楼中昂贵的）顶层公寓

pent-up
/ˌpent ˈʌp/adj (only before a noun 只用于名词前) (used about feelings) that you hold inside and do not express （指感情）被压抑的，被抑制的，积郁的: pent-up anger 积愤

penultimate
/penˈʌltɪmət ||; pɪˈnʌltəmɪt/adj (in a series) the one before the last one （一连串事物）倒数第二的: ‘Y’ is the penultimate letter of the alphabet. Y是字母表中倒数第二个字母。

penumbra
/pəˈnʌmbrə ||; pɪˈnʌmbrə/noun [C] (technical术语)
1 the outer part of a SHADOW, that is less dark than the central part 半阴影
2 a dark area on the earth caused by the moon, or a dark area on the moon caused by the earth, during a PARTIAL ECLIPSE (= a time when the moon is almost exactly between the earth and the sun, or when the earth is almost exactly between the moon and the sun) （偏食时月亮投在地球或地球投在月亮上的）半影 ☞Compare umbra. 与umbra比较。 ☞picture at shadow 见shadow插图

*people
/ˈpi:pl ||; ˈpipḷ/noun
1 [pl] more than one person 人；人们: How many people are coming to the party? 这个聚会有多少人要来参加？ ☞Be careful. People is almost always used instead of the plural form persons. Persons is very formal and is usually used in legal language Persons under the age of sixteen are not permitted to buy cigarettes. 注意：people一词几乎总是用于代替persons这个复数形式。persons为非常正式的词，通常用于法律用语：Persons under the age of sixteen are not permitted to buy cigarettes.十六岁以下者不准购买香烟。
2 [C] (plural peoples) (formal 正式) all the men, women and children who belong to a particular place or race 人民；民族；种族: The President addressed the American people. 总统向美国人民发表演说。 the French-speaking peoples of the world 世界上说法语的民族
3 [pl] men and women who work in a particular activity 从事某项活动的人: business/sports people 商界╱体育界人士
4 the people [pl] the ordinary citizens of a country （一个国家的）国民，民众，寻常百姓: The President is popular because he listens to the people. 这位总统很得民心，因为他倾听民众意见。

ˈpeople carrier
(US 美 minivan) noun [C] a large car, like a van, designed to carry up to eight people 载人车（形似厢式送货车，可坐八人） [SYN] MPV 同义词为MPV ☞picture at car 见car插图

pepper¹
/ˈpepə(r) ||; ˈpɛpɚ/noun
1 [U] a black or white powder with a hot taste that is used for flavouring food 胡椒粉: salt and pepper 盐和胡椒粉
2 [C] a green, red or yellow vegetable that is almost empty inside 辣椒；甜椒 ☞picture on page C3 见C3页插图
pepper²
/ˈpepə(r) ||; ˈpɛpɚ/verb [T] pepper sb/sth with sth (usually passive 通常用于被动语态) to hit sb/sth with a series of small objects, especially bullets （用一连串的小物品）打击（尤其是子弹）: The wall had been peppered with bullets. 这道墙曾被子弹扫射过。

peppercorn
/ˈpepəkɔ:n ||; ˈpɛpɚˌkɔrn/noun [C] a dried berry from a tropical plant, that is pressed into small pieces or powder to make pepper 胡椒粒

peppermint
/ˈpepəmɪnt ||; ˈpɛpɚˌmɪnt/noun
1 [U] a natural substance with a strong fresh flavour that is used in sweets and medicines 薄荷
2 (also mint) [C] a sweet with a peppermint flavour 薄荷糖 ☞Look at spearmint. 参看spearmint。

pepperoni
/ˌpepəˈrəʊni ||; ˌpɛpəˈronɪ/noun [U] a type of spicy sausage 意大利辣香肠: a pepperoni pizza 辣香肠比萨饼

pepsin
/ˈpepsɪn ||; ˈpɛpsɪn/noun [U] (technical术语) the main ENZYME in the stomach that breaks down PROTEIN (= a natural substance found in meat, eggs, fish, etc that the body needs to grow and be healthy) 胃蛋白酶

pep talk
/ˈpep tɔ:k ||; ˈpɛp ˌtɔk/noun [C] (informal 非正式) a speech that is given to encourage people or to make them work harder 鼓动性话语

*per
/pə(r);strong form pɜ:(r) ||; pɚ; pɝ/prep for each 每；每一: The speed limit is 110 kilometres per hour. 速度限制是每小时110公里。 Rooms cost 60 dollars per person per night. 房费每人每晚为60元。

per capita
/pə ˈkæpɪtə ||; pɚ ˈkæpɪtə/adj for each person 人均的: Per capita income rose sharply last year. 去年人均收入大幅度增加。 per capita adv average earnings per capita 人均收入

perceive
/pəˈsi:v ||; pɚˈsiv/verb [T] (formal 正式)
1 to notice or realize sth 留意到；察觉到: Scientists failed to perceive how dangerous the level of pollution had become. 科学家没有察觉到污染物的浓度已有多危险。
2 to understand or think of sth in a particular way 把（某事物）看作或认为: I perceived his comments as a criticism. 我把他的意见视为批评。 ☞noun perception 名词为perception

*per ˈcent
(US 美 percent) adj adv noun [C] [with.sop] (plural per cent) (symbol %) in or of each hundred; one part in every hundred 百分之: You get 10% off if you pay cash. 如果付现金，可便宜10%。 90% of the population owns a television. 当地90%的人口拥有电视机。 The price of bread has gone up by 50 per centin two years. 面包的价格两年内已上涨了百分之五十。

percentage
/pəˈsentɪdʒ ||; pɚˈsɛntɪdʒ/noun [C] [with.sop] the number, amount, rate, etc of sth, expressed as if it is part of a total which is a hundred; a part or share of a whole 百分比: What percentage of people voted in the last election? 有百分之多少的人在上次选举中投票？

perceptible
/pəˈseptəbl ||; pɚˈsɛptəbḷ/adj (formal 正式) that can be seen or felt 看得见的；感觉得到的: a barely perceptible change in colour 几乎察觉不到的颜色变化 [OPP] imperceptible 反义词为imperceptible ➔perceptibly /-əbli ||; -əblɪ/ adv

perception
/pəˈsepʃn ||; pɚˈsɛpʃən/noun
1 [U] the ability to notice or understand sth 洞察力；认知力
2 [C] a particular way of looking at or understanding sth; an opinion 看法；意见: What is your perception of the situation? 你对这个情况有什么看法？ ☞verb perceive 动词为perceive

perceptive
/pəˈseptɪv ||; pɚˈsɛptɪv/adj (formal 正式) quick to notice or understand things 知觉的；敏锐的；理解力强的 ➔perceptively adv

perch¹
/pɜ:tʃ ||; pɝtʃ/verb
1 [I] (used about a bird) to sit on a branch, etc （指鸟）（在树枝等上）栖止
2 [I,T] to sit or be put on the edge of sth （使）坐落于，置于（某物的边缘） · The house was perched on the edge of a cliff. 这幢房子坐落于悬崖边上。
perch²
/pɜ:tʃ ||; pɝtʃ/noun [C] a branch (or a bar in a cage) where a bird sits 鸟栖止的树枝；鸟笼中的棍；栖木

percolate
/ˈpɜ:kəleɪt ||; ˈpɝkəˌlet/verb
1 [I] (technical术语) (used about a liquid, gas, etc 指液体、气体等) to move gradually through a surface that has very small holes or spaces in it 渗漏；渗入: Water had percolated down through the rocks. 水从岩石里渗漏下来。
2 [I,T] to make coffee in a special pot(a percolator); to be made in this way 用渗滤式咖啡壶煮咖啡 ➔percolation /pɜ:kəˈleɪʃn ||; ˌpɝkəˈleʃən/ noun [U]

percolator
/ˈpɜ:kəleɪtə(r) ||; ˈpɝkəˌletɚ/noun [C] a pot for making coffee, in which boiling water is forced up a central tube and then comes down again through the coffee 渗滤式咖啡壶 ☞Compare cafetière. 与cafetière比较。

percussion
/pəˈkʌʃn ||; pɚˈkʌʃən/noun [U] drums and other instruments that you play by hitting them 打击乐器

perennial
/pəˈreniəl ||; pəˈrɛnɪəl/adj
1 that happens often or that lasts for a long time 经常出现的；持久的: a perennial problem 长期存在的问题
2 (used about plants) living for two years or more （指植物）存活两年或以上的，多年生的

*perfect¹
/ˈpɜ:fɪkt ||; ˈpɝfɪkt/adj
1 completely good; without faults or weaknesses 完善的；完美无瑕的: The car is two years old but it is still in perfect condition. 虽然这辆汽车已用了两年，但依然完好无损。 [OPP] imperfect 反义词为imperfect
2 perfect (for sb/sth) exactly suitable or right 很适合；很恰当；绝佳: Ken would be perfect for the job. 肯很适合做那份工作。
3 (only before a noun 只用于名词前) complete; total 完全的；全部的: What he was saying made perfect sense to me. 他说的话在我听来很有道理。 a perfect stranger 素昧平生的人
4 used to describe the tense of a verb that is formed with has/have/had and the past participle 完成时的；完成式的 perfectly adv He played the piece of music perfectly. 他把那首乐曲演奏得完美无瑕。
perfect²
/pəˈfekt ||; pɚˈfɛkt/verb [T] to make sth perfect 使完美；使改善: Vinay is spending a year in France to perfect his French. 维奈将在法国待一年，以提高自己的法语水平。

perfection
/pəˈfekʃn ||; pɚˈfɛkʃən/noun [U] the state of being perfect or without fault 完美；完善: The steak was cooked to perfection. 这牛排做得色香味俱全。

perfectionist
/pəˈfekʃənɪst ||; pɚˈfɛkʃənɪst/noun [C] a person who always does things as well as he/she possibly can and who expects others to do the same 完美主义者

perforate
/ˈpɜ:fəreɪt ||; ˈpɝfəˌret/verb [T] to make a hole or holes in sth 在…上开孔、穿孔或打洞

perforation
/ˌpɜ:fəˈreɪʃn ||; ˌpɝfəˈreʃən/noun
1 [C] a series of small holes in paper, etc that make it easy for you to tear （纸等上的）孔眼，齿孔，孔眼线
2 [U] the action of making a hole or holes in sth 穿孔；打孔；打洞

*perform
/pəˈfɔ:m ||; pɚˈfɔrm/verb
1 [T] (formal 正式) to do a piece of work or sth that you have been ordered to do 做；执行；进行: to perform an operation/an experiment/a task 做手术；做实验；执行任务
2 [I,T] to take part in a play or to sing, dance, etc in front of an audience 演出；表演: She is currently performing at the National Theatre. 她目前正在国家剧院演出。
3 [I] perform (well/badly/poorly) to work or function well or badly 运作（良好╱不佳）: The company has not been performing well recently. 公司最近营运欠佳。
work/perform miracles→MIRACLE

*performance
/pəˈfɔ:məns ||; pɚˈfɔrməns/noun
1 [C] the act of performing sth in front of an audience; something that you perform 表演；演出；节目: What time does the performance start? 演出什么时候开始？
2 [C] the way a person performs in a play, concert, etc 表演；演出水平: His moving performance in the film won him an Oscar. 他在这部电影里感人的演出使他获得了奥斯卡金像奖。
3 [C] the way in which you do sth, especially how successful you are 表现（尤指出色的）: The company's performance was disappointing last year. 这家公司去年的表现令人失望。
4 [U] (used about a machine, etc) the ability to work well （指机器等）性能: This car has a high performance engine. 这辆汽车有一部性能很好的引擎。
5 [U] [sing] (formal 正式) the act or process of doing a task, an action, etc 执行；做；履行: the performance of your duties 履行职责

performer
/pəˈfɔ:mə(r) ||; pɚˈfɔrmɚ/noun[C]
1 a person who performs for an audience 表演者；演出者
2 a person or thing that behaves or works in the way mentioned 执行者；表现者；履行者: Diana is a poor performer in exams. 黛安娜考试都考得很差。

*perfume
/ˈpɜ:fju:m ||; ˈpɝfjum/noun[C,U]
1 (brit also 英亦作 scent) a liquid with a sweet smell that you put on your body to make yourself smell nice 香水: Are you wearing perfume? 你抹香水吗？
2 a pleasant, often sweet, smell 香气；芳香

*perhaps
/pəˈhæps;præps ||; pɚˈhæps; præps/adv (used when you are not sure about sth) possibly; maybe （用于表示不确定）或许，大概，可能: Perhaps he's forgotten. 也许他忘了。 She was, perhaps, one of the most famous writers of the time. 她可能是当时最有名的作家之一。 ☞ Perhaps and maybe are similar in meaning. They are often used to make what you are saying sound more polite Perhaps I could borrow your book, if you're not using it? Maybe I'd better explain... perhaps和maybe的意思相近。这两个词常用以使说话听起来较有礼貌：Perhaps I could borrow your book, if you're not using it?如果你不在用那本书的话，可以借给我吗？·Maybe I'd better explain...也许我该解释一下…

peril
/ˈperəl ||; ˈpɛrəl/noun (written 书面语)
1 [U] great danger 很大的危险: A lack of trained nurses is putting patients' lives in peril. 由于缺少有训练的护士，病人的生命极其危险。
2 [C] sth that is very dangerous 极危险的事物: the perils of drug abuse 吸毒的危险 ➔perilous /ˈperələs ||; ˈpɛrələs/ adj Danger and dangerous are more common words. danger和dangerous较为常用。

perimeter
/pəˈrɪmɪtə(r) ||; pəˈrɪmətɚ/noun [C] the outside edge or limit of an area of land 周边；周围；边缘地带: the perimeter fence of the army camp 这座军营四周的围栏

*period
/ˈpɪəriəd ||; ˈpɪrɪəd/noun[C]
1 a length of time （一段）时间，时期: The scheme will be introduced for a six-month trial period. 这个方案将有六个月的试验期。 Her son is going through a difficult period at the moment. 她的儿子目前正经历一段艰苦的时期。 What period of history are you most interested in? 你对哪个时期的历史最感兴趣？
2 a lesson in school （学校里的）一节课，一堂课: We have five periods of English a week. 我们每星期有五节英语课。
3 the time every month when a woman loses blood from her body （妇女的）月经
4 (especially US 尤为美) =FULL STOP

periodic
/ˌpɪəriˈɒdɪk ||; ˌpɪrɪˈɑdɪk/ (also periodical /-kl ||; -kḷ/) adj happening fairly regularly 定期的；定期发生的: We have periodic meetings to check on progress. 我们定期开会检查进展情况。 ➔periodically /-kli ||; -klɪ/ adv All machines need to be checked periodically. 所有机器都需要定期检查。

periodical
/ˌpɪəriˈɒdɪkl ||; ˌpɪrɪˈɑdɪkḷ/noun [C] (formal 正式) a magazine that is produced regularly 期刊

peripheral¹
/pəˈrɪfərəl ||; pəˈrɪfərəl/adj
1 (formal 正式)peripheral (to sth) not as important as the main aim, part, etc of sth 次要的
2 (technical术语) connected with the outer edge of a particular area 周围的；与周边有关的: the peripheral nervous system 周围神经系统
3 (computing计算机技术) (used about equipment) connected to a computer （指设备）与计算机连接的: a peripheral device 与计算机连接的装置 ➔peripherally /pəˈrɪfərəli ||; pəˈrɪfərəlɪ/ adv
peripheral²
/pəˈrɪfərəl ||; pəˈrɪfərəl/noun [C] (computing计算机技术) a piece of equipment that is connected to a computer, for example a PRINTER 与计算机连接的设备（如打印机）

periphery
/pəˈrɪfəri ||; pəˈrɪfərɪ/noun [C] [usu.sing] (plural peripheries) (formal 正式)
1 the outer edge of a particular area 外围；外缘: industrial development on the periphery of town 城镇边缘地区的工业发展
2 the less important part of sth, for example of a particular activity or of a social or political group 次要部份；外围活动或组织: minor parties on the periphery of American politics 美国政治外围的一些小党

periscope
/ˈperɪskəʊp ||; ˈpɛrəˌskop/noun [C] a device like a long tube, containing mirrors which allow you to see over the top of sth, used especially in a SUBMARINE (= a ship that can operate underwater), to see above the surface of the sea （尤指潜艇使用的）潜望镜

perish
/ˈperɪʃ ||; ˈpɛrɪʃ/verb [I] (written 书面语) to die or be destroyed 死亡；被毁灭: Thousands perished in the war. 数以千计的人在战争中丧生。

perishable
/ˈperɪʃəbl ||; ˈpɛrɪʃəbḷ/adj (used about food) that will go bad quickly （指食物）容易腐坏的 [OPP] non-perishable 反义词为non-perishable

peristalsis
/ˌperɪˈstælsɪs ||; ˌpɛrəˈstælsɪs/noun [U] (technical术语) the movements that the large tubes inside the body make automatically to push sth out or along 蠕动

perjury
/ˈpɜ:dʒəri ||; ˈpɝdʒərɪ/noun [U] (formal 正式) the act of telling a lie in a court of law （在法庭上）作伪证，发假誓 ➔perjure /ˈpɜ:dʒə(r) ||; ˈpɝdʒɚ/ verb [T] perjure yourself She admitted that she had perjured herself while giving evidence. 她承认作了伪证。

perk¹
/pɜ:k ||; pɝk/verb perk (sb/sth) up to become or make sb become happier and have more energy （使）振作起来，高兴起来，活跃起来
perk²
/pɜ:k ||; pɝk/noun [C] (informal 非正式) something extra that you get from your employer in addition to money 额外收入；特殊待遇: Travelling abroad is one of the perks of the job. 可以到国外旅行是这份工作的好处之一。

perm
/pɜ:m ||; pɝm/noun [C] the treatment of hair with special chemicals in order to make it curly （用特别化学品）烫出的波浪发型；烫发 ☞Look at wave. 参看wave。 perm verb · She has had her hair permed. 她烫了头发。

permafrost
/ˈpɜ:məfrɒst ||; ˈpɝməˌfrɔst/noun [U] (technical术语) a layer of soil that is permanently frozen, in very cold regions of the world 永久冻土

*permanent
/ˈpɜ:mənənt ||; ˈpɝmənənt/adj lasting for a long time or for ever; that will not change 持久的；永久的；不变的；固定的: The accident left him with a permanent scar. 那起事故给他留下一个永久的伤疤。 Are you looking for a permanent or a temporary job? 你要找固定的还是临时性的工作呢？ ➔permanence noun [U] ➔permanently adv Has she left permanently? 她永远地离开了吗？

permeable
/ˈpɜ:miəbl ||; ˈpɝmɪəbḷ/adj allowing a liquid or gas to pass through 可渗透的: A frog's skin is permeable to water. 青蛙的皮肤能透水。 [OPP] impermeable 反义词为impermeable ➔permeability /ˌpɜ:miəˈbɪləti ||; ˌpɝmɪəˈbɪlətɪ/ noun [U]

permissible
/pəˈmɪsəbl ||; pɚˈmɪsəbḷ/adj (formal 正式)permissible (for sb) (to so sth) that is allowed by law or by a set of rules （根据法律或规则）许可的，允许的: They have been exposed to radiation above the permissible level. 他们所接触到的辐射已高于决定许可量。

*permission
/pəˈmɪʃn ||; pɚˈmɪʃən/noun [U] permission (for sth);permission (for sb) (to do sth) the act of allowing sb to do sth, especially when this is done by sb in a position of authority 准许；许可: I'm afraid you can't leave without permission. 恐怕未经批准你是不可以离开的。 to ask/give permissionfor sth 要求准许做某事；准许做某事 ☞Be careful. Permission is uncountable. A document that says that you are allowed to do something is a permit. 注意，permission是不可数的。准许某人做某事的文件叫做permit（许可证）。

permissive
/pəˈmɪsɪv ||; pɚˈmɪsɪv/adj having, allowing or showing a lot of freedom that many people do not approve of, especially in sexual matters （尤指性生活方面）放任的，放纵的，纵容的

*permit¹
/pəˈmɪt ||; pɚˈmɪt/verb (permitting;permitted)
1 [T] (formal 正式) to allow sb to do sth or to allow sth to happen 允许；准许: You are not permitted to smoke in the hospital. 医院内不准吸烟。 His visa does not permit him to work. 他的签证不允许他工作。 ☞Look at the note at allow. 参看allow的注释。
2 [I,T] to make sth possible 使有可能: Let's have a barbecue at the weekend, weather permitting. 如果天气好的话，周末一起去烧烤吧。
permit²
/ˈpɜ:mɪt ||; ˈpɝmɪt/noun [C] an official document that says you are allowed to do sth, especially for a limited period of time 许可证；执照: Next month I'll have to apply for a new work permit. 下个月我得申请新的工作许可证。

peroxide
/pəˈrɒksaɪd ||; pəˈrɑksaɪd/ (also ˌhydrogen peˈroxide) noun [U] a colourless liquid that is used to kill bacteria and to make hair a lighter colour 过氧化物

perpendicular
/ˌpɜ:pənˈdɪkjələ(r) ||; ˌpɝpənˈdɪkjəlɚ/adj
1 at an angle of 90° to sth 垂直的；成直角的: Are the lines perpendicular to each other? 这几条线互相垂直吗？ ☞Compare horizontal and vertical. 与horizontal及vertical比较。
2 pointing straight up; upright 直立的；陡峭的: The path was almost perpendicular (= it was very steep). 这条小路很陡峭。

perpetrate
/ˈpɜ:pətreɪt ||; ˈpɝpəˌtret/verb [T] (formal 正式)perpetrate sth (against/upon/on sb) to commit a crime or do sth wrong or evil 犯（罪行）；干（错事或坏事）: to perpetrate a crime/fraud/massacre 犯罪；实施欺诈；进行屠杀 violence perpetrated against women and children 对妇女和儿童所犯的暴行 ➔perpetration /ˌpɜ:pəˈtreɪʃn ||; ˌpɝpəˈtreʃən/ noun [U]

perpetual
/pəˈpetʃuəl ||; pɚˈpɛtʃυəl/adj
1 continuing for a long period of time without stopping 连续不断的；无休止的: They lived in perpetual fear of losing their jobs. 他们时刻生活在害怕会失业的恐惧之中。
2 frequently repeated in a way which is annoying 经常；老是: How can I work with these perpetual interruptions? 老是这样来打岔，我还怎么工作呀？ ➔perpetually /-tʃuəli ||; -tʃυəlɪ/ adv

perpetuate
/pəˈpetʃueɪt ||; pɚˈpɛtʃυˌet/verb [T] (formal 正式) to cause sth to continue for a long time 使持久；使保持；使长存: to perpetuate an argument 使争执继续下去

perplexed
/pəˈplekst ||; pɚˈplɛkst/adj not understanding sth; confused 困惑的；胡涂的

persecute
/ˈpɜ:sɪkju:t ||; ˈpɝsɪˌkjut/verb[T]
1 persecute sb (for sth) (often passive 常用于被动语态) to treat sb in a cruel and unfair way, especially because of race, religion or political beliefs （尤指因种族、宗教或政治信仰而）迫害（某人）
2 to deliberately annoy sb and make his/her life unpleasant 折磨 ➔persecution /ˌpɜ:sɪˈkju:ʃn ||; ˌpɝsɪˈkjuʃən/ noun [C,U] the persecution of minorities 对少数民族的迫害 ➔persecutor /ˈpɜ:sɪkju:tə(r) ||; ˈpɝsɪˌkjutɚ/ noun [C]

persevere
/ˌpɜ:sɪˈvɪə(r) ||; ˌpɝsəˈvɪr/verb [I] persevere (at/in/with sth) to continue trying to do or achieve sth that is difficult 坚持；锲而不舍；不屈不挠: The treatment is painful but I'm going to persevere with it. 这种治疗很痛苦，但是我会坚持下去。 ➔perseverance noun [U]

persist
/pəˈsɪst ||; pɚˈsɪst/verb[I]
1 persist (in sth/doing sth) to continue doing sth even though other people say that you are wrong or that you cannot do it 坚持，执意（做某事）: If you persist in making so much noise, I shall call the police. 如果你执意那样吵闹下去，我就要报警。
2 to continue to exist 持续: If your symptoms persist you should consult your doctor. 如果你的病征持续，你就应该去看医生。 ➔persistence noun [U]: Finally her persistence was rewarded and she got what she wanted. 她的坚持终于得到回报，她得到了她想要的东西。

persistent
/pəˈsɪstənt ||; pɚˈsɪstənt/adj
1 determined to continue doing sth even though people say that you are wrong or that you cannot do it 执着的；坚持不懈的: Some salesmen can be very persistent. 有些推销员总是纠缠不休。
2 lasting for a long time or happening often 持续的；持久的；经常发生的: a persistent cough 久咳 ➔persistently adv

*person
/ˈpɜ:sn ||; ˈpɝsṇ/noun [C] (plural people)
1 a man or woman; a human being 人: I would like to speak to the person in charge. 我想与负责人谈谈。
In some very formal cases the plural of person can be persons. Look at the note at people. 在一些很正式的场合，person的复数形式可用persons。参看people的注释。
2 -person (used to form compound nouns 用于构成复合名词) a person doing the job mentioned 从事…的人: a salesperson/spokesperson 售货员；发言人
3 (grammar语法) one of the three types of pronoun in grammar. I/we are the first person, you is the second person and he/she/it/they are the third person. 人称（语法中三类代名词之一。第一人称是I／we，第二人称是you，第三人称是he／she／it／they）
in person seeing or speaking to sb face to face (not speaking on the telephone or writing a letter) 亲自；本人

*personal
/ˈpɜ:sənl ||; ˈpɝsṇḷ/adj
1 (only before a noun 只用于名词前) of or belonging to one particular person 私人的；个人的；属于某人的: personal belongings 私人物品 Judges should not let their personal feelings influence their decisions. 法官不应让个人情感影响判决。
2 concerning your feelings, health or relationships with other people 涉及隐私的（如个人感情、健康或与他人的关系）: I should like to speak to you in private. I have something personal to discuss. 我想单独与你谈谈，我有件私事跟你商量。 Do you mind if I ask you a personal question ? 我问你一个个人隐私的问题，你介意吗？
3 not connected with a person's job or official position 与工作或职位无关的: Please keep personal phone calls to a minimum. 请尽量少打私人电话。 I try not to let work interfere with my personal life. 我尽力不让工作干扰我的私生活。
4 (only before a noun 只用于名词前) done by a particular person rather than by sb who is acting for him/her 亲自的；亲身的: The Prime Minister made a personal visit to the victims in hospital. 首相亲自到医院探望受害者。
5 (only before a noun 只用于名词前) made or done for one particular person rather than for a large group of people or people in general 为某人特别制造或做的；贴心的: We offer a personal service to all our customers. 我们对所有顾客都提供贴心的服务。
6 speaking about sb's appearance or character in an unpleasant or unfriendly way （恶意地）针对个人的，人身的: It started as a general discussion but then people started to get personal and an argument began. 起初是一般性的讨论，但后来人们开始变成针对个人，便引起了争执。
7 (only before a noun 只用于名词前) connected with the body 与身体有关的: personal hygiene 个人卫生 She's always worrying about her personal appearance. 她老是担心自己的仪容。

personal ad ( also personal)
noun [C] (informal 非正式) a private advertisement or message that is placed in a newspaper, especially by sb who is looking for a romantic partner 私人启事；征友广告

ˌpersonal asˈsistant
=PA

ˈpersonal column
noun [C, usually pl] a section of newspaper in which personal ads and private messages are published 私人启事栏；征友广告栏

ˌpersonal comˈputer
=PC(1)

personality
/ˌpɜ:səˈnæləti ||; ˌpɝsṇˈælətɪ/noun (plural personalities)
1 [C,U] the different qualities of a person's character that make him/her different from other people 个性；性格: Joe has a kind personality. 乔性格温厚。
2 [U] the quality of having a strong, interesting and attractive character （刚强、有趣、有魅力的）独特性格: A good entertainer needs a lot of personality. 一个出色的演艺人员需要有许多独特性格。
3 [C] a famous person (especially in sport, on television, etc) （尤指体育界、电视圈等的）名人，明星: a television personality 电视明星

personalize
/ˈpɜ:sənəlaɪz ||; ˈpɝsṇḷˌaɪz/ (also -ise) verb [T] (usually passive 通常用于被动语态) to mark sth with your name, etc to show that it belongs to you 写上姓名的首字母（以表示某物属于自己）: a car with a personalized number plate 车牌上有个人姓名首字母的汽车

personally
/ˈpɜ:sənəli ||; ˈpɝsṇḷɪ/adv
1 used to show that you are expressing your own opinion （用于表达自己的意见）就我本人而言: Personally, I think that nurses deserve more money. 我个人认为护士应该得到更高的薪金。
2 done by you yourself, not by sb else acting for you 亲自；本人直接地: I will deal with this matter personally. 我会亲自处理这件事情。
3 in a way that is connected with one particular person rather than a group of people 与某个特定的人有关: I wasn't talking about you personally -- I meant all teachers. 我不是在说你个人─我是指所有的教师。
4 in a way that is intended to offend 针对个人的；有意冒犯的: Please don't take it personally, but I would just rather be alone this evening. 请不要把这事看作是针对你的，但今晚我就是想一个人静一静。
5 in a way that is connected with sb's private life, rather than his/her job 与私生活有关（而不是与工作有关）

ˌpersonal ˈpronoun
noun [C] (grammar语法) any of the pronouns I, me, she, her, he, him, we, us, you, they, them 人称代词（如I、me、she、her、he、him、we、us、you、they、them）

ˌpersonal ˈstereo
noun [C] a small machine that plays CDs or cassettes that you can carry round with you and listen to through a wire which goes in each ear (headphones) 随身听

ˌpersonal ˈtrainer
noun [C] a person whose job is to help sb exercise, especially by deciding what types of exercise are best for him/her 私人健身教练

personify
/pəˈsɒnɪfaɪ ||; pɚˈsɑnəˌfaɪ/verb [T] (present participle personifying third person singular present personifies;past tense past participle personified)
1 to be an example in human form of a particular quality 为…的化身: She is kindness personified. 她是仁慈的化身。
2 to describe an object or a feeling as if it were a person, for example in a poem （如在诗歌里）把…人格化或拟人化 ➔personification /pəˌsɒnɪfɪˈkeɪʃn ||; pɚˌsɑnəfəˈkeʃən/ noun [C,U]

personnel
/ˌpɜ:səˈnel ||; ˌpɝsṇˈɛl/noun
1 [pl] the people who work for a large organization or one of the armed forces （一个大机构的）人员，员工，职工；（海、陆或空军中的）人员: sales/medical/technical personnel 销售人员╱医务人员╱技术人员
2 (also personˈnel department) [U] [with.sop] the department of a large company or organization that deals with employing and training people 人事部门: Personnel is/are currently reviewing pay scales. 人事部门目前正在审核工资级别。

perspective
/pəˈspektɪv ||; pɚˈspɛktɪv/noun
1 [U] the ability to think about problems and decisions in a reasonable way without exaggerating them 理智地考虑问题和做决定的能力: Hearing about others' experiences often helps to put your own problems into perspective(= makes them seem less important than you thought). 听听别人的经验往往有助理智地考虑自己的问题。 Try to keep these issues in perspective(= do not exaggerate them). 尽量实事求是地考虑这些问题。
2 [C] your opinion or attitude towards sth 看法；观点: Try and look at this from my perspective. 试着尽量从我的角度来看待这件事。
3 [U] the art of drawing on a flat surface so that some objects appear to be farther away than others 透视法

Perspex™
/ˈpɜ:speks ||; ˈpɝspɛks/noun [U] a strong transparent plastic material that is often used instead of glass 珀斯佩有机玻璃

perspire
/pəˈspaɪə(r) ||; pɚˈspaɪr/verb [I] (formal 正式) to lose liquid through your skin when you are hot; to sweat 出汗；流汗 ➔perspiration /ˌpɜ:spəˈreɪʃn ||; ˌpɝspəˈreʃən/ noun [U] ☞ Sweat is a more common word. sweat较常用。

*persuade
/pəˈsweɪd ||; pɚˈswed/verb[T]
1 persuade sb (to do sth);persuade sb (into sth/doing sth) to make sb do sth by giving him/her good reasons 说服，劝服，劝说（某人做某事）: It was difficult to persuade Louise to change her mind. 要说服路易丝改变主意是很难的事。 We eventually persuaded Sanjay into coming with us. 我们最后说服了桑杰与我们一起去。 [OPP] dissuade 反义词为dissuade
2 (formal 正式)persuade sb that...;persuade sb (of sth) to make sb believe sth 使相信: She had persuaded herself that she was going to fail. 她让自己相信她会失败。 The jury was not persuaded of her innocence. 陪审团不相信她是清白的。 ☞Look at convince. 参看convince。

persuasion
/pəˈsweɪʒn ||; pɚˈsweʒən/noun
1 [U] the act of persuading sb to do sth or to believe sth 说服；劝说: It took a lot of persuasion to get Alan to agree. 劝说了很久艾伦才同意。
2 [C] (formal 正式) a religious or political belief （宗教或政治）信念，信仰: politicians of all persuasions 持各种信念的政界人士

persuasive
/pəˈsweɪsɪv ||; pɚˈswesɪv/adj able to persuade sb to do or believe sth 有说服力的: the persuasive power of advertising 广告的说服力 ➔persuasively adv ➔persuasiveness noun [U]

pertinent
/ˈpɜ:tɪnənt; US -tənənt ||; ˈpɝtṇənt/adj (formal 正式) closely connected with the subject being discussed 切题的；贴切的: to ask a pertinent question 提一个相关的问题

perturb
/pəˈtɜ:b ||; pɚˈtɝb/verb [T] (formal 正式) to make sb worried or upset 使担忧；使烦恼 ➔perturbed adj

pervade
/pəˈveɪd ||; pɚˈved/verb [T] (formal 正式) to spread through and be noticeable in every part of sth 弥漫；遍布: A sadness pervades most of her novels. 她的大部份小说都是弥漫着悲情的。

pervasive
/pəˈveɪsɪv ||; pɚˈvesɪv/adj that is present in all parts of sth 无处不在的；遍布的: a pervasive mood of pessimism 到处弥漫的悲观情绪

perverse
/pəˈvɜ:s ||; pɚˈvɝs/adj (formal 正式) liking to behave in a way that is not acceptable or reasonable or that most people think is wrong 喜欢作对的；乖张的；别扭的: Derek gets perverse pleasure from shocking his parents. 德里克喜欢让父母震惊，以此取乐。 ➔perversely adv ➔perversity noun [U]

perversion
/pəˈvɜ:ʃn; US -ʒn ||; pɚˈvɝʒən/noun[U] [C]
1 sexual behaviour that is not considered normal or acceptable by most people 性欲反常；性变态；性倒错
2 the action of changing sth from right to wrong or from good to bad 颠倒；歪曲；反常: That statement is a perversion of the truth. 那说法歪曲真相。

pervert¹
/pəˈvɜ:t ||; pɚˈvɝt/verb[T]
1 to change a system, process, etc in a bad way 扭曲，扰乱（制度、程序等）: to pervert the course of justice (= to deliberately prevent the police from finding out the truth about a crime) 扰乱司法进程（故意不让警方查出犯罪真相）
2 to cause sb to think or behave in a way that is not moral or acceptable 使堕落；使走上歧途
pervert²
/ˈpɜ:vɜ:t ||; ˈpɝvɝt/noun [C] a person whose sexual behaviour is not thought to be natural or normal by most people 性欲反常者；性变态者；性倒错者

pessimism
/ˈpesɪmɪzəm ||; ˈpɛsəˌmɪzəm/noun [U] pessimism (about/over sth) the state of expecting or believing that bad things will happen and that sth will not be successful 悲观 [OPP] optimism 反义词为optimism ➔pessimistic /ˌpesɪˈmɪstɪk ||; ˌpɛsəˈmɪstɪk/ adj [OPP] optimistic 反义词为optimistic ➔pessimistically /-kli ||; -klɪ/ adv [OPP] optimistically 反义词为optimistically

pessimist
/ˈpesɪmɪst ||; ˈpɛsəmɪst/noun [C] a person who always thinks that bad things will happen or that sth will be not be successful 悲观者；悲观主义者 [OPP] optimist 反义词为optimist

pest
/pest ||; pɛst/noun[C]
1 an insect or animal that destroys plants, food, etc （破坏植物、粮食等的）害虫，有害的动物
2 (informal 非正式) a person or thing that annoys you 令人讨厌的人或事物: That child is such a pest! 那个孩子真是个讨厌鬼！

pester
/ˈpestə(r) ||; ˈpɛstɚ/verb [T] pester sb (for sth);pester sb (to do sth) to annoy sb, for example by asking him/her sth many times 缠着某人（要某物或要做某事）: to pester sb for money 缠着某人要钱 The kids kept pestering me to take them to the park. 这些孩子老是缠着我，要我带他们去公园。

pesticide
/ˈpestɪsaɪd ||; ˈpɛstəˌsaɪd/noun [C,U] a chemical substance that is used for killing animals, especially insects, that eat food crops （农用）杀虫剂；农药 ☞Look at insecticide. 参看insecticide。

pestle
/ˈpesl ||; ˈpɛsḷ/noun [C] a small heavy tool with a round end used for crushing food, etc into powder in a special bowl(a mortar) 杵；捣锤 ☞picture at laboratory 见laboratory插图

*pet
/pet ||; pɛt/noun[C]
1 an animal or bird that you keep in your home for pleasure rather than for food or work 宠物；玩赏动物: a pet dog/cat/hamster 养作宠物的狗╱猫╱仓鼠 a pet shop (= where pets are sold) 宠物店
2 a person who is treated as a favourite 受宠爱的人；宠儿；宝贝: teacher's pet 老师的得意门生

petal
/ˈpetl ||; ˈpɛtḷ/noun [C] one of the thin soft coloured parts of a flower 花瓣 ☞pictures at flower and on page C2 见flower及C2页插图

peter
/ˈpi:tə(r) ||; ˈpitɚ/verb peter out to slowly become smaller, quieter, etc and then stop 逐渐缩小、停止或消失

ˌpet ˈhate
noun [C] sth that you particularly do not like 特别讨厌的事情: Filling in forms is one of my pet hates. 填表格是我特别讨厌的事之一。

petite
/pəˈti:t ||; pəˈtit/adj (used about a girl, woman or her figure) small and thin ﹙女孩等﹚娇小的: a petite blonde 娇小的金发女郎

petition
/pəˈtɪʃn ||; pəˈtɪʃən/noun [C] a written document, signed by many people, that asks a government, etc to do or change sth 请愿书；陈情书: More than 50000 people signed the petition protesting about the new road. 超过50000人签署请愿书，抗议兴建那条新道路的事。 petition verb [I,T]

Petri dish
/ˈpetri dɪʃ;ˈpi:tri||; ˈpɛtrɪ ˌdɪʃ/noun [C] (technical术语) a covered dish that is not very deep, used for growing bacteria, etc in 皮氏培养皿 ☞picture at laboratory 见laboratory插图

petrified
/ˈpetrɪfaɪd ||; ˈpɛtrəˌfaɪd/adj very frightened 吓呆了的

petro-
/ˈpetrəʊ ||; ˈpɛtro/prefix (used in nouns, adjectives and adverbs 用于构成名词、形容词及副词)
1 connected with rocks 与岩石有关: petrology 岩石学
2 connected with petrol 与石油有关: petrochemical 石油化学的

petrochemical
/ˌpetrəʊˈkemɪkl ||; ˌpɛtroˈkɛmɪkḷ/noun [C] any chemical substance obtained from petrol or natural gas 石油化学制品

*petrol
/ˈpetrəl ||; ˈpɛtrəl/ (US 美 gasgasoline) noun [U] the liquid that is used as fuel for vehicles such as cars and motorbikes 汽油 ☞Look at diesel. 参看diesel。

petroleum
/pəˈtrəʊliəm ||; pəˈtrolɪəm/noun [U] mineral oil that is found under the ground or sea and is used to make petrol, plastic and other types of chemical substances 石油

peˌtroleum ˈjelly
(US also 美亦作petrolatum /ˌpetrəˈleɪtəm ||; ˌpɛtrəˈletəm/) noun [U] a soft clear substance obtained from petroleum, used to heal injuries on the skin or to make machine parts move together more smoothly 矿脂，石油冻﹙用于伤口或润滑机器部件﹚

ˈpetting zoo
noun [C] (US 美) a park containing many kinds of animals that children can touch ﹙儿童可抚摸动物的﹚动物园

ˈpetrol station
(US 美 gas station) noun [C] a place where you can buy petrol and other things for your car （汽车）加油站 ☞Look at garage. 参看garage。

petty
/ˈpeti ||; ˈpɛtɪ/adj
1 small and unimportant 小的；琐碎的；不重要的: He didn't want to get involved with the petty details. 他不想牵扯到琐碎的细节。 petty crime/theft (= that is not very serious) 轻微罪行；小偷小摸
2 unkind or unpleasant to other people (for a reason that does not seem very important) 气量小；心胸狭窄；小器；小心眼: petty jealousy/revenge 心胸狭窄的妒忌╱报复

ˌpetty ˈcash
noun [U] a small amount of money kept in an office for small payments 小额现金

pew
/pju:/noun [C] one of the long wooden seats in a church 教堂长椅

pewter
/ˈpju:tə(r) ||; ˈpjutɚ/noun [U] a grey metal that is made from two other metals(tin)and(lead), used especially in the past for making cups, dishes, etc; objects made from this metal 白镴（锡、铅合金，旧时尤用于制杯子、碟子等）；白镴制品

PG
/ˌpi: ˈdʒi: ||; ˌpi ˈdʒi/abbr (Brit 英) (used about films in which there are scenes that are unsuitable for children) parental guidance （指部份场面不适合儿童看的影片）家长指导级，辅导级

pH
/ˌpi: ˈeɪtʃ ||; ˌpi ˈetʃ/noun [sing] a measurement of the level of acid or ALKALIin a substance pH值（物质中含酸或碱程度的计量单位） A pH value of below 7 shows an acid and of above 7 shows an alkali. pH值低于7呈酸性，高于7呈碱性。

phagocyte
/ˈfægəsaɪt ||; ˈfægəˌsaɪt/noun [C] (technical术语) a type of cell in the body that can surround smaller cells or small pieces of material and take them into itself 吞噬细胞

phantom
/ˈfæntəm ||; ˈfæntəm/noun[C]
1 (written 书面语) the spirit of a dead person that is seen or heard by sb who is still living 幽灵；鬼魂 Ghost is a more common word. ghost较常用。
2 something that you think exists, but that is not real 幻影；幻象: phantom fears/illnesses 幻觉恐惧；幻觉症

pharaoh
/feərəʊ ||; ˈfɛro/noun [C] a ruler of ancient Egypt 法老﹙古埃及国王﹚

pharmaceutical
/ˌfɑ:məˈsju:tɪkl; US -ˈsju:-;-ˈsu:- ||; ɝɛḷɛTɛ; ˌfɑrməˈsutɪkḷ/adj connected with the production of medicines and drugs 与制药有关的: pharmaceutical companies 制药公司

pharmacist
/ˈfɑ:məsɪst ||; ˈfɑrməsɪst/ =CHEMIST(1)

pharmacology
/ˌfɑ:məˈkɒlədʒi ||; ˌfɑrməˈkɑlədʒɪ/noun [U] (technical术语) the scientific study of drugs and their use in medicine 药理学；药物学 ➔pharmacological /ˌfɑ:məkəˈlɒdʒɪkl ||; ˌfɑrməkəˈlɑdʒɪkḷ/ adj pharmacological research 药物研究

pharmacy
/ˈfɑ:məsi ||; ˈfɑrməsɪ/noun (plural pharmacies)
1 [C] a shop or part of a shop where medicines and drugs are prepared and sold 药店；药房
A shop that sells medicine is also called a chemist's (shop) in British English or a drugstore in American English. 卖药的商店英国英语亦称为chemist's (shop)，美国英语称为drugstore。
2 [U] the preparation of medicines and drugs 配药；制药

pharynx
/ˈfærɪŋks ||; ˈfærɪŋks/noun [C] the soft area at the top of the throat where the passages to the nose and mouth connect with the throat 咽

*phase¹
/feɪz ||; fez/noun [C] a stage in the development of sth （某事物发展的）阶段: Julie went through a difficult phase when she started school. 朱莉开始上学时经历了一段艰难的时期。
phase²
/feɪz ||; fez/verb phase sth in to introduce or start using sth gradually in stages over a period of time 分阶段引进；逐步实施: The metric system was phased in over several years. 公制分数年逐步推行。 phase sth out to stop using sth gradually in stages over a period of time 分阶段淘汰，逐步取消: The older machines are gradually being phased out and replaced by new ones. 旧的机器正逐渐淘汰，由新的机器取代。

PhD
/ˌpi: eɪtʃ ˈdi: ||; ˌpi etʃ ˈdi/abbr Doctor of Philosophy; an advanced university degree that you receive when you complete a piece of research into a special subject 哲学博士: She has a PhD in History. 她有历史哲学博士学位。 [SYN] DPhil 同义词为DPhi

pheasant
/ˈfeznt ||; ˈfɛzṇt/noun [C] (plural pheasants or pheasant) a type of bird with a long tail. The males have brightly coloured feathers. Pheasants are often shot for sport and eaten. 雉；野鸡

phenomenal
/fəˈnɒmɪnl ||; fəˈnɑmənḷ/adj very great or impressive 很了不起的；显著的；惊人的；非凡的: phenomenal success 惊人的成就 ➔phenomenally /-nəli ||; -nḷɪ/ adv

phenomenon
/fəˈnɒmɪnən; US -nɒn ||; fəˈnɑməˌnɑn/noun [C] (plural phenomena /-ɪnə ||; -ənə/) a fact or an event in nature or society, especially one that is not fully understood 现象: Acid rain is not a natural phenomenon. It is caused by pollution. 酸雨不是自然现象，而是由污染造成的。

phew
/fju: ||; fju/ exclamation a sound which you make to show that you are hot, tired or happy that sth bad did not happen or has finished （用于表示炎热、疲倦、为某不好的事未发生或终于结束而松一口气的声音）: Phew, it's hot! （发出口哨声）真热！ Phew, I'm glad that interview's over! （发出口哨声）面试结束了，真高兴！

philanthropist
/fɪˈlænθrəpɪst ||; fəˈlænθrəpɪst/noun [C] a rich person who helps the poor and those in need, especially by giving money 慈善家，乐善好施的人（尤指捐钱）

philanthropy
/fɪˈlænθrəpi ||; fəˈlænθrəpɪ/noun [U] (formal 正式) the practice of helping the poor and those in need, especially by giving money 慈善事业（尤指通过捐钱） ➔philanthropic /ˌfɪlənˈθrɒpɪk ||; ˌfɪlənˈθrɑpɪk/ adj philanthropic work 慈善工作 ➔philanthropically /ˌfɪlənˈθrɒpɪkli ||; ˌfɪlənˈθrɑpɪklɪ/ adv

philo-
/ˈfɪləʊ ||; ˈfɪlo/prefix (used in nouns, adjectives, verbs and adverbs 用于构成名词、形容词、动词及副词) liking 爱好: philanthropist 慈善家

philosopher
/fəˈlɒsəfə(r) ||; fəˈlɑsəfɚ/noun [C] a person who has developed a set of ideas and beliefs about the meaning of life 哲学家

philosophical
/ˌfɪləˈsɒfɪkl ||; ˌfɪləˈsɑfɪkḷ/ (also philosophic) adj
1 of or concerning philosophy 哲学的；与哲学有关的: a philosophical debate 哲学辩论
2 philosophical (about sth) staying calm and not getting upset or worried about sth bad that happens （面对不好的事）泰然自若，达观，沉着: He is quite philosophical about failing the exam and says he will try again next year. 对于考试不及格，他泰然自若，并表示明年再试一下。 ➔philosophically /-kli ||; -klɪ/ adv

*philosophy
/fəˈlɒsəfi ||; fəˈlɑsəfɪ/noun (plural philosophies)
1 [U] the study of ideas and beliefs about the meaning of life 哲学
2 [C] a set of beliefs that tries to explain the meaning of life or give rules about how to behave 哲学思想；哲学体系；人生哲学: Her philosophy is ‘If a job's worth doing, it's worth doing well’. 她的人生哲学是：“如果一件工作值得做，就值得好好做。”

phlegm
/flem ||; flɛm/noun [U] the thick substance that is produced in your nose and throat when you have a cold 痰

phlegmatic
/flegˈmætɪk ||; flɛgˈmætɪk/adj (formal 正式) not easily made angry or upset; calm 沉着的；冷静的；镇定的；沉得住气的

phloem
/ˈfləʊem ||; ˈfloɛm/noun [U] (technical术语) the material in a plant containing very small tubes that carry sugars and other substances down from the leaves （植物的）韧皮部 ☞picture at flower 见flower插图

phobia
/ˈfəʊbiə ||; ˈfobɪə/noun [C] (often used in compounds 常用于构成复合词) a very strong fear or hatred that you cannot explain （无法解释的）恐惧，厌恶: arachnophobia (= fear of spiders) 恐蜘蛛症

*phone
/fəʊn ||; fon/noun (informal 非正式)
1 [U] =TELEPHONE(1) a phone conversation 电话交谈；通电话 · You can book the tickets over the/by phone. 你可用电话订票。
2 [C] = TELEPHONE(2) The phone is ringing -- could you answer it? 电话铃在响，你去接好吗？ phone verb [I,T] Did anybody phone while I was out? 我不在时有人打电话来吗？ Could you phone the restaurant and book a table? 你打电话到那饭店订一个桌子可以吗？ [SYN] ring or call 同义词为ring或call
on the phone/telephone
1 using the telephone 在打电话
2 having a telephone in your home （家里）装有电话: I'll have to write to her because she's not on the phone. 她家里没有电话，我得写信给她。

ˈphone book
=TELEPHONE DIRECTORY

phone booth ( also telephone booth)
noun [C] a small place that is partly enclosed, containing a public telephone, in a hotel, restaurant, in the street, etc 公用电话间；电话亭

ˈphone box
=TELEPHONE BOX

phonecard
/ˈfəʊnkɑ:d ||; ˈfonˌkɑrd/noun [C] a small plastic card that you can use to pay for calls in a public telephone box 电话卡 ☞picture at telephone 见telephone插图

ˈphone-in
noun [C] a radio or television programme during which you can ask a question or give your opinion by telephone （电台听众或电视台观众）来电话发问或表达意见的节目；叩应节目

phonetic
/fəˈnetɪk ||; fəˈnɛtɪk/adj
1 connected with the sounds of human speech; using special symbols to represent these sounds 和语音有关的；标示语音的: the phonetic alphabet 音标 ☞Look at transcribe. 参看transcribe。
2 (used about spelling) having a close relationship with the sounds represented （指拼写）跟发音关系密切的: Spanish spelling is phonetic, unlike English spelling. 西班牙语的拼写不同于英语的拼写，它与发音关系密切。 ➔phonetically /-kli ||; -klɪ/ adv

phonetics
/fəˈnetɪks ||; fəˈnɛtɪks/noun [U] the study of the sounds of human speech 语音学

phoney
/ˈfəʊni ||; ˈfonɪ/ (US 美 phony) adj not real; false 不实的；假的: She spoke with a phoney Russian accent. 她以假的俄罗斯口音说话。 ➔phoney(US 美 phony) noun [C]

phonics
/fɒnɪks ||; ˈfɑnɪks/noun [U] a method of teaching people to read based on the sounds that letters represent 语音教学法

phono-
/ˈfəʊnəʊ ||; ˈfono/prefix (used in nouns, adjectives and adverbs 用于构成名词、形容词及副词) connected with sound or sounds 与声或音有关: phonetic 语音的 phonics 语音学

phonograph
/fəʊnəgræf ||; ˈfonəˌgræf/noun [C] (old-fashioned 旧) = record player

phosphate
/ˈfɒsfeɪt ||; ˈfɑsfet/noun [C,U] (in chemistry) any salt or compound containing phosphorus, used in industry or for helping plants to grow 磷酸盐；磷酸酯

phosphorus
/ˈfɒsfərəs ||; ˈfɑsfərəs/noun [U] (symbol P) a chemical element found in several different forms, including as a poisonous, pale yellow substance that shines in the dark and starts to burn as soon as it is placed in air 磷

*photo
/ˈfəʊtəʊ ||; ˈfoto/noun [C] (plural photos /-təʊz ||; -toz/) (informal 非正式)=PHOTOGRAPH

photo-
/ˈfəʊtəʊ ||; ˈfoto/prefix (used in nouns, adjectives, verbs and adverbs 用于构成名词、形容词、动词及副词)
1 connected with light 与光有关: photosynthesis 光合作用
2 connected with photography 与摄影有关: photocopier 复印机

photocopier
/ˈfəʊtəʊkɒpiə(r) ||; ˈfotoˌkɑpɪɚ/noun [C] a machine that makes copies of documents by photographing them 复印机；复印机

photocopy
/ˈfəʊtəʊkɒpi ||; ˈfotoˌkɑpɪ/noun [C] (plural photocopies) a copy of a document, a page in a book, etc that is made by a photocopier 复印本；影印本 [SYN] Xerox 同义词为Xerox ☞Look at copy. 参看copy。 photocopy verb [I,T] (present participle photocopying third person singular present photocopies;past tense past participle photocopied)

ˌphoto ˈfinish
noun [C, usually sing] the end of a race in which the leading runners or horses are so close together that only a photograph of them passing the finishing line can show which is the winner 摄影定名次﹙竞赛结果十分接近，以终点线摄影决定结果﹚

photogenic
/ˌfəʊtəʊˈdʒenɪk ||; ˌfotoˈdʒɛnɪk/adj (used especially about a person) looking attractive in photographs ﹙尤指人﹚上镜的: I'm not very photogenic. 我不太上镜。

*photograph
/ˈfəʊtəgrɑ:f; US -græf ||; ˈfotəˌgræf/ (also photo) noun [C] a picture that is taken with a camera 相片；照片: to take a photograph 拍照 She looks younger in real life than she did in the photograph. 她本人看上去比相片上的年轻。 ☞Look at negative and slide. 参看negative及slide。 photograph verb [T]

photographer
/fəˈtɒgrəfə(r) ||; fəˈtɑgrəfɚ/noun [C] a person who takes photographs 摄影者；摄影师 ☞Look at cameraman. 参看cameraman。

photographic
/ˌfəʊtəˈgræfɪk ||; ˌfotəˈgræfɪk/adj connected with photographs or photography 摄影的；与摄影有关的

photography
/fəˈtɒgrəfi ||; fəˈtɑgrəfɪ/noun [U] the skill or process of taking photographs 摄影术；摄影

photojournalism
/ˌfəʊtəʊˈdʒɜ:nəlɪzəm ||; ˌfotoˈdʒɝnəˌlɪzəm/noun [U] the work of reporting news using mainly photographs, especially in a magazine 图片新闻报道；摄影新闻报道

photon
/ˈfəʊtɒn ||; ˈfotɑn/noun [C] a unit of a certain type of energy(electromagnetic energy), for example light 光子（一种电磁能，如光）

photosynthesis
/ˌfəʊtəʊˈsɪnθəsɪs ||; ˌfotəˈsɪnθəsɪs/noun [U] the process by which green plants turn CARBON DIOXIDEand water into food using energy from sunlight 光合作用

phototropism
/ˌfəʊtəʊˈtrəʊpɪzəm ||; foˈtɑtrəˌpɪzəm/noun [U] (technical术语) the action of a plant turning towards or away from light 向旋光性 ➔phototropic adj

phrasal verb
/ˌfreɪzl ˈvɜ:b ||; ˌfrezḷ ˈvɝb/noun [C] (grammar语法) a verb that is combined with an adverb or a preposition, or sometimes both, to give a new meaning, such as ‘look after’ or ‘put sb off’ 短语动词（与副词或介词连用而产生新意义的动词，如look after或put sb off） ☞Look at verb. 参看verb。

*phrase¹
/freɪz ||; frez/noun [C] (grammar语法) a group of words that are used together. A phrase does not contain a full verb. 词组，短语，词组（一同使用的一组词语，其中没有实义动词）: ‘First of all’ and ‘a bar of chocolate’ are phrases. first of all（首先）及a bar of chocolate（一条巧克力）都是短语。 ☞Look at sentence. 参看sentence。
phrase²
/freɪz ||; frez/verb [T] to express sth in a particular way 用某种方式表达: The statement was phrased so that it would offend no one. 这份声明措辞小心，以免冒犯任何人。

ˈphrase book
noun [C] a book that gives common words and useful phrases in a foreign language. People often use phrase books when they travel to another country whose language they do not know （外语）常用语手册，惯用语集（供不懂外语的人到外国旅行时用）

phylum
/ˈfaɪləm ||; ˈfaɪləm/noun [C] (plural phyla /-lə ||; -lə/) a group into which animals, plants, etc are divided, smaller than a KINGDOM(2) and larger than a CLASS¹(4) 门（生物的一种分类，小于界，大于纲）

*physical
/ˈfɪzɪkl ||; ˈfɪzɪkḷ/adj
1 connected with your body rather than your mind 身体的: physical fitness/strength/disabilities 身体健康；体力；身体残疾
2 (only before a noun 只用于名词前) connected with real things that you can touch, or with the laws of nature 与实物有关的；与自然规律有关的: physical geography (= the natural features on the face of the earth) 自然地理学
3 (only before a noun 只用于名词前) connected with the study of natural forces(physics)and things that are not alive 物理的 ➔physically /-kli ||; -klɪ/ adv to be physically fit 身体很健康 · It will be physically impossible to get to London before ten. 要在十时前抵达伦敦实际上是不可能的。

ˌphysical eduˈcation
noun [U] (abbr PE) sport and exercise that is taught in schools 体育教育；体育课

physician
/fɪˈzɪʃn ||; fəˈzɪʃən/ (US 美) (formal 正式)=DOCTOR¹(1)

physicist
/ˈfɪzɪsɪst ||; ˈfɪzəsɪst/noun [C] a person who studies or is an expert in physics 物理学家；物理学研究者

*physics
/ˈfɪzɪks ||; ˈfɪzɪks/noun [U] the scientific study of natural forces such as light, sound, heat, electricity, pressure, etc 物理学

physio-
/ˈfɪziəʊ ||; ˈfɪzɪˌo/prefix (used in nouns, adjectives and adverbs 用于构成名词、形容词及副词)
1 connected with nature 与自然有关
2 connected with PHYSIOLOGY(= the way in which living things function, and the scientific study of this) 与生理学有关

physiologist
/ˌfɪziˈɒlədʒɪst ||; ˌfɪzɪˈɑlədʒɪst/noun [C] a scientist who studies how living things function 生理学家

physiology
/ˌfɪziˈɒlədʒi ||; ˌfɪzɪˈɑlədʒɪ/noun [U] the scientific study of how living things function 生理学

physiotherapist
/ˌfɪziəʊˈθerəpɪst ||; ˌfɪzɪoˈθɛrəpɪst/noun [C] a person who is trained to use physiotherapy 物理治疗师；理疗师

physiotherapy
/ˌfɪziəʊˈθerəpi ||; ˌfɪzɪoˈθɛrəpɪ/ (US 美 ˌphysical ˈtherapy) noun [U] the treatment of disease or injury by exercise, light, heat, rubbing the muscles (massage), etc 物理治疗；理疗

physique
/fɪˈzi:k ||; fɪˈzik/noun [C] the size and shape of a person's body 体形；体格: a strong muscular physique 肌肉发达的体格

pi
/paɪ ||; paɪ/noun [sing] the symbol π used to show the relation between the CIRCUMFERENCE of a circle (= the distance around it) and its DIAMETER(= the distance across it) that is about 3.14159 圆周率(π)（圆周与直径之比，即3.14159）

pianist
/ˈpɪənɪst ||; ˈpiənɪst/noun [C] a person who plays the piano 钢琴演奏者；钢琴家

*piano
/piˈænəʊ ||; pɪˈæno/noun [C] (plural pianos /-nəʊz ||; -noz/) a large musical instrument that you play by pressing down black and white keys 钢琴: an upright piano 立式钢琴 a grand piano 大钢琴 We usually say ‘play the piano, the violin, the guitar, etc’ I've been learning the piano for four years. When talking about modern music such as jazz, rock, etc, ‘play drums, guitar, etc’ is more usual without the use of 'the' He plays bass in a band. This recording features Miles Davis on trumpet. 注意：弹钢琴通常要说play the piano，演奏小提琴要说play the violin，弹吉他要说play the guitar等等：I've been learning the piano for four years.四年来我一直在学习弹钢琴。至于爵士乐、摇滚乐等现代音乐，以及“打鼓、弹吉他等”则往往不与the连用：He plays bass in a band.他在乐队里演奏低音乐器。·This recording features Miles Davis on trumpet.这盘录音带主要是由迈尔斯．戴维斯吹奏小号。
piccolo
/ˈpɪkələʊ ||; ˈpɪkəˌlo/noun [C] (plural piccolos) a musical instrument like a small FLUTE (= an instrument like a pipe that you hold sideways and play by blowing over a hole at one side) that plays high notes 短笛

*pick¹
/pɪk ||; pɪk/verb[T]
1 to choose sb/sth from a group of people or things 选出；挑出；挑选: I was upset not to be picked for the team. 我没有获选加入球队，心里很难过。 Have I picked a bad time to visit? 我这次来得不是时候吗？
2 to take a flower, fruit or vegetable from the place where it is growing 采，摘（花朵、水果或蔬菜）: to pick flowers/grapes/cotton 摘花；摘葡萄；摘棉花
3 to remove a small piece or pieces of sth with your fingers （用手指）掏，扒，挖掉（细小的东西）: Don't pick your nose! 别挖鼻孔！ She picked a hair off her jacket. 她从短上衣上拈去一根头发。
4 pick your way across, over, through, etc sth to walk carefully, choosing the best places to put your feet 小心行走；挑好地点踩
have a bone to pick with sb→BONE¹ pick a fight (with sb) to start a fight with sb deliberately 故意招惹某人打架 pick a lock to open a lock without using a key 撬锁 pick and choose to choose only the things that you like or want very much 挑三拣四；挑挑拣拣 pick sb's pocket to steal money, etc from sb's pocket or bag 扒窃 pick at sth
1 to eat only small amounts of food because you are not hungry 只吃一点点；无食欲地吃
2 to touch sth many times with your fingers 用手指触摸多次；抓弄
pick on sb to behave unfairly or in a cruel way towards sb 跟某人过不去；找某人的岔子 pick sb/sth out to choose or recognize sb/sth from a number of people or things; identify （从很多人或对象中）选出，认出: I immediately picked Jean out in the photo. 我立刻在那张相片中认出琼。 pick up to become better; to improve 好转；改善 pick sb up to collect sb, in a car, etc （用车等）接载某人: We've ordered a taxi to pick us up at ten. 我们已经叫了一辆出租车十点来接我们。 pick sb/sth up
1 to take hold of and lift sb/sth 捡起；拿起；提起: Lucy picked up the child and gave him a cuddle. 露西抱起那小孩，紧紧搂了他一下。
2 to receive an electronic signal, sound or picture 收听到，收看到（电子信号、声音或图片）: In the north of France you can pick up English television programmes. 在法国北部可以收看到英国的电视节目。
pick sth up
1 to learn sth without formal lessons 没有正式上课而学会某事物；自然学会: Joe picked up a few words of Spanish on holiday. 乔度假的时候学会了几个西班牙语词。
2 to get or find sth 得到；找到: I picked up this book at the market. 我在市场上买到这本书。
3 to go and get sth; to collect sth 取: I have to pick up my jacket from the cleaner's. 我得去洗衣店取我的短上衣。
pick²
/pɪk ||; pɪk/noun
1 [sing] the one that you choose; your choice 选出来的东西；中意之物: You can have whichever cake you like. Take your pick. 你想要哪一个蛋糕都可以，挑你中意的吧。
2 [sing] the best of a group 精华；最佳的部份: You can see the pick of the new films at this year's festival. 你可以在今年的电影节中看到最佳的新影片。
3 (also pickaxe (US 美) pickax /ˈpɪkæks ||; ˈpɪkˌæks/) [C] a tool that consists of a curved iron bar with sharp points at both ends, fixed onto a wooden handle. Picks are used for breaking stones or hard ground. 鹤嘴锄；镐 ☞picture at garden 见garden插图

picket
/ˈpɪkɪt ||; ˈpɪkɪt/noun [C] a worker or group of workers who stand outside the entrance to a building to protest about sth, especially in order to stop people entering a factory, etc during a strike （尤指站在大楼外阻止不愿罢工工人上班的）罢工纠察队员，罢工纠察队 picket verb [I,T]

pickings
/pɪkɪŋz ||; ˈpɪkɪŋz/noun [pl] something that can be gained from a particular situation, especially in an easy or a dishonest way 油水: Bring plenty to eat. It's slim pickings here. 多带些吃的东西。这里没多少东西可以白吃的。 The strike affecting the country's largest airline is producing easy pickings for smaller companies. 这次影响该国最大航空公司的罢工给小公司提供了可趁之机。

pickle
/ˈpɪkl ||; ˈpɪkḷ/noun
1 [C] [usu.pl] (Brit 英) food such as fruit or vegetables that is put in salt water or VINEGAR(= a liquid with a strong sharp taste that is made from wine) so that it can be kept for a long time before being eaten 腌渍食物；泡菜
2 [U] a cold thick sauce with a strong flavour made from fruit and vegetables that have been boiled. Pickle is served with meat, cheese, etc 水果蔬菜沙司；腌汁
3 [C] (US 美) =GHERKIN pickle verb [T] pickled onions 腌制过的洋葱

pickpocket
/ˈpɪkpɒkɪt ||; ˈpɪkˌpɑkɪt/noun [C] a person who steals things from other people's pockets or bags in public places 扒手

pickup
/ˈpɪkʌp ||; ˈpɪkˌʌp/ (also pickup truck) noun [C] a type of vehicle that has an open part with low sides at the back 小卡车；轻型货车 ☞picture at truck 见truck插图

picky
/ˈpɪki ||; ˈpɪkɪ/adj (informal 非正式) (used about a person) liking only certain things and difficult to please （指人）难以取悦的，爱挑剔的 ☞Look at fussy. 参看fussy。

*picnic
/ˈpɪknɪk ||; ˈpɪknɪk/noun [C] a meal that you take with you to eat outdoors 户外用餐；野餐: We had a picnic on the beach. 我们在海滩野餐。 picnic verb [I] (present participle picnicking;past tense past participle picnicked)

pictogram
/ˈpɪktəgræm ||; ˈpɪktəˌgræm/noun [C] (technical术语)
1 a picture representing a word or phrase 象形文字
2 a diagram that uses pictures to represent amounts or numbers of a particular thing 象形图表

pictorial
/pɪkˈtɔ:riəl ||; pɪkˈtɔrɪəl/adj expressed in pictures 用图片表示的；图画的: pictorial representations of objects 用图片表现实物

*picture¹
/ˈpɪktʃə(r) ||; ˈpɪktʃɚ/noun[C]
1 a painting, drawing or photograph 画；图画；图片；照片: Who painted the picture in the hall? 大厅里那幅画是谁画的？ The teacher asked us to draw a picture of our families. 老师叫我们画一幅表现我们家庭的画。
2 an image on a television screen （电视的）画面，图像: They showed pictures of the crash on the news. 新闻节目里播放了那起坠机事故的画面。
3 a description of sth that gives you a good idea of what it is like 描述，描绘（以便使人了解真实的情景）: The police are trying to build up a picture of exactly what happened. 警方想要建构事情发生的实际场面。
picture²
/ˈpɪktʃə(r) ||; ˈpɪktʃɚ/verb[T]
1 picture sb/sth (as sth) to imagine sth in your mind 想象；构想: I can't picture Ivan as a father. 我无法想象伊凡当爸爸的样子。
2 to make a picture of sb/sth 绘；画；拍摄: She is pictured here with her parents. 她与她父母在这儿合照了一张。

picturesque
/ˌpɪktʃəˈresk ||; ˌpɪktʃəˈrɛsk/adj (usually used about an old building or place) attractive （通常指古建筑或地方）风景如画的: a picturesque fishing village 景色如画的渔村

*pie
/paɪ ||; paɪ/noun [C,U] a type of food consisting of fruit, meat or vegetables inside a pastry case 馅饼，派（内有水果、肉或蔬菜的烤饼）: apple pie 苹果馅饼 meat pie 肉馅饼 ☞picture on page C4 见C4页插图

*piece¹
/pi:s ||; pis/noun[C]
1 an amount or example of sth 片；块；段；张: a piece of paper 一张纸 a piece of furniture 一件家具 a good piece of work 一件好作品 a piece of advice/information/news 一个忠告；一段信息；一则新闻
2 one of the parts that sth is made of （组成某物的）部份，部件: We'll have to take the engine to piecesto find the problem. 我们得把引擎拆开，以便找出问题。
3 one of the parts into which sth breaks 碎片；碎块；断片: The plate fell to the floor and smashed to pieces. 碟子掉在地上打碎了。 The vase lay in pieces on the floor. 花瓶掉在地上，已经打碎了。
4 a piece (on/about sb/sth) an article in a newspaper or magazine （报纸或杂志上的）一篇文章: There's a good piece on China in today's paper. 今天报纸上有一篇关于中国的好文章。
5 a single work of art, music, etc 一件（艺术作品）；一首（乐曲）: He played a piece by Chopin. 他演奏了肖邦的一首作品。
6 one of the small objects that you use when you are playing games such as CHESS 棋子
7 a coin of the value mentioned 一枚…钱的硬币: a fifty-pence piece 一枚五十便士硬币
bits and pieces→BIT¹ give sb a piece of your mind to speak to sb angrily because of sth he/she has done 不客气地表达己意；怒责某人 go to pieces to be no longer able to work or behave normally because of a difficult situation （身体、精神等方面）垮掉，崩溃: When his wife died he seemed to go to pieces. 他妻子去世时，他悲伤得好像整个人都崩溃了。 in one piece not broken or injured 未损坏；未受伤；安然无恙: I've only been on a motorbike once, and I was just glad to get home in one piece. 我只骑过一回摩托车，能安然无恙回到家里真是太高兴了。 a piece of cake(informal 非正式) something that is very easy 轻而易举的事
piece²
/pi:s ||; pis/verb piece sth together
1 to discover the truth about sth from different pieces of information 拼凑出真相: Detectives are trying to piece together the last few days of the man's life. 侦探们想要勾勒出那名男子死前几天的情况。
2 to put sth together from several pieces 拼合；凑集；拼凑

piecemeal
/ˈpi:smi:l ||; ˈpisˌmil/adj adv done or happening a little at a time 零碎（地）；逐渐（地）

ˈpiece rate
noun [C] an amount of money paid for each thing or amount of sth that a worker produces 记件工资率；按件计酬

ˈpie chart
noun [C] a diagram consisting of a circle divided into parts to show the size of particular parts in relation to the whole 饼分图，圆形分析图（用圆的扇形面积来表示部份与整体的关系） ☞picture at chart 见chart插图

pier
/pɪə(r) ||; pɪr/noun[C]
1 a large wooden or metal structure that is built out into the sea from the land. Boats can stop at piers so that people or goods can be taken on or off. 码头（供船只上落客货的地方）
2 (in Britain) a large wooden or metal structure that is built out into the sea in holiday towns, where people can walk （英国）长堤，突堤，栈桥（建于海滨的度假城镇，形似码头，供人行走）

pierce
/pɪəs ||; pɪrs/verb
1 [T] to make a hole in sth with a sharp point （用尖物）刺穿，刺破，刺入，穿孔于: I'm going to have my ears pierced. 我要去穿耳洞。
2 [I,T] pierce (through/into) sth to manage to go through or into sth （声音、光线等）响彻，照进 · A scream pierced the air. 一声尖叫刺破长空。

piercing
/ˈpɪəsɪŋ ||; ˈpɪrsɪŋ/adj
1 (used about the wind, pain, a loud noise, etc) strong and unpleasant （指风、痛楚、噪音等）剧烈的，刺耳的，尖厉的，刺骨的
2 (used about sb's eyes or a look) seeming to know what you are thinking （指眼神或神态）能看透似的，敏锐的，有洞察力的

piety
/ˈpaɪəti ||; ˈpaɪətɪ/noun [U] a way of behaving that shows a deep respect for God and religion 虔诚；虔敬 ☞adjective pious 形容词为pious

*pig¹
/pɪg ||; pɪg/noun[C]
1 a fat pinkish animal with short legs and a short tail that is kept on farms for its meat (pork) 猪
A male pig is a boar, a female pig is a sow and a young pig is a piglet. When they make a noise, pigs grunt and piglets squeal. 公猪叫做boar，母猪叫做sow，小猪叫做piglet。大猪叫可用grunt，小猪叫可用squeal。 Look at the note at meat. 参看meat的注释。
2 (informal 非正式) an unpleasant person or a person who eats too much 令人讨厌的人；贪吃的人
pig²
/pɪg ||; pɪg/verb [T] (pigging;pigged) (slang 俚语)pig yourself to eat too much 吃太多 pig out (on sth)(slang 俚语) to eat too much of sth 贪吃某物

pigeon
/ˈpɪdʒɪn ||; ˈpɪdʒɪn/noun [C] a fat grey bird that often lives in towns 鸽子

ˈpigeon-hole
noun [C] one of a set of small open boxes that are used for putting papers or letters in 文件格；信箱

piggyback
/ˈpɪgibæk ||; ˈpɪgɪˌbæk/noun [C] the way of carrying sb, especially a child, on your back 背，背负（尤指背孩子）: to give sb a piggyback 背某人

ˈpiggy bank
noun [C] a small box, often shaped like a pig, that children save money in 储蓄罐，扑满（孩子储钱的地方，常为猪形）

ˌpig-ˈheaded
adj (informal 非正式) not prepared to change your mind or say that you are wrong 顽固的；固执的；刚愎的 ☞Look at stubborn and obstinate. 参看stubborn及obstinate。

ˈpig iron
noun [U] a form of iron that is not pure 生铁

piglet
/ˈpɪglət ||; ˈpɪglɪt/noun [C] a young pig 小猪

pigment
/ˈpɪgmənt ||; ˈpɪgmənt/noun [C,U] a substance that gives colour to things 色素: The colour of your skin depends on the amount of pigment in it. 肤色是由皮肤里的色素多少决定的。

pigpen
/pɪgpen ||; ˈpɪgˌpɛn/noun (US 美)
1 [C] = pigsty
2 [sing] (informal 非正式) a very dirty or messy house or room 肮脏﹙或凌乱﹚的房子﹙或房间﹚

pigskin
/pɪgskɪn ||; ˈpɪgˌskɪn/noun [sing] (US, informal 美，非正式) the ball used in American football ﹙美式﹚橄榄球

pigsty
/ˈpɪgstaɪ ||; ˈpɪgstaɪ/ (also sty (US 美) pigpen) noun [C] (plural pigsties) a small building where pigs are kept 猪栏；猪圈；猪舍

pigtail
/ˈpɪgteɪl ||; ˈpɪgˌtel/ (US 美 braid) noun [C] hair that is tied together in one or two thick pieces made by crossing three pieces of hair over each other (plaiting) 辫子

pilchard
/ˈpɪltʃəd ||; ˈpɪltʃɚd/noun [C] a small sea fish that you can eat 沙丁鱼；沙瑙鱼

*pile¹
/paɪl ||; paɪl/noun[C]
1 a number of things lying on top of one another, or an amount of sth lying in a mass （一）摞，迭，堆: a pile of books/sand 一堆书╱沙 He put the coins in neat piles. 他把硬币摞得整整齐齐。 She threw the clothes in a pile on the floor. 她把衣服成堆扔在地板上。 ☞A pile may be tidy or untidy. A heap is untidy. pile可以指整齐的一摞，也可以指不整齐的一堆，而heap则是指不整齐的一堆。
2 (usually plural 常用复数) (informal 非正式)piles of sth a lot of sth 大量；一大堆: I've got piles of work to do this evening. 今晚我有大量工作要做。
3 piles [pl] =HAEMORRHOIDS
pile²
/paɪl ||; paɪl/verb[T]
1 pile sth (up) to put things one on top of the other to form a pile 摞、迭或堆起来: We piled the boxes in the corner. 我们把箱子堆放在角落里。
2 pile A on(to) B;pile B with A to put a lot of sth on top of sth 把（大量的东西）堆在或放在（某物）上: She piled the papers on the desk. 她把文件堆在书桌上。 The desk was piled with papers. 书桌上堆满文件。
pile into, out of, off, etc sth(informal 非正式) to go into, out of, off, etc sth quickly and all at the same time 蜂拥而入╱出╱去: The children piled onto the bus. 孩子们一窝蜂挤进公共汽车。 pile up (used about sth bad) to increase in quantity （指坏事）积累，堆积: Our problems are really piling up. 我们的问题确实越积越多。

ˈpile-up
noun [C] a crash that involves several cars, etc 多车相撞: a multiple pile-up on the motorway 高速公路上一起多车相撞事故

pilgrim
/ˈpɪlgrɪm ||; ˈpɪlgrəm/noun [C] a person who travels a long way to visit a religious place 朝圣者；进香客

pilgrimage
/ˈpɪlgrɪmɪdʒ ||; ˈpɪlgrəmɪdʒ/noun [C,U] a long journey that a person makes to visit a religious place 朝圣；进香

pill
/pɪl ||; pɪl/noun
1 [C] a small round piece of medicine that you swallow 药丸；药片: Take one pill, three times a day after meals. 饭后服用，每日三次，每次一粒。 a sleeping pill 安眠药 ☞Look at tablet. 参看tablet。 ☞picture at health 见health插图
2 the pill [sing] a pill that some women take regularly so that they do not become pregnant （口服）避孕药: She is on the pill. 她在服用避孕药。

pillar
/ˈpɪlə(r) ||; ˈpɪlɚ/noun[C]
1 a column of stone, wood or metal that is used for supporting part of a building 柱子；支柱
2 a person who has a strong character and is important to sb/sth 重要成员；栋梁；中坚分子: Dave was a pillar of strength to his sister when she was ill. 戴夫的妹妹生病时，他是她有力的支柱。

ˈpillar box
noun [C] (in Britain) a tall round red box in a public place into which you can post letters, which are then collected by sb from the post office （英国）邮筒 ☞Look at postbox and letter box. 参看postbox及letter box。

pillion
/ˈpɪliən ||; ˈpɪljən/noun [C] a seat for a passenger behind the driver on a motorbike 摩托车后座 pillion adv to ride pillion on a motorbike 乘坐摩托车的后座

*pillow
/ˈpɪləʊ ||; ˈpɪlo/noun [C] a large cushion that you put under your head when you are in bed 枕头 ☞picture at bed 见bed插图

pillowcase
/ˈpɪləʊkeɪs ||; ˈpɪloˌkes/noun [C] a thin soft cloth cover for a pillow 枕头套

*pilot¹
/ˈpaɪlət ||; ˈpaɪlət/noun [C] a person who flies an aircraft 飞机驾驶员；飞行员: an airline pilot 航空公司的飞机驾驶员
pilot²
/ˈpaɪlət ||; ˈpaɪlət/verb[T]
1 to operate the controls of a vehicle, especially an aircraft or a boat 驾驶（交通工具，尤指飞机或船）: to pilot a ship 驾船
2 to lead sb/sth through a difficult situation 领导，指引，引导，带领（使渡过难关）: The booklet pilots you through the process of starting your own business. 这本小册子指导你如何自己创业。
3 to be the first to test sth that will be used by everyone 率先试验或试用: The new exam is being piloted in schools in Italy. 这种新考试正在意大利的学校试行。
pilot³
/ˈpaɪlət ||; ˈpaɪlət/adj (only before a noun 只用于名词前) done as an experiment or to test sth that will be used by everyone 试验性的；实验的: The pilot scheme will run for six months. 这个试验性计划将进行六个月。

pimple
/ˈpɪmpl ||; ˈpɪmpḷ/noun [C] a small spot on your skin 丘疹；小脓；粉刺

*pin¹
/pɪn ||; pɪn/noun[C]
1 a short thin piece of metal with a round head at one end and a sharp point at the other. Pins are used for fastening together pieces of cloth, paper, etc. 大头针
2 a thin piece of wood or metal that is used for a particular purpose 夹子: a hairpin 发夹 a two-pin plug 两脚插头 ☞picture at plug 见plug插图

PIN
/pɪn ||; pɪn/ (also PIN number) noun [C] [usu.sing] personal identification number; a number given to you by your bank so that you can use a plastic card to take out money from a cash machine 个人身分识别号（码）；个人密码
pin²
/pɪn ||; pɪn/verb [T] (pinning;pinned)
1 pin sth to/on sth;pin sth together to fasten sth with a pin or pins 用针别住；用夹子固定: Could you pin this notice on the board, please? 请你把这张通知钉在布告板上，可以吗？
