2 pin sb/sth against, to, under, etc sth to make sb/sth unable to move by holding or pressing down on him/her/it 使不能动弹；按住；压住: He caught his brother and pinned him to the floor. 他捉住他的弟弟，把他按在地板上。 He was pinned under the fallen tree. 他被那棵倒下来的树压住了。
pin (all) your hopes on sb/sth to believe completely that sb/sth will help you or will succeed 把希望全部寄托在…之上 pin sb down
1 to hold sb so he/she cannot move 使某人不能移动；按住某人
2 to force sb to decide sth or to say exactly what he/she is going to do 迫使某人决定某事；使确切地说明意图: Can you pin her down to what time she'll be coming? 你能叫她定下来访的时间吗？
pin sth down to describe or explain exactly what sth is 确切地描述或解释某事物

pinafore
/ˈpɪnəfɔ:(r) ||; ˈpɪnəˌfɔr/noun [C] (old-fashioned 旧) a piece of clothing or a dress that a woman can wear over her normal clothes to keep them clean when she is cooking or doing dirty jobs 围身布；围裙 ☞Look at apron. 参看apron。

pinball
/pɪnbɔ:l ||; ˈpɪnˌbɔl/noun [U] a game played on a machine, in which the player sends a small metal ball up a sloping board and scores points as it bounces off objects. The player tries to prevent the ball from reaching the bottom of the machine by pressing two buttons at the side. 弹球游戏

pincer
/ˈpɪnsə(r) ||; ˈpɪnsɚ/noun
1 pincers [pl] a tool made of two crossed pieces of metal that is used for holding things, pulling nails out of wood, etc 钳子；镊子
2 [C] one of the two sharp, curved front legs of some shellfish that are used for holding things （甲壳动物的）螯 ☞picture at shellfish 见shellfish插图

pinch¹
/pɪntʃ ||; pɪntʃ/verb
1 [T] to hold a piece of sb's skin tightly between your thumb and first finger, especially in order to hurt him/her （用拇指和食指），拧，掐: Paul pinched his brother and made him cry. 保罗掐他的弟弟，使他哭了起来。
2 [I,T] to hold sth too tight, often causing pain 紧紧夹住，挤压（往往引起痛楚）: I've got a pinched nerve in my neck. 我脖子里有根神经给压着很痛。
3 [T] (informal 非正式) to steal 偷窃: Who's pinched my pen? 谁偷了我的笔？
pinch²
/pɪntʃ ||; pɪntʃ/noun[C]
1 the holding of sb's skin tightly between your finger and thumb ；拧；掐: She gave him a little pinch on the arm. 她轻轻拧了他的胳膊一把。
2 the amount of sth that you can pick up with your thumb and first finger 一撮（用拇指和食指可拿取的分量）: a pinch of salt 一撮盐
at a pinch used to say that sth can be done if it is really necessary 必要时: We really need three cars but we could manage with two at a pinch. 我们确实需要三辆车，但必要时两辆也可应付过来。 take sth with a pinch of salt to think that sth is probably not true or accurate 半信半疑

pinched
/pɪntʃt ||; pɪntʃt/adj (used about sb's face) thin and pale because of illness or cold （指人的脸因疾病、寒冷等）瘦削苍白

ˈpinch-hit
verb [I] (US 美)
1 (in baseball 棒球) to hit the ball for another player 代击球；替补击球
2 pinch-hit (for sb) (informal 非正式) to do sth for sb else who is suddenly unable to do it 临时顶替；紧急替代

pine¹
/paɪn ||; paɪn/noun
1 [C] (also pine tree) a tall EVERGREEN tree that has thin sharp leaves (needles) 松树 Trees, like the pine, that do not lose their leaves in winter are called evergreen. 像松树等在冬天不会落叶的树木称为常绿树(evergreen)。
2 [U] the wood from pine trees (which is often used for making furniture) 松木（常用于制造家具）: a pine table 松木桌子
pine²
/paɪn ||; paɪn/verb [I] pine (for sb/sth) to be very unhappy because sb has died or gone away （因某人去世或离去而）悲伤: The dog sat outside, pining for its owner. 那条狗坐在外面，苦苦思念它的主人。

ˈpine nut
(brit also 英亦作 pine kernel) noun [C] the white seed of some PINE trees, used in cooking 松果

pineapple
/ˈpaɪnæpl ||; ˈpaɪnˌæpḷ/noun [C,U] a large sweet fruit that is yellow inside and has a thick brown skin with sharp points. Pineapples grow in hot countries. 菠萝；菠萝 ☞picture on page C3 见C3页插图

ping
/pɪŋ ||; pɪŋ/noun [C] a short high noise that is made by a small bell or by a metal object hitting against sth （小铃或金属对象撞击硬物所发出的）短而尖的声音；乒；铛: The lift went ping and the doors opened. 电梯铛地一声停下来，门开了。 ping verb [I]

ˈping-pong
(informal 非正式)=TABLE TENNIS

*pink
/pɪŋk ||; pɪŋk/adj noun [U] (of) a pale red colour 粉红色的；淡红色的

ˌpink ˈslip
noun [C] (US, informal 美，非正式) a letter given to sb to say that he/she must leave his/her job 解雇通知书；辞退信: About 40% of the department's 78 engineers received pink slips. 该部门 78 名工程师中有 40% 收到了辞退信。

ˈpink-slip
verb [T] (US 美) (pink-slipping; pink-slipped) to fire sb from his/her job 解雇；开除

pinnacle
/ˈpɪnəkl ||; ˈpɪnəkḷ/noun[C]
1 the most important or successful part of sth 顶点；极致: Celia is at the pinnacle of her career. 西莉亚的事业正处于顶峰状态。
2 a high pointed rock on a mountain 山峰；高峰

pinpoint
/ˈpɪnpɔɪnt ||; ˈpɪnˌpɔɪnt/verb[T]
1 to find the exact position of sth 找出某物的确切位置: to pinpoint a place on the map 找出某个地方在地图上的位置
2 to describe or explain exactly what sth is 准确地描述或解释: First we have to pinpoint the cause of the failure. 我们首先得确定失败的原因。

ˌpins and ˈneedles
noun [pl] a strange, sometimes painful feeling that you get in a part of your body after it has been in one position for too long and when the blood is returning to it 发麻；针刺感

*pint
/paɪnt ||; paɪnt/noun[C]
1 (abbr pt) a measure of liquid; 0.57 of a litre. There are 8 pints in a gallon 品脱（液体量度单位，一品脱等于0.57升，8品脱为一加仑）: a pint of milk 一品脱牛奶 An American pint is 0.47 of a litre. 美制一品脱等于0.47升。
2 (Brit 英) (informal 非正式) a pint of beer 一品脱啤酒

pint-sized ( also pint-size)
adj (informal 非正式) very small 非常小的

ˈpin-up
noun [C] (informal 非正式) a picture of an attractive person, made to be put on a wall; a person who appears in these pictures （挂在墙上的）漂亮人物的画像或照片；这类画像或照片里的人

pioneer
/ˌpaɪəˈnɪə(r) ||; ˌpaɪəˈnɪr/noun[C]
1 a pioneer (in/of sth) a person who is one of the first to develop an area of human knowledge, culture, etc 先锋；先驱者；开创者: Yuri Gagarin was one of the pioneers of space exploration. 尤里．加加林是太空探测的先驱之一。
2 a person who is one of the first to go and live in a particular area 拓荒者；开拓者；开辟者: the pioneers of the American West 美国西部的拓荒者 pioneer verb [T] a technique pioneered in the US 在美国开创的一项技术

pious
/ˈpaɪəs ||; ˈpaɪəs/adj having or showing a deep belief in religion 虔诚的；笃信的 ➔piously adv ☞noun piety 名词为piety

pip
/pɪp ||; pɪp/noun [C] (Brit 英) the small seed of an apple, a lemon, an orange, etc （苹果、柠檬、橙等的）种子，籽 ☞picture on page C3 见C3页插图

*pipe¹
/paɪp ||; paɪp/noun[C]
1 a tube that carries gas or liquid （输送气体或液体的）管子: Waste water is carried away down the drainpipe. 废水顺着排水管流走。
2 a tube with a small bowl at one end that is used for smoking tobacco 烟斗: to smoke a pipe 吸烟斗
3 a simple musical instrument that consists of a tube with holes in it. You blow into it to play it 管乐器
pipe²
/paɪp ||; paɪp/verb [T] to carry liquid or gas in pipes 用管子输送（液体或气体）: Water is piped to all the houses in the village. 水是经管道输送到村内各幢房子的。 pipe up(informal 非正式) to suddenly say sth 突然讲话: Suddenly Shirin piped up with a question. 希琳突然提出了一个问题。

pipeline
/ˈpaɪplaɪn ||; ˈpaɪpˌlaɪn/noun [C] a line of pipes that are used for carrying liquid or gas over a long distance （长距离输送液体或气体的）一排管道或管线 in the pipeline being planned or prepared 在计划中；在准备中

piper
/ˈpaɪpə(r) ||; ˈpaɪpɚ/noun [C] a person who plays music on a pipe, or who plays a musical instrument that is typical in Scotland (the bagpipes) 管乐吹奏者；风笛手

pipette
/pɪˈpet ||; pɪˈpɛt/noun [C] (technical术语) a narrow tube used in a LABORATORY for measuring or moving small amounts of liquids 吸量管；移液管 ☞picture at laboratory 见laboratory插图

ˌpiping ˈhot
adj (used about liquids or food) very hot ﹙液体或食物﹚滚烫的，烫手的

piracy
/ˈpaɪrəsi ||; ˈpaɪrəsɪ/noun[U]
1 the crime of attacking ships in order to steal from them 海盗行为；海上劫掠
2 the illegal copying of books, video tapes, etc 非法翻印；非法复制；盗印；盗制；盗录

pirate¹
/ˈpaɪrət ||; ˈpaɪrət/noun[C]
1 (usually in the past or in stories) a criminal who attacks ships in order to steal from them （通常指过去或故事中的）海盗
2 a person who copies books, video tapes, computer programs, etc in order to sell them illegally （为出售而）非法翻印或复制者，盗印者，盗制者，盗录者
pirate²
/ˈpaɪrət ||; ˈpaɪrət/verb [T] to make an illegal copy of a book, video tape, etc in order to sell it （为出售而）非法翻印，非法复制，盗印，盗制，盗录

Pisces
/ˈpaɪsi:z ||; ˈpaɪsiz/noun [U] the twelfth sign of the ZODIAC, the Fishes 黄道第十二宫；双鱼宫；双鱼星座

pistachio
/pɪˈstæʃiəʊ;-ˈstɑ:ʃiəʊ ||; pɪsˈtæʃɪˌo; -sˈtɑʃɪˌo/ (also piˈstachio nut) noun [C] (plural pistachios) the small green nut of an Asian tree 阿月浑子，开心果（一种绿色小坚果，产于亚洲） ☞picture at nut 见nut插图

pistil
/ˈpɪstɪl ||; ˈpɪstɪl/noun (technical术语) the female organs of a flower, which receive the POLLEN and produce seeds （花的）雌蕊

pistol
/ˈpɪstl ||; ˈpɪstḷ/noun [C] a small gun that you hold in one hand 手枪 ☞Look at the note at gun. 参看gun的注释。

piston
/ˈpɪstən ||; ˈpɪstṇ/noun [C] a piece of metal in an engine, etc that fits tightly inside a tube (shaft). The piston is moved up and down inside the tube and causes other parts of the engine to move. 活塞 ☞picture at hydraulic 见hydraulic插图

pit¹
/pɪt ||; pɪt/noun
1 [C] a large hole that is made in the ground 坑；沟；壕沟: They dug a large pit to bury the dead animals. 他们挖了一个大坑把死动物埋掉。
2 [C] =COAL MINE
3 the pits [pl] the place on a motor racing track where cars stop for fuel, new tyres, etc during a race （赛车道旁的）检修加油站
be the pits(slang 俚语) to be very bad 极坏；最低级: The food in that restaurant is the pits! 那家饭馆的饭菜很差劲！
pit²
/pɪt ||; pɪt/verb [T] (pitting;pitted) to make small holes in the surface of sth 使（某物表面）凹陷或出现坑坑洞洞: The front of the building was pitted with bullet marks. 那座建筑物的正面布满弹痕。 pit A against B to test one person or thing against another in a fight or competition 使较量；使相斗: The two strongest teams were pitted against each other in the final. 两支最强的队在总决赛中对垒。

pitch¹
/pɪtʃ ||; pɪtʃ/noun
1 [C] (Brit 英) a special area of ground where you play certain sports 球场: a football/hockey/cricket pitch 足球场；曲棍球场；板球场 ☞Compare court and field. 与court及field比较。
2 [sing] the strength or level of feelings, activity, etc （感情、活动等的）强度，程度: The children's excitement almost reached fever pitch. 孩子们兴奋得近乎疯狂。
3 [U] how high or low a sound is, especially a musical note （声调的）高低；音高；音调 ☞picture at high-pitched 见high-pitched插图
4 [C] talk or arguments used by sb who is trying to sell sth or persuade sb to do sth （推销商品的）叫卖语: a sales pitch 叫卖语 to make a pitch for sth 叫卖某物
pitch²
/pɪtʃ ||; pɪtʃ/verb
1 [T] to set sth at a particular level 把（某物）定于某水平: The talk was pitched at people with far more experience than me. 这个讲座是为经验比我丰富得多的人而设的。
2 [I,T] to throw sth/sb; to be thrown 投；掷；抛: Doug pitched his can into the bushes. 道格把罐子扔进灌木丛里。
3 [T] to put up a tent or tents 搭（帐篷）；扎（营）: They pitched their tents in the valley. 他们在山谷中扎营。
4 [T] pitch sth (at sb) to try to sell a product to a particular group of people or in a particular way 竭力推销: This new breakfast cereal is being pitched at kids. 这种新的谷类早点正向孩子们大力推销。
pitch in(informal 非正式) to join in and work together with other people 加入别人一起工作；协力做: Everybody pitched in to clear up the flood damage. 大家齐心协力，清理洪水造成的破坏。

ˌpitch-ˈblack
adj completely dark; with no light at all 漆黑的；黑暗无光的

pitcher
/ˈpɪtʃə(r) ||; ˈpɪtʃɚ/noun[C]
1 a large container for holding and pouring liquids （盛液体的）大罐，大壶 ☞picture at jug 见jug插图
2 (in baseball) the player who throws (pitches) the ball to a player from the other team, who tries to hit it （棒球）投手

pitchfork
/ˈpɪtʃfɔ:k ||; ˈpɪtʃˌfɔrk/noun [C] a farm tool like a fork with a long handle and two or three sharp metal points. It is used for lifting and moving dried cut grass(hay) 干草叉

piteous
/ˈpɪtiəs ||; ˈpɪtɪəs/adj (formal 正式) that makes you feel pity or sadness 可怜的；令人同情的；使人怜悯的 ➔piteously adv

pitfall
/ˈpɪtfɔ:l ||; ˈpɪtˌfɔl/noun [C] a danger or difficulty, especially one that is hidden or not obvious （尤指隐蔽的或不明显的）危险，困难，陷阱

pith
/pɪθ ||; pɪθ/noun [U] the white substance inside the skin of an orange, lemon, etc （橙、柠檬等外皮下的白色）衬皮

pithy
/ˈpɪθi ||; ˈpɪθɪ/adj expressed in a clear, direct way 清楚直接的；简炼的；简洁的: a pithy comment 言简意赅的评论

pitiful
/ˈpɪtɪfl ||; ˈpɪtɪfəl/adj causing you to feel pity or sadness 可怜的；令人同情的: the pitiful groans of the wounded soldiers 伤兵可怜的呻吟声 ➔pitifully /-fəli ||; -fəlɪ/ adv

pitiless
/ˈpɪtiləs ||; ˈpɪtɪlɪs/adj having or showing no pity for other people's suffering 无同情心的；无情的；对别人的苦痛无动于衷的 ➔pitilessly adv

ˈpit stop
noun [C]
1 (in motor racing 赛车) an occasion when a car stops during a race for more fuel, etc 停车加油﹙或维修等﹚
2 (US, informal 美，非正式) a short stop during a long trip for a rest, a meal, etc ﹙长途旅行中的﹚短暂休息，歇脚

pituitary
/pɪˈtju:ɪtəri ||; pɪˈtjuəˌtɛrɪ/ (also piˈtuitary gland) noun [C] (plural pituitaries) a small organ at the base of the brain that produces substances that affect growth and sexual development (hormones) （大脑基部的）垂体（分泌的物质影响到生长及性激素）

*pity¹
/ˈpɪti ||; ˈpɪtɪ/noun
1 [U] a feeling of sadness that you have for sb/sth that is suffering or in trouble 怜悯；可怜；恻隐之心: The situation is his fault so I don't feel any pity for him. 这境况是他自己造成的，因此我毫不可怜他。
2 [sing] something that makes you feel a little sad or disappointed 可惜的事情；遗憾的事情: ‘You're too late. Emily left five minutes ago.’ ‘Oh, what a pity !’ “你来得太迟了，埃米莉在五分钟前走了。”“哦，太遗憾了。” It's a pity that Bina couldn't come. 比娜来不了，真遗憾。
take pity on sb to help sb who is suffering or in trouble because you feel sorry for him/her 出于同情或怜悯而帮助某人
pity²
/ˈpɪti ||; ˈpɪtɪ/verb [T] (present participle pitying third person singular present pities;past tense past participle pitied) to feel pity or sadness for sb who is suffering or in trouble 同情；可怜；怜悯: We shouldn't just pity these people; we must help them. 对这些人我们不应该仅仅表示同情，我们还必须帮助他们。

pivot¹
/ˈpɪvət ||; ˈpɪvət/noun[C]
1 the central point on which sth turns or balances 支点；旋轴；枢轴
2 the central or most important person or thing 核心的或最重要的人或物: West Africa was the pivot of the cocoa trade. 西非是可可粉贸易中心。
pivot²
/ˈpɪvət ||; ˈpɪvət/verb [I] to turn or balance on a central point 在枢轴上转动；在支点上平衡

pixel
/ˈpɪksl ||; ˈpɪksəl/noun [C] (computing计算机技术) any of the very small individual areas on a computer screen, which together form the whole image （构成显示器上图像的）像素

pixie
/ˈpɪksi ||; ˈpɪksɪ/noun [C] (in children's stories) a creature like a small person with pointed ears that has magic powers （童话故事中）小精灵，小仙子

pizza
/ˈpi:tsə ||; ˈpitsə/noun [C,U] an Italian dish consisting of a flat round bread base with vegetables, cheese, meat, etc on top, which is cooked in an oven 意大利馅饼，比萨饼（用面粉、蔬菜、干酪、肉等烤制而成的扁圆形饼食）

pizzazz ( also pizazz)
/pɪˈzæz ||; pəˈzæz/noun [U] (informal 非正式) a lively and exciting quality or style 激情；活泼；风度: We need someone with youth, glamour and pizzazz. 我们需要一位年富力强、魅力十足、风度翩翩的人。

pizzeria
/ˌpi:tsəˈri:ə ||; ˌpitsəˈriə/ (US also 美亦作 pizza parlor) noun [C] a restaurant that serves mostly pizzas 比萨饼店；比萨饼餐馆

pizzicato
/ˌpɪtsɪˈkɑ:təʊ ||; ˌpɪtsɪˈkɑto/adj adv (technical术语) (in music) using the fingers to pull the strings of a musical instrument, for example a VIOLIN, that you usually play with a BOW (= a long thin piece of wood with strings stretched tightly across it) （用手指）拨奏

pl.
abbr (grammar语法) plural 复数；复数形式

placard
/ˈplækɑ:d ||; ˈplækɑrd/noun [C] a large written or printed notice that is put in a public place or carried on a stick in a protest march （贴在公共场所的）大海报；（抗议游行时手持的）标语牌

placate
/pləˈkeɪt; US ˈpleɪkeɪt ||; ˈpleket/verb [T] to make sb feel less angry about sth 缓和愤怒的情绪；安抚；抚慰

*place¹
/pleɪs ||; ples/noun[C]
1 a particular position or area 地方；地点: Show me the exact place where it happened. 给我指出事情发生的确切地点。 This would be a good place to sit down and have a rest. 在这里坐下来休息一会儿很不错。 The wall was damaged in several places. 这堵墙有几处受损了。
2 a particular village, town, country, etc 地方（指某村、镇、国家等）: Which places did you go to in Italy? 你意大利去了哪些地方？ Vienna is a very beautiful place. 维也纳是个很美丽的地方。
3 a building or an area that is used for a particular purpose （作某种用途的）建筑物，地区: The square is a popular meeting place for young people. 这个广场是年轻人约会处。 The town is full of inexpensive eating places. 这镇上到处都是价廉的餐馆。
4 a seat or position that can be used by sb/sth 座位；位子；位置: They went into the classroom and sat down in their places. 他们走进教室，坐在自己的位子上。 Go on ahead and save me a placein the queue. 你先去排队，给我留个位子。 ☞A place is a seat or position for sb/sth. A place where you can park your car is also called a space. You use space and room when you are talking about empty areas This piano takes up too much space. There is enough room for three people in the back of the car. place是指某人或某物的座位或位置。用来停放车辆的位置亦可叫做space。space和room用于指空间：This piano takes up too much space.这台钢琴占了太多空间。·There is enough room for three people in the back of the car.汽车的后座有足够空间容纳三个人。
5 [sing] your position in society; your role 社会地位；身分: I feel it is not my place to criticize my boss. 我认为我没有资格批评上司。
6 an opportunity to study at a college, play for a team, etc 入读某学校或入选某体育队伍的机会: Abina has got a place to study law at Hull. 阿比纳已获准进赫尔攻读法律。 Laila is now sure of a place on the team. 莱拉现已肯定入选该队。
7 the usual or correct position or occasion for sth 惯常或适当的位置；适当的场合: The room was tidy. Everything had been put away in its place. 那个房间很整齐，每样东西都放在适当的位置。 A funeral is not the place to discuss business. 葬礼不是谈生意的场合。
8 the position of a number after the DECIMAL POINT （小数点后的）位: Your answer should be correct to three decimal places. 你的答案必须准确到小数点后三位数。
9 [sing] (spoken 口语) a person's home 住所；寓所；家: Her parents have got a place on the coast. 她的父母在海滨有一处住所。
10 [usu.sing] the position that you have at the end of a race, competition, etc （赛跑、比赛等的）名次: Cara finished in second place. 卡拉得了第二名。
all over the place everywhere 到处 change/swap places (with sb) to take sb's seat, position, etc and let him/her have yours （与某人）交换座位或位置等: Let's change places so that you can look out of the window. 让我们换换座位吧，这样你就可以往窗外看。 fall/slot into place (used about sth that is complicated or difficult to understand) to become organized or clear in your mind （指复杂或费解的事物）变得清楚、有条不紊: After two weeks in my new job, everything suddenly started to fall into place. 我在新的岗位做了两个星期后，突然一切都开始明朗起来。 in my, your, etc place/shoes in my, your, etc situation or position 在我或你…的处境或地位: If I were in your place I would wait a year before getting married. 如果我处于你的情况，我会等一年再结婚。 in place
1 in the correct or usual position 在正确或通常的位置: Use tape to hold the picture in place. 用胶纸把图片固定住。
2 (used about plans or preparations) finished and ready to be used （指计划或准备工作）完成，就绪: All the preparations for the trip are now in place. 这次旅行的一切准备工作现在都已就绪。
in place of sb/sth;in sb/sth's place instead of sb/sth 代替；取代 in the first, second, etc place(informal 非正式) used when you are giving a list of reasons for sth or explaining sth; firstly, secondly, etc （用于解释或提出理由）第一，第二… out of place
1 not suitable for a particular situation 不合适；格格不入: I felt very out of place among all those clever people. 跟那些聪明人在一起，我真感到与他们格格不入。
2 not in the correct or usual place 不在适当或惯常的位置
put sb in his/her place to show that sb is not as clever, important, etc as he/she believes 使某人明白他或她并不那么聪明、重要…；煞某人的气焰: It really put her in her place when she failed to qualify for the race. 她没有获得参赛资格，这确实煞了煞她的气焰。 put yourself in sb's place to imagine that you are in the same situation as sb else 设身处地；站在他人的立场想: Put yourself in Steve's place and you will realize how worried he must be. 站在斯蒂夫的立场想想，你就知道他是多么担心了。 take place (used about a meeting, an event, etc) to happen （指会议、事件等）举行，发生，进行: The ceremony took place in glorious sunshine. 典礼在灿烂的阳光下举行。
*place²
/pleɪs ||; ples/verb[T]
1 (formal 正式) to put sth carefully or deliberately in a particular position 放置；安放: The chairs had all been placed in neat rows. 椅子都已整齐地一排一排放好了。 The poster was placed where everyone could see it. 海报贴在大家看得见的地方。
2 to put sb in a particular position or situation 使（某人）处于某境地或情况: His behaviour placed me in a difficult situation. 他的举动使我很尴尬。 to place sb in charge 任命某人当主管 Rhoda was placed third in the competition. 罗达在比赛中获得第三名。
3 used to express the attitude that sb has to sb/sth （用于表达某人对…的态度）: We placed our trust in you and you failed us. 我们信任你，而你却使我们失望。 The blame for the disaster was placed firmly on the company. 那场灾难的责任肯定要由那家公司承担。
4 (usually in negative statements 通常用于否定句) to recognize sb/sth and be able to identify him/her/it 认出；能够识别: Her face is familiar but I just can't place her. 她的脸很熟，但我就是想不起她是谁。
5 to give instructions about sth or to ask for sth to happen 下达关于某事的指令；要求让某事发生: to place a bet on sth 在某物身上下注 to place an order for sth 订购

ˈplace name
noun [C] the name of a city, town, etc 地名

placenta
/pləˈsentə ||; pləˈsɛntə/noun [C] the material inside the part of a woman's body where a baby grows(womb)which protects the baby and supplies the food through a tube(umbilical cord) 胎盘（位于子宫内，保护婴儿，并通过脐带为其提供食物）

placid
/ˈplæsɪd ||; ˈplæsɪd/adj (used about a person or an animal) calm and not easily excited （指人或动物）平静的，温和的 ➔placidly adv

plagiarism
/ˈpleɪdʒərɪzəm ||; ˈpledʒəˌrɪzəm/noun [U] [C] the act of copying another person's ideas, words or work and pretending they are your own; sth that has been copied in this way 抄袭；剽窃 ➔plagiarize(also -ise) /ˈpleɪdʒəraɪz ||; ˈpledʒəˌraɪz/ verb [T] [I]

plague¹
/pleɪg ||; pleg/noun
1 [C,U] any infectious disease that spreads quickly and kills many people 瘟疫
2 the plague [U] an infectious disease spread by rats that causes swellings on the body, a very high temperature and often results in death 腺鼠疫；肺鼠疫；鼠疫
3 [C] a plague of sth a large number of unpleasant animals or insects that come into an area at one time 同一时间侵扰某地方的一大群令人厌烦的动物或昆虫: a plague of ants/locusts 蚁灾；蝗灾
plague²
/pleɪg ||; pleg/verb [T] to cause sb/sth a lot of trouble 给…带来很多麻烦；使苦恼: The project was plagued by a series of disasters. 这项工程为接连发生的意外灾祸所困。

plaice
/pleɪs ||; ples/noun [C,U] (plural plaice) a type of flat sea fish that we eat 鲽

*plain¹
/pleɪn ||; plen/adj
1 easy to see, hear or understand; clear 清晰的；清楚的；明白的；浅易的: It was plain that he didn't want to talk about it. 他显然不想谈论这件事。 She made it plain that she didn't want to see me again. 她明确表示她不想再见到我。
2 (used about people, thoughts, actions, etc) saying what you think; direct and honest （指人、思想、行动等）直截了当的，坦率的，真诚的: I'll be plain with you. I don't like the idea. 坦白对你说，我不喜欢那主意。
3 simple in style; not decorated or complicated 朴素的；简朴的；简单的: My father likes plain English cooking. 我父亲喜欢清淡的英国菜。
4 (only before a noun 只用于名词前) all one colour; without a pattern on it 单色的；没有花纹的；素净的: a plain blue jumper 素净的蓝色套头毛衣
5 (used especially about a woman or girl) not beautiful or attractive （尤指妇女或女孩）不美的，相貌平庸的: She's a rather plain child. 她是个相貌平庸的女孩。
plain²
/pleɪn ||; plen/noun [C] a large area of flat land with few trees 平原
plain³
/pleɪn ||; plen/adv (spoken 口语) completely 完全: That's plain silly. 那么做十分愚蠢。

ˈplain clothes
adj (used about a police officer) in ordinary clothes; not uniform （指警察）穿便衣的: a plain-clothes detective 便衣警探 ➔ˈplain clothes noun [pl] officers in plain clothes 穿便衣的军官

ˌplain ˈflour
noun [U] flour that does not contain a powder (baking powder) which makes cakes, etc rise （不含发酵粉的）普通面粉 ☞Look at self-raising flour. 参看self-raising flour。

plainly
/ˈpleɪnli ||; ˈplenlɪ/adv
1 clearly 清楚地；显然: He was plainly very upset. 他显然很难过。
2 using simple words to say sth in a direct and honest way 直截了当；坦率地: She told him plainly that he was not doing his job properly. 她直截了当地对他说，他的工作做法不当。
3 in a simple way, without decoration 简朴；没有装饰: She was plainly dressed and wore no make-up. 她衣着简朴，也不化妆。

plaintiff
/ˈpleɪntɪf ||; ˈplentɪf/noun [C] a person who starts a legal action against sb in a court of law 原告 ☞Look at defendant. 参看defendant。

plaintive
/ˈpleɪntɪv ||; ˈplentɪv/adj sounding sad, especially in a weak complaining way （声音听来）哀伤的，悲伤的，悲哀的 ➔plaintively adv

plait
/plæt ||; plet/ (US 美 braid) verb [T] to cross three or more long pieces of hair, rope, etc over and under each other to make one thick piece （将头发、绳等）编成辫子，织成粗绳 ☞picture at hair 见hair插图 plait noun [C]

*plan¹
/plæn ||; plæn/noun
1 [C] a plan (for sth/to do sth) an idea or arrangement for doing or achieving sth in the future 打算；计划；方案: We usually make our holiday plansin January. 我们通常在一月份拟订我们的度假计划。 The firm has no plans to employ more people. 这家公司不打算增聘人手。 There has been a change of plan -- we're meeting at the restaurant. 计划有变动─我们将在餐馆见面。 If everything goes according to plan (= happens as we planned) we should be home by midnight. 如果一切按计划进行，我们午夜前应该可以到家。
2 [C] a detailed map of a building, town, etc （建筑物、城镇等的）详图: a street plan of Berlin 柏林的街道图
3 plans [pl] detailed drawings of a building, machine, road, etc that show its size, shape and measurements （建筑物、机器、道路等的）设计图，示意图，图样: We're getting an architect to draw up some plansfor a new kitchen. 我们正在找建筑师替新的厨房绘制设计图。
4 [C] a diagram that shows how sth is to be organized or arranged （显示组织或安排情况的）图表，计划表，进度表: Before you start writing an essay, it's a good idea to make a brief plan. 开始写文章前，最好先订出一个简单的大纲。
plan²
/plæn ||; plæn/verb (planning;planned)
1 [I,T] plan (sth) (for sth) to decide, organize or prepare for sth you want to do in the future 计划；筹划；安排 [I] to plan for the future 为未来做安排 You need to plan your work more carefully. 你要更用心地安排自己的工作。
2 [I,T] plan (on sth/doing sth); plan (to do sth) to intend or expect to do sth 打算做；想要做: I'm planning on having a holiday in July. 我打算在七月度假。 We plan to arrive at about 4 o'clock. 我们打算在4点钟左右到达。
3 [T] to make a diagram or a design of sth 绘设计图；设计: The new shopping centre is very badly planned. 新的购物中心设计得很差。 ➔planning noun [U]: The project requires careful planning. 这项工程需要仔细规划。

*plane¹
/pleɪn ||; plen/noun[C]
1 a vehicle that can fly through the air, with wings and one or more engines 飞机: Has her plane landed yet? 她乘坐的那班飞机降落了没有？
2 a tool used for making the surface of wood smooth by taking very thin pieces off it 刨子 ☞picture at tool 见tool插图
3 (technical术语) a flat surface 平面
plane²
/pleɪn ||; plen/verb [T] to make the surface of a piece of wood flat and smooth using a plane¹(2) 用刨子把…刨平
plane³
/pleɪn ||; plen/adj (only before a noun 只用于名词前) (technical术语) completely flat; level 平的；平坦的: a plane mirror 平面镜

planeload
/pleɪnləʊd ||; ˈplenˌlod/noun [C] the number of people or the amount of goods that can be carried in an airplane 一架飞机的载客量﹙或装货量﹚: two planeloads of refugees 两飞机的难民

*planet
/ˈplænɪt ||; ˈplænɪt/noun
1 [C] a very large round object in space that moves around the sun or another star 行星: the planets of our solar system 太阳系的行星
2 the planet [sing] the world we live in; the Earth, especially when talking about the environment （尤指谈论环境时）世界，地球

planetarium
/ˌplænɪˈteəriəm ||; ˌplænəˈtɛrɪəm/noun [C] a building with a curved ceiling that represents the sky at night. It is used for showing the positions and movements of the planets and stars for education and entertainment 天文馆

plank
/plæŋk ||; plæŋk/noun [C] a long flat thin piece of wood that is used for building or making things 木板（用于建筑或制造物品） ☞picture at vice 见vice插图

plankton
/ˈplæŋktən ||; ˈplæŋktən/noun [U] [pl] the very small forms of plant and animal life that live in seas, rivers, lakes, etc 浮游生物

ˌplanned eˈconomy
(also comˌmand eˈconomy) noun [C] an economy in which levels of pay, prices, production, etc are decided by the government 计划经济

planner
/ˈplænə(r) ||; ˈplænɚ/noun[C]
1 (also ˌtown ˈplanner) a person whose job is to plan the growth and development of a town （城镇发展的）规划者
2 a person who makes plans for a particular area of activity （某方面活动的）策划者，安排者: curriculum planners 课程设计者
3 a book, computer program, etc that contains dates and is used for recording information, arranging meetings, etc 记事本；记事本程序

*plant¹
/plɑ:nt; US plænt ||; plænt/noun[C]
1 a living thing that grows in the ground and usually has leaves, a long thin green central part (a stem) and roots 植物: a tomato plant 一株蕃茄 a plant pot (= a container for plants) 花盆 ☞picture on page C2 见C2页插图
2 a very large factory 大型工厂: a car plant 汽车工厂 a nuclear reprocessing plant 核后处理工厂
*plant²
/plɑ:nt; US plænt ||; plænt/verb[T]
1 to put plants, seeds, etc in the ground to grow 种植；栽种: Bulbs should be planted in the autumn. 鳞茎植物该在秋季栽种。
2 plant sth (with sth) to cover or supply a garden, area of land, etc with plants 在花园里、土地上栽种植物: The field's been planted with wheat this year. 今年这块地种了小麦。
3 to put yourself/sth firmly in a particular place or position 牢固地将自己或某物安置于（某位置）: He planted himself in the best seat. 他安坐在最好的位子上。
4 plant sth (on sb) to hide sth, especially sth illegal, in sb's clothing, property, etc, often in order to make him/her seem guilty of a crime 安放（非法物品）；栽赃: The police think that terrorists may have planted the bomb. 警方认为恐怖分子可能已暗中放置了炸弹。 The women claimed that the drugs had been planted on them. 这些女子声称那些毒品是别人给她们栽的赃。

plantain
/ˈplæntɪn;-teɪn||; ˈplæntɪn/noun [C,U] a fruit similar to a BANANA but larger and less sweet, that is cooked and eaten as a vegetable 大蕉

plantation
/plɑ:nˈteɪʃn ||; plænˈteʃən/noun[C]
1 a large area of land, especially in a hot country, where tea, cotton, tobacco, etc are grown （尤指气候炎热国家的茶、棉、烟草等的）种植园，大农场: a coffee plantation 咖啡种植园
2 an area of land where trees are grown to produce wood 人工林

plaque
/plɑ:k; US plæk ||; plæk/noun
1 [C] a flat piece of stone or metal, usually with names and dates on it, that is fixed on a wall in memory of a famous person or event （纪念名人或历史事件的）饰板，匾 ☞picture at column 见column插图
2 [U] a harmful substance that forms on your teeth 牙斑

plasma
/ˈplæzmə ||; ˈplæzmə/ (also plasm /ˈplæzəm ||; ˈplæzəm/) noun [U] the colourless liquid part of blood, in which the blood cells, etc float 血浆

plaster¹
/ˈplɑ:stə(r); US ˈplæs- ||; ˈplæstɚ/noun
1 [U] a mixture of a special powder and water that becomes hard when it is dry. Plaster is put on walls and ceilings to form a smooth surface. 灰泥（用于涂平墙壁和天花板） ☞picture at building 见building插图
2 (also sticking plaster) [C] a small piece of sticky material that is used to cover a cut, etc on the body 膏药；橡皮膏 ☞picture at health 见health插图
3 (also ˌplaster of ˈParis) [U] a white powder that is mixed with water and becomes hard when dry. It is used for putting round broken bones, etc until they get better 熟石膏；石膏: When Alan broke his leg it was in plaster for six weeks. 艾伦断了腿，上了六个星期石膏。 ☞picture at health 见health插图
plaster²
/ˈplɑ:stə(r); US ˈplæs- ||; ˈplæstɚ/verb[T]
1 to cover a wall, etc with plaster¹(1) to make the surface smooth 在（墙壁等上）涂灰泥
2 plaster sb/sth (in/with sth) to cover sb/sth with a large amount of sth 将某物大量覆盖或涂抹在…上面: He plastered his walls with posters. 他在自己的墙上贴满了海报。

ˈplaster cast
noun [C]
1 a case made of PLASTER OF PARISthat covers a broken bone and protects it 石膏夹；石膏绷带 ☞picture at health 见health插图
2 a copy of sth, made using PLASTER OF PARIS 石膏模型: They took a plaster cast of the teeth for identification purposes. 他们制作了一副牙齿模型作识别之用。

*plastic¹
/ˈplæstɪk ||; ˈplæstɪk/noun [C,U] a light, strong material that is made with chemicals and is used for making many different sorts of objects 塑料；塑料
plastic²
/ˈplæstɪk ||; ˈplæstɪk/adj made of plastic 塑料制的: plastic cups 塑料杯 a plastic bag 塑料袋

ˌplastic ˈsurgeon
noun [C] a doctor who is qualified to perform plastic surgery 整形外科医生

ˌplastic ˈsurgery
noun [U] a medical operation to repair or replace damaged skin or to improve the appearance of a person's face or body 整形外科手术 ☞Look at facelift and surgery. 参看facelift及surgery。

ˈplastic wrap
noun [U] (US 美) = cling film

*plate¹
/pleɪt ||; plet/noun
1 [C] a flat, usually round, dish for eating or serving food from 碟子；盘子: a plastic/paper/china plate 塑料／纸／瓷碟子 a plate of food 一碟子食物
You eat your main course from a dinner plate. You may put bread, etc on a side plate. You eat cereal or a pudding from a bowl. 吃主菜时用餐碟(dinner plate)。放面包可用面包碟(side plate)。吃麦片粥或布丁通常用碗(bowl)。
2 [C] a thin flat piece of metal or glass （金属／玻璃）薄片: a steel/metal plate 钢板；金属板
3 [C] a flat piece of metal with sth written on it （印有或写上东西的）金属牌: The brass plate beside the door said ‘Dr Waters’. 门边的铜招牌上刻着“沃尔斯特医生”几个字。
4 [U] metal that has a thin covering of gold or silver 镀金／银的金属: gold/silver plate 镀金／银的金属牌子
5 [C] (in geology 地质学) one of the sheets of rock that cover the earth's surface 板块 ☞Look at plate tectonics. 参看plate tectonics。
plate²
/pleɪt ||; plet/verb [T] (usually passive 通常用于被动词态) (technical术语)
1 to cover a metal with a thin layer of another metal, especially gold or silver 镀（尤指镀金银）: a silver ring plated with gold 镀金的银戒指
2 to cover sth with sheets of metal or another hard substance 用金属板等覆盖: The walls of the vault were plated with steel. 金库的墙壁覆盖着一层钢板。

plateau
/ˈplætəʊ; US plæˈtəʊ ||; plæˈto/noun [C] (plural plateaus /-təʊz ||; -ˈtoz/or plateaux /-təʊz ||; -ˈtoz/)
1 a large high area of flat land 高原 ☞picture at limestone 见limestone插图
2 a state where there is little development or change 停滞状态；稳定状态: House prices seem to have reached a plateau. 房价似乎已经稳定下来了。

plateful
/ˈpleɪtfʊl ||; ˈpletˌfυl/noun [C] the amount of food that a plate(1) can hold 一碟（或一盘）的量

ˌplate ˈglass
noun [U] very clear glass of good quality, made in thick sheets, used for doors, windows of shops/stores, etc 平板玻璃: plate-glass windows 平板玻璃窗

platelet
/ˈpleɪtlət ||; ˈpletlət/noun [C] a very small blood cell, shaped like a disc. Platelets make your blood become thicker so that it CLOTS(= stops flowing) when you cut yourself 血小板

ˌplate tecˈtonics
noun [U] (in geology 地质学) the movements of the large sheets of rock(plates)that form the earth's surface; the scientific study of these movements 板块移动（论） ☞Look at continental drift. 参看continental drift。

*platform
/ˈplætfɔ:m ||; ˈplætˌfɔrm/noun[C]
1 the place where you get on or off trains at a railway station （火车站内供乘客上落的）站台，月台: Which platform does the train to York leave from? 到约克的火车从哪个站台开出？
2 a flat surface, higher than the level of the floor or ground, on which public speakers or performers stand so that the audience can see them 讲台；舞台
3 [usu.sing] the ideas and aims of a political party who want to be elected （政党的）政纲，纲领: They fought the election on a platform of low taxes. 他们以低税的政纲进行竞选。

platinum
/ˈplætɪnəm ||; ˈplætṇəm/noun [U] (symbol Pt) a silver-grey metal that is often used for making expensive jewellery 白金，铂（常用于制造昂贵首饰）: a platinum wedding ring 白金结婚戒指

platonic
/pləˈtɒnɪk ||; pləˈtɑnɪk/adj (used about a relationship between two people) friendly but not sexual （指两人的关系）柏拉图式的，友好而无性爱的，精神恋爱的

platoon
/pləˈtu:n ||; pləˈtun/noun [C] a small group of soldiers 排（军队的编制单位）

plausible
/ˈplɔ:zəbl ||; ˈplɔzəbḷ/adj that you can believe; reasonable 可信的；似有道理的: a plausible excuse 言之成理的借口 [OPP] implausible 反义词为implausible

*play¹
/pleɪ ||; ple/verb
1 [I] play (with sb/sth) to do sth to enjoy yourself; to have fun 玩；玩耍；游乐: The children have been playing on the beach all day. 孩子们整天都在沙滩上玩耍。 Emma's found a new friend to play with. 埃玛找到一个可以跟她一起玩耍的新朋友。
2 [I,T] to take part in a game or sport 参与（游戏、体育运动或比赛） [T] to play football/tennis/hockey 踢足球；打网球；打曲棍球: I usually play against Bill. 我通常以比尔为对手。 She played him at table tennis and won. 她跟他打乒乓球赢了。 Do you know how to play chess? 你会下棋吗？ Who's Brazil playing next in the World Cup? 巴西队在世界杯中接下来跟哪个队比赛？
3 [I,T] play (sth) (on sth) to make music with a musical instrument 演奏（乐器） [T] to play the piano/guitar/trumpet 弹钢琴；弹吉他；吹小号: My son's learning the piano. He plays very well. 我的儿子正在学弹钢琴，他弹得很好。 She played a few notes on the violin. 她用小提琴拉了几个音。 ☞Look at the note at piano. 参看piano的注释。
4 [T] to turn on a video, tape, etc so that it produces sound 播放（录像、录音带等）: Shall I play the CD for you again? 我把那张激光唱片再放一遍给你听好吗？
5 [I,T] to act in a play, film, television programme, etc; to act the role of sb （在戏剧、电影、电视节目等中）扮演（角色）；演（戏） · Richard is going to play Romeo. 理查德德将扮演罗密欧。
Play a part, role, etc is often used in a figurative way Britain has played an active part in the recent discussions. John played a key role in organizing the protest. play a part／role等常用作比喻：Britain has played an active role in the recent discussions.在近期的讨论中，英国起了积极的作用。·John played a key role in organizing the protest.约翰在组织那次抗议活动中扮演了重要的角色。
6 [I] (formal 正式) to move quickly and lightly 轻快地移动: Sunlight played on the surface of the sea. 阳光在海面上闪烁。
For idioms containing play, look at the entries for the nouns, adjectives, etc, for example play it by ear is at ear. 含play的习语，参看有关名词、形容词等词条，如play it by ear可参看词条ear。 play at sth/being sth to do sth with little interest or effort 不太热心、不认真或敷衍地做: He's only playing at studying. He'd prefer to get a job now. 他读书只是敷衍而已，他现在更想找一份工作。 What is that driver playing at (= doing)? 那个司机究竟在做什么？ play sth back (to sb) to turn on and watch or listen to a film, tape, etc that you have recorded 播放，看，听（录好的电影、录音带等）: Play that last scene back to me again. 把最后那个片断再放一遍给我看。 play sth down to make sth seem less important than it really is 降低某事物的重要性；淡化: to play down a crisis 把危机的严重性讲得轻些 play A off against B to make people compete or argue with each other, especially for your own advantage 使两人相争或相斗（尤指以便从中得到好处）: I think she enjoys playing one friend off against another. 我认为她喜欢挑拨朋友之间的关系。 play on sth to use and take advantage of sb's fears or weaknesses 利用（某人的恐惧或弱点）: This advertising campaign plays on people's fears of illness. 这项广告活动利用人们对疾病的恐惧心理。 play (sb) up(informal 非正式) to cause sb trouble or pain 给某人带来麻烦或痛苦: The car always plays up in wet weather. 这辆汽车总是在下雨天出毛病。
*play²
/pleɪ ||; ple/noun
1 [C] a piece of writing performed by actors in the theatre, or on television or radio 戏剧: Would you like to see a play while you're in London? 你在伦敦的时候，想去看戏吗？ a radio/television play 广播剧；电视剧
Actors and actresses rehearse a play. A theatre company, drama group, etc produces a play. A play is usually acted on a stage. 演员排演(rehearse)一出戏剧。剧团上演(produce)戏剧。戏剧通常在舞台(stage)上演出。
2 [U] the playing of a game or sport 进行，举行（游戏或体育运动）: Bad weather stopped play yesterday. 恶劣天气使昨天的比赛受阻。
We play tennis, football, etc but we cannot say a play of tennis. We have a game of tennis. 打网球、踢足球等说play tennis／football…，而不说a play of tennis，只说a game of tennis。
3 [U] activity done for enjoyment only, especially by children 玩耍，游戏，嬉戏（尤指儿童的）: Young children learn through play. 幼童从游戏中学习。 the happy sound of children at play 孩子们玩耍的快活声音
4 [U] a control on a video or cassette player, etc that you press to start the tape running （录象机或录音机上的）播放键: Put the video into the machine then press play. 把录像带放进机器里，然后单击播放键。
fair play→FAIR¹

playboy
/ˈpleɪbɔɪ ||; ˈpleˌbɔɪ/noun [C] a rich man who spends his time enjoying himself 花花公子；只顾寻欢作乐的有钱人

ˌplay-by-ˈplay
noun [usually sing] (US 美) a report on what is happening in a sports game, given as the game is being played 体育比赛现场解说: The game was broadcast live but we couldn't hear the play-by-play. 这场比赛虽是现场直播，但我们听不到现场解说。 ➔ˌplay-by-ˈplay adj: a play-by-play announcer 现场解说员

*player
/ˈpleɪə(r) ||; ˈpleɚ/noun[C]
1 a person who plays a game or sport 游戏者；运动员；选手: a game for four players 四人玩的游戏 She's an excellent tennis player. 她是个出色的网球选手。
2 (used to form compound nouns 用于构成复合名词) a machine on which you can listen to sound that has been recorded on CD, tape, etc （播放激光唱片、录音带等的）机器；唱机: a CD/cassette player 激光唱片唱机；盒式录音带放音机
3 a person who plays a musical instrument 乐器演奏者；乐师: a piano player 钢琴演奏者

ˈplayer piano
noun [C] a piano that can play automatically 自动演奏钢琴

playful
/ˈpleɪfl ||; ˈplefəl/adj
1 done or said in fun; not serious 开玩笑的；不当真的: a playful remark 开玩笑的话
2 full of fun; wanting to play 十分有趣的；好玩的: a playful puppy 一只顽皮的小狗

playground
/ˈpleɪgraʊnd ||; ˈpleˌgraυnd/noun [C] an area of land where children can play 操场；（儿童）游乐场: the school playground 学校操场

playgroup
/ˈpleɪgru:p ||; ˈpleˌgrup/ (also playschool /ˈpleɪsku:l ||; ˈpleˌskul/) (Brit 英) =NURSERY SCHOOL

playhouse
/ˈpleɪhɑʊs ||; ˈpleˌhaυs/noun
1 [sing] used in the name of some theatres 剧场，戏院（用于专有名词）: the Liverpool Playhouse 利物浦戏院
2 [C] a model of a house for children to play in 儿童游戏小屋

ˈplaying card
=CARD(4)

ˈplaying field
noun [C] a large field used for sports such as cricket and football （板球、足球等的）球场 a level playing field→LEVEL²

ˈplay-off
noun [C] a match between two teams or players who have equal scores to decide the winner （平局后的）延长赛，加时赛: They lost to Chicago in the play-offs. 他们在加时赛中输给芝加哥队。

plaything
/ˈpleɪθɪŋ ||; ˈpleˌθɪŋ/noun [C] (formal 正式) a toy 玩具

playtime
/ˈpleɪtaɪm ||; ˈpleˌtaɪm/noun [C,U] a period of time between lessons when children at school can go outside to play （学校的）游戏时间

playwright
/ˈpleɪraɪt ||; ˈpleˌraɪt/noun [C] a person who writes plays for the theatre, television or radio 剧作家；编剧

plc
/ˌpi: el ˈsi: ||; ˌpi ɛl ˈsi/ (also PLC) abbr (Brit 英) Public Limited Company 公共有限公司；公开股份有限公司；上市公司

plea
/pli: ||; pli/noun[C]
1 (formal 正式) a plea (for sth) an important and emotional request 恳求；请求；祈求: a plea for help 请求帮助
2 a plea of sth a statement made by or for sb in a court of law （在法庭上某人或为某人所作的）答辩，抗辩: a plea of guilty/not guilty 承认╱否认有罪

plead
/pli:d ||; plid/verb
1 [I] plead (with sb) (to do/for sth) to ask sb for sth in a very strong and serious way 恳求；请求: She pleaded with him not to leave her. 她求他不要离开她。 He pleaded for mercy. 他请求宽恕。
2 [I,T] to state in a court of law that you did or did not do a crime （在法庭上）认罪或不认罪: The defendant pleaded not guilty to the charge of theft. 被告不承认偷窃的控罪。
3 [I,T] plead (sth) (for sb/sth) (used especially about a lawyer in a court of law) to support sb's case （尤指法庭上的律师）为（某人）辩护，抗辩: He needs the very best lawyer to plead (his case) for him. 他需要最好的律师为他（的案件）辩护。
4 [T] to give sth as an excuse or explanation for sth 提出（某事物）作为借口或解释: He pleaded family problems as the reason for his lack of concentration. 他以家庭问题作为他精神不集中的理由。

*pleasant
/ˈpleznt ||; ˈplɛzṇt/adj nice, enjoyable or friendly 舒适的；令人愉快的；友善的: a pleasant evening/climate/place/view 愉快的夜晚；宜人的气候；舒适的地方；悦目的景致 a pleasant smile/voice/manner 可爱的笑容；悦耳的声音；讨人喜欢的举止 [OPP] unpleasant 反义词为unpleasant ➔pleasantly adv

*please¹
/pli:z ||; pliz/ exclamation used as a polite way of asking for sth or telling sb to do sth （用于礼貌的请求、询问或吩咐）请，烦劳: Come in, please. 请进。 Please don't spend too much money. 请不要花太多钱。 Sit down, please. 请坐。 Two cups of coffee, please. 请来两杯咖啡。 yes, please used when you are accepting an offer of sth politely （用于礼貌地接受某物）好，谢谢你: ‘Sugar?’ ‘Yes, please.’ “要糖吗？”“好的，来一点吧。”(Yes, please.)反义说法为“不要了，谢谢。”(No, thank you.)
*please²
/pli:z ||; pliz/verb
1 [I,T] to make sb happy; to satisfy 使高兴；使喜欢；使满意 · There's just no pleasing some people (= some people are impossible to please). 有些人难以讨好。
2 [I] (not used as the main verb in a sentence; used after words like as, what, whatever, anything, etc 不用作句中的主要动词，用于as、what、whatever、anything等词之后) to want; to choose 要；想要；选择: You can't always do as you please. 你不总是想怎样做就可以怎样做的。 She has so much money she can buy anything she pleases. 她钱多得可以想买什么就买什么。
please yourself to be able to do whatever you want 想做什么就做什么: Without anyone else to cook for, I can please myself what I eat. 不必为别人做饭，我可想吃什么就吃什么。

*pleased
/pli:zd ||; plizd/adj (not before a noun 不用于名词前) pleased (with sb/sth);pleased to do sth;pleased that... happy or satisfied about sth 高兴；满意: John seems very pleased with his new car. 约翰对他的新车好像很满意。 Aren't you pleased to see me? 难道你看见我不高兴吗？ We're only too pleased (= very happy) to help. 我们很乐意帮忙。 I'm so pleased that you've decided to stay another week. 我很高兴你决定多留一个星期。 ☞Look at the note at glad. 参看glad的注释。 [OPP] displeased 反义词为displeased

pleasing
/ˈpli:zɪŋ ||; ˈplizɪŋ/adj giving you pleasure and satisfaction 令人快乐；令人满意: The exam results are very pleasing this year. 今年的考试成绩令人十分满意。 [OPP] displeasing 反义词为displeasing

pleasurable
/ˈpleʒərəbl ||; ˈplɛʒərəbḷ/adj (formal 正式) enjoyable 令人高兴的；愉快的: a pleasurable experience 一次愉快的经历

*pleasure
/ˈpleʒə(r) ||; ˈplɛʒɚ/noun
1 [U] the feeling of being happy or satisfied 快乐；愉快；满足: Parents get a lot of pleasure out ofwatching their children grow up. 父母看着自己的子女长大会感到十分欣慰。 It gives me great pleasure to introduce our next speaker. 我很高兴向大家介绍下一位讲者。
2 [U] enjoyment (rather than work) 娱乐；消遣: What brings you to Paris -- business or pleasure? 你来巴黎是出差还是旅游呢？
3 [C] an event or activity, that you enjoy or that makes you happy 喜欢或快乐的事、活动；乐事: It's been a pleasure to work with you. 与你一起工作真是一件乐事。 ‘Thanks for your help.’ ‘ It's a pleasure.’ “谢谢你的帮忙。”“别客气。”
take (no) pleasure in sth/doing sth to (not) enjoy (doing) sth 喜欢／不喜欢做某事 with pleasure used as a polite way of saying that you are happy to do sth （用于礼貌地表示乐于接受或同意某事）: ‘Could you give me a lift into town?’ ‘Yes, with pleasure.’ “你可以载我进城吗？”“好的，非常乐意。”

pleat
/pli:t ||; plit/noun [C] a permanent FOLD that is sewn or pressed into a piece of cloth （布料上缝的或压的）褶: a skirt with pleats at the front 前面有褶的裙子

plebiscite
/ˈplebɪsɪt; US -saɪt ||; ˈplɛbəˌsaɪt/noun [C] (technical术语)a plebiscite (on sth) a vote by the people of a country or a region on a question that is very important 公民投票: to hold a plebiscite on the country's future system of government 就该国未来的政治制度举行公民投票

plectrum
/ˈplektrəm ||; ˈplɛktrəm/noun [C] a small piece of plastic, metal, etc, that you use to play the strings of a guitar or similar musical instrument instead of using your fingers （用于弹奏吉他等弦乐器的）拨子，拨弦片

pledge
/pledʒ ||; plɛdʒ/noun [C] a pledge (to do sth) a formal promise or agreement 承诺；协定 pledge verb [T] pledge (sth) (to sb/sth) The Government has pledged £250000 to help the victims of the crash. 政府已承诺要拨出25万英镑帮助这次交通事故的受害者。

plenary
/ˈpli:nəri ||; ˈplinərɪ/adj (used about meetings, etc 指会议等) that should be attended by everyone who has the right to attend （有资格的人）全体出席的: The new committee holds its first plenary session this week. 新委员会定于本周举行第一次全体会议。 plenary noun [C] (plural plenaries) the opening/final plenary of the conference 大会开幕式╱闭幕式全体会议

plentiful
/ˈplentɪfl ||; ˈplɛntɪfəl/adj available in large amounts or numbers 多的；充足的；丰富的: Fruit is plentiful at this time of year. 每年这个时候都有大量水果供应。 [OPP] scarce 反义词为scarce

*plenty
/ˈplenti ||; ˈplɛntɪ/pronoun adv
1 plenty (of sb/sth) as much or as many of sth as you need 充足；丰富；大量: ‘Shall I get some more coffee?’ ‘No, we've still got plenty.’ “我再拿点咖啡来好吗？”“不用了，我们还有很多。” There's still plenty of time to get there. 到那里去还有很充足的时间。 Have you brought plenty to drink? 你带了足够的饮料没有？
2 (before more 用于more前) a lot 很多: There's plenty more ice cream. 还有很多冰淇淋。
3 (informal 非正式) (with big, long, tall, etc followed by enough 与big、long、tall等词语连用，后接enough) easily 无疑: ‘This shirt's too small.’ ‘Well, it looks plenty big enough to me.’ “这件衬衫太小了。”“嗯，我看绝对够大了。”

pliable
/ˈplaɪəbl ||; ˈplaɪəbḷ/ (also pliant /ˈplaɪənt ||; ˈplaɪənt/) adj
1 easy to bend or shape 易弯的；易塑造的
2 (used about a person) easy to influence （指人）易受影响的

pliers
/ˈplaɪəz ||; ˈplaɪɚz/noun [pl] a tool made of two crossed pieces of metal with handles, that is used for holding things firmly and for cutting wire 钳子: a pair of pliers 一把钳子 ☞picture at tool 见tool插图

plight
/plaɪt ||; plaɪt/noun [sing] (formal 正式) a bad or difficult state or situation 困境；苦况

plimsoll
/ˈplɪmsəl ||; ˈplɪmsḷ/ (also pump) (US 美 sneaker) noun [C] a light shoe made of strong material(canvas) that is especially used for sports, etc （尤指体育运动时穿的）胶底帆布鞋: a pair of plimsolls 一双胶底帆布鞋 ☞Look at trainer. 参看trainer。

plinth
/plɪnθ ||; plɪnθ/noun [C] a block of stone on which a column or statue stands （圆柱或雕像的）石头底座

plod
/plɒd ||; plɑd/verb [I] (plodding;plodded)plod (along/on)
1 to walk slowly and in a heavy or tired way 迈着沉重的脚步走；疲倦地慢慢往前走: We plodded on through the rain for nearly an hour. 我们在雨中涉水前进了差不多一个小时。
2 to make slow progress, especially with difficult or boring work 进展缓慢（尤指做困难或无聊的工作）: I just plod on with my work and never seem to get anywhere. 我的工作进展缓慢，似乎总没有什么进展。

plonk¹
/plɒŋk ||; plɑŋk/verb [T] (spoken 口语)
1 plonk sth (down) to put sth down on sth, especially noisily or carelessly 重重放下；摔下: Just plonk your bag down anywhere. 把你的包放下，放在哪里都行。
2 plonk (yourself) (down) to sit down heavily and carelessly 重重地、随随便便地坐下: He just plonked himself down in front of the TV. 他在电视机前一屁股坐了下来。
plonk²
/plɒŋk ||; plɑŋk/noun [U] (Brit 英) (informal 非正式) cheap wine 廉价酒: Let's open a bottle of plonk! 我们开一瓶廉价酒喝吧！

plop¹
/plɒp ||; plɑp/noun [C] [usu.sing] a sound like that of a small object dropping into water 小对象落入水中的声音；扑通声
plop²
/plɒp ||; plɑp/verb [I] (plopping;plopped) to fall making a plopping noise 扑通一声落下: The frog plopped back into the water. 那只青蛙扑通一声跳进水里。

*plot¹
/plɒt ||; plɑt/noun[C]
1 the series of events which form the story of a novel, film, etc （小说、电影等的）情节: The play had a very weak plot. 这出戏的情节很不精彩。 I can't follow the plot of this novel. 我看不懂这本小说的情节。
2 a plot (to do sth) a secret plan made by several people to do sth wrong or illegal 阴谋，密谋，秘密计划（多指做坏事或非法勾当）: a plot to kill the president 刺杀总统的阴谋
3 a small piece of land, used for a special purpose （作特别用途的）小块土地: a plot of land 一小块地
plot²
/plɒt ||; plɑt/verb (plotting;plotted)
1 [I,T] plot (with sb) (against sb) to make a secret plan to do sth wrong or illegal 密谋，秘密计划（做坏事或非法勾当）: They were accused of plotting against the government. 他们被控密谋反对政府。 The terrorists had been plotting this campaign for years. 恐怖分子密谋策划这项活动已有多年了。
2 [T] to mark sth on a map, diagram, etc 在地图或示意图上标明: to plot the figures on a graph 把那些数字用图表标示出来

plough
/plaʊ ||; plaυ/ (US 美 plow) noun [C] a large farm tool which is pulled by a TRACTORor by an animal. A plough turns the soil over ready for seeds to be planted. 犁 ☞Look at snowplough. 参看snowplough。 plough verb [I,T] (figurative 比喻) The book was long and boring but I managed to plough through it (= read it with difficulty). 这本书又长又乏味，但我还是费力看完了。

ploy
/plɔɪ ||; plɔɪ/noun [C] a ploy (to do sth) something that you say or do in order to get what you want or to persuade sb to do sth （为了取得想要的东西或说服别人做某事而作的）策略，计策，手段

pluck¹
/plʌk ||; plʌk/verb[T]
1 pluck sth/sb (from sth/out) to remove or take sth/sb from a place 拔除；摘去；拉: He plucked the letter from my hands. 他从我手上抢走这封信。
2 to pull the feathers out of a dead bird in order to prepare it for cooking 拔去（鸟等的）毛（以备烹调）
3 to make the strings of a musical instrument play notes by moving your fingers across them 弹，拨（乐器的弦）
pluck up courage to try to get enough courage to do sth 鼓起勇气 pluck at sth to pull sth gently several times （轻轻地数次）拉，扯
pluck²
/plʌk ||; plʌk/noun [U] (informal 非正式) courage and determination 勇气；胆量；决心 plucky adj

plug¹
/plʌg ||; plʌg/noun[C]
1 a plastic or rubber object with two or three metal pins, which connects a piece of electrical equipment to the electricity supply （将电器的导线接上电源的）插头
2 a round piece of rubber or plastic that you use to block the hole in a bath, etc （橡胶或塑料制的）塞子（如用于塞住洗涤槽、浴缸等的）
3 a mention that sb makes of a new book, film, etc in order to encourage people to buy or see it （新书、电影等的）推销广告，推介，促销
plug²
/plʌg ||; plʌg/verb [T] (plugging;plugged)
1 to fill or block a hole with sth that fits tightly into it 填塞，堵塞，塞住（孔洞）: He managed to plug the leak in the pipe. 他堵住了管子的裂缝。
2 (informal 非正式) to say good things about a new book, film, etc in order to make people buy or see it 为（新书、电影等）推荐，打广告: They're really plugging that song on the radio at the moment. 此刻他们正在电台上大肆宣传那首歌。
plug sth in to connect a piece of electrical equipment to the electricity supply or to another piece of equipment 将电器的插头接上电源或另一件电器: Is the microphone plugged in? 麦克风的插头插上了吗？ [OPP] unplug 反义词为unplug

plughole
/ˈplʌghəʊl ||; ˈplʌghol/noun [C] (Brit 英) a hole in a bath, etc where the water flows away （浴缸等的）排水孔

ˈplug-in¹
adj
1 able to be connected using a plug¹(1) 插入插头的: a plug-in telephone 插入式电话
2 (computing 计算机技术) able to be added to a computer system so that it can do more things 可插入﹙计算机系统﹚的: a plug-in graphics card 插入式图形适配器 Some of the smaller notebooks use plug-in drives which saves power and makes them even more portable. 一些更小的笔记本计算机使用了插入式驱动器，既可以省电，又可以使计算机更轻便。
ˈplug-in²
noun [C]
1 (computing 计算机技术) a piece of computer software that can be added to a system so that it can do more things 插件: Plug-ins for palmtops are a booming industry. 用于掌上计算机的插件发展迅速。
2 (Brit 英) a connection to an electricity supply (socket) in a garage, near a parking space, etc for plugging in an electric heater that is used to warm the engine of a car, etc so that it starts more easily ﹙车库等处﹚加热器的接电装置

plum
/plʌm ||; plʌm/noun [C] a soft, round fruit with red or yellow skin and a stone in the middle 梅子；李子 ☞picture on page C3 见C3页插图

plumage
/ˈplu:mɪdʒ ||; ˈplumɪdʒ/noun [U] the feathers covering a bird's body （鸟的）羽毛

plumber
/ˈplʌmə(r) ||; ˈplʌmɚ/noun [C] a person whose job is to put in or repair water pipes, baths, toilets, etc 管子工；水暖工；铅管匠

plumbing
/ˈplʌmɪŋ ||; ˈplʌmɪŋ/noun[U]
1 all the pipes, taps, etc in a building （建筑物内的）管道设备，铅管工程
2 the work of a person who puts in and repairs water pipes, taps, etc 管子工的工作

plume
/plu:m ||; plum/noun[C]
1 a quantity of smoke that rises in the air 一缕烟
2 a large feather or group of feathers, often worn as a decoration 一根大羽毛；一组羽毛；羽饰

plummet
/ˈplʌmɪt ||; ˈplʌmɪt/verb [I] (formal 正式) to fall suddenly and quickly from a high level or position 骤降；骤跌: Share prices plummeted to an all-time low. 股票价格一下子跌到创纪录的低点。 The jet plummeted into a row of houses. 那架喷气式飞机坠落在一排房子里。 [SYN] plunge 同义词为plunge

plump¹
/plʌmp ||; plʌmp/adj (used about a person or an animal) pleasantly fat （指人或动物）胖得好看的，丰满的: the baby's plump cheeks 那婴孩胖乎乎的脸颊
plump²
/plʌmp ||; plʌmp/verb plump (yourself/sb/sth) down to sit down or to put sb/sth down heavily 猛地坐下；重重放下: She plumped herself down by the fire. 她一屁股坐到炉火旁。 plump for sb/sth (Brit 英) (informal 非正式) to choose or decide to have sb/sth 选择要；决定要: I think I'll plump for the roast chicken, after all. 我想我还是要烤鸡。

plunder
/ˈplʌndə(r) ||; ˈplʌndɚ/noun [U] the action of stealing from people or places, especially during war or fighting; the goods that are stolen 掠夺，劫掠（尤指在战争或战斗中）；被劫掠的财物 plunder verb [I,T]

plunge¹
/plʌndʒ ||; plʌndʒ/verb
1 [I] plunge (into sth/in) to jump, drop or fall suddenly and with force 突然猛力跳进、掉落或跌进: He ran to the river and plunged in. 他跑到河边，纵身跳进河里。 (figurative 比喻) Share prices plunged overnight. 股票价格一夜之间暴跌。
2 [T] plunge sth in/into sth to push sth suddenly and with force into sth （突然用力把某物）插入，刺进: He plunged the knife into the table in anger. 他一怒之下把刀插入桌子。
3 [T] to cause sb/sth to suddenly be in the state mentioned 使突然陷入（某种状态）: The country has been plunged into chaos by the floods. 全国因洪水而陷入混乱之中。
4 [I] plunge into (doing) sth to start doing sth with energy and enthusiasm （劲头十足而热情洋溢地）投入（某工作）: Think carefully before you plunge into buying a house. 买房子之前要三思，不要操之过急。
plunge²
/plʌndʒ ||; plʌndʒ/noun [C] a sudden jump, drop or fall 纵身跃；猛然落下；暴跌: I slipped and took a plunge in the river. 我摔了一跤，一屁股跌进河里。 the plunge in house prices 房价的暴跌 take the plunge to decide to do sth difficult after thinking about it for quite a long time （经过颇长时间考虑后）决定做困难的事情: After going out together for five years, they took the plunge and got married. 经过五年约会以后，他们终于决定结婚。

ˈplunge pool
noun [C] (in geography 地理学) an area of deep water that is formed by water falling from above(a waterfall) （瀑布的水形成的）瀑布潭

plunger
/ˈplʌndʒə(r) ||; ˈplʌndʒɚ/noun [C] a part of a piece of equipment that can be pushed down, for example in a SYRINGE(= a device that is used for putting drugs into sb's body and for taking blood out) （注射器的）柱塞 ☞picture at laboratory 见laboratory插图

pluperfect
/ˌplu:ˈpɜ:fɪkt ||; ˌpluˈpɝfɪkt/ =THE PAST PERFECT

*plural
/ˈplʊərəl ||; ˈplυrəl/noun [C] (grammar语法) the form of a noun, verb, etc which refers to more than one person or thing （名词、动词等的）复数，复数形式: The plural of ‘boat’ is ‘boats’. boats是boat的复数形式。 The verb should be in the plural. 这个动词应该用复数形式。 plural adj ☞Look at singular. 参看singular。

*plus¹
/plʌs ||; plʌs/prep
1 and; added to 加；加上: Two plus two is four (2 + 2 = 4). 二加二等于四。 [OPP] minus 反义词为minus
2 in addition to; and also 外加；另有: You have to work five days a week plus every other weekend. 你每周得工作五天，周末也要隔周上班。
plus²
/plʌs ||; plʌs/noun[C]
1 the sign (+) 加号；正号（＋） [OPP] minus 反义词为minus
2 an advantage of a situation （某种情况的）有利方面，好处
plus³
/plʌs ||; plʌs/adj (only after a noun 只用于名词后)
1 or more 或更多: I'd say there were 30000 plus at the match. 依我看，有超过30000人入场观看了这场比赛。
2 (used for marking work done by students) slightly above （用于评定学生功课的等级）略高于，加，上: I got a B plus (= B+) for my homework. 我的家庭作业得B加（写作B+）。 [OPP] minus 反义词为minus

plush
/plʌʃ ||; plʌʃ/adj comfortable and expensive 舒适豪华的: a plush hotel 一家舒适豪华的旅馆

Pluto
/ˈplu:təʊ ||; ˈpluto/noun [sing] the planet that is furthest from the sun 冥王星（离太阳最远的行星） ☞picture at the solar system 见the solar system插图

plutonium
/plu:ˈtəʊniəm ||; pluˈtonɪəm/noun [U] a dangerous(radioactive)substance used especially as a fuel in nuclear power stations 钚（一种放射性元素，尤用作核电站的燃料）

ply
/plaɪ ||; plaɪ/verb (present participle plying third person singular present plies;past tense past participle plied) [I,T] to try to sell services or goods to people, especially on the street （尤指在街头）向人硬提供（服务），硬卖（货品） · Boat owners were plying their tradeto passing tourists. 船主向过路的游客兜揽生意。 [I] to ply for business 拉生意 ply sb with sth to keep giving sb food and drink, or asking sb questions 不断给某人食物和饮料或向某人发问: They plied us with food from the moment we arrived. 我们一到，他们就不停给我们送来食物。

plywood
/ˈplaɪwʊd ||; ˈplaɪˌwυd/noun [U] board made by sticking several thin layers of wood together 胶合板；压层木板

*p.m.
/ˌpi: ˈem ||; ˌpi ˈɛm/ (US 美 P.M.) abbr after midday 下午: 2 p.m. (= 2 o'clock in the afternoon) 下午2时 11.30 p.m.(= 11.30 in the evening) 晚上11时30分

PMS
/ˌpi: em ˈes ||; ˌpi ˌɛm ˈɛs/ (Brit also 英亦作 PMT) abbr premenstrual syndrome; physical and emotional problems such as pain and feeling depressed that many women experience before their period (= flow of blood) each month 月经前综合症

pneumatic
/nju:ˈmætɪk ||; njuˈmætɪk/adj
1 filled with air 充满气的: a pneumatic tyre 充气轮胎
2 worked by air under pressure 由压缩空气操作的: pneumatic tools 风动工具

pneuˌmatic ˈdrill
(US 美 jackhammer) noun [C] a large powerful tool, worked by air pressure, used especially for breaking up road surfaces 风钻

pneumonia
/nju:ˈməʊniə; US nu:- ||; nuˈmonjə/noun [U] a serious illness of the lungs which makes breathing difficult 肺炎

PO
/ˌpi: ˈəʊ ||; ˌpi ˈo/abbr (used in compound nouns 用于复合名词) Post Office 邮局: a PO box 邮政信箱

poach
/pəʊtʃ ||; potʃ/verb[T]
1 to cook food (especially fish or eggs) gently in a small amount of liquid （尤指鱼或蛋放在少量水中用文火）煮: poached eggs 水煮荷包蛋
2 to hunt animals illegally on sb else's land （在他人土地）偷猎，偷捕: The men were caught poaching elephants. 那几个人偷猎大象当场被捉到。
3 to take an idea from sb else and use it as though it is your own 盗用，窃取（点子）
4 to take members of staff from another company in an unfair way 挖走（别家公司的职员）

poacher
/ˈpəʊtʃə(r) ||; ˈpotʃɚ/noun [C] a person who hunts animals illegally on sb else's land 偷猎者；偷捕者

ˌPˈO box
/pi: ˈəʊ bɒks ||; ˈpi ˈo ˌbɑks/noun [C] a place in a post office where letters, packages, etc are kept until they are collected by the person they were sent to 邮政信箱: The address is PO Box 4287, Nairobi, Kenya. 地址是肯尼亚内罗毕4287号信箱。

*pocket¹
/ˈpɒkɪt ||; ˈpɑkɪt/noun[C]
1 a piece of material like a small bag that is sewn inside or on a piece of clothing and is used for carrying things in 衣袋；口袋: He always walks with his hands in his trouser pockets. 他走路时老是把两只手插在裤袋里。 a pocket dictionary/calculator(= one small enough to fit in your pocket) 袖珍字典／计算器
2 a small bag or container that is fixed to the inside of a car door, suitcase, etc and used for putting things in （汽车门、手提箱等内部的）袋子: There are safety instructions in the pocket of the seat in front of you. 你前面座位的袋子里有安全守则。
3 used to talk about the amount of money that you have to spend （不得不花的）金额: They sell cars to suit every pocket. 他们出售各种财力的人都买得起的汽车。 The school couldn't afford a CD player, so the teacher bought one out of his own pocket. 学校买不起激光唱机，所以这位老师自掏腰包买了一部。
4 a small area or group that is different from its surroundings （与周围不同的）小范围，群体，一小群，一小团: pockets of warm water 小块暖水 ☞Look at air pocket. 参看air pocket。
pick sb's pocket→PICK¹
pocket²
/ˈpɒkɪt ||; ˈpɑkɪt/verb[T]
1 to put sth in your pocket 把…放进口袋里: He took the letter and pocketed it quickly. 他拿了那封信，然后迅速把它放进口袋里。
2 to steal or win money 偷钱；赢钱

ˈpocket money
noun [U] (US 美 allowance) an amount of money that parents give a child to spend, usually every week （父母给子女的）零用钱

pod
/pɒd ||; pɑd/noun [C] the long, green part of some plants, such as peas and beans, that contains the seeds 荚；豆荚 ☞picture on page C3 见C3页插图

podiatrist
/pəˈdaɪətrɪst ||; pəˈdaɪətrɪst/ (US 美) =CHIROPODIST

podiatry
/pəˈdaɪətri ||; pəˈdaɪətrɪ/ (US 美) =CHIROPODY

podium
/ˈpəʊdiəm ||; ˈpodɪəm/noun [C] a small platform for a speaker, a performer, etc to stand on （给讲者、表演者等站立的）讲台，讲坛，舞台

*poem
/ˈpəʊɪm ||; ˈpo·ɪm/noun [C] a piece of writing arranged in short lines. Poems try to express thoughts and feelings with the help of sound and rhythm 诗；韵文

*poet
/ˈpəʊɪt ||; ˈpo·ɪt/noun [C] a person who writes poems 诗人

poetic
/pəʊˈetɪk ||; poˈɛtɪk/ (also poetical /-ɪkl ||; -ɪkḷ/) adj connected with poets or like a poem 与诗人有关的；似诗的 ➔poetically /-kli ||; -klɪ/ adv

*poetry
/ˈpəʊətri ||; ˈpo·ɪtrɪ/noun [U] a collection of poems; poems in general 诗集；诗歌（总称）: Shakespeare's poetry and plays 莎士比亚的诗歌和戏剧 Do you like poetry? 你喜欢诗吗？ ☞Compare prose. 与prose比较。

poignant
/ˈpɔɪnjənt ||; ˈpɔɪnjənt/adj causing sadness or pity 令人悲伤的；辛酸的: a poignant memory 一段辛酸的回忆 ➔poignancy /-jənsi ||; -jənsɪ/ noun [U] ➔poignantly adv

poinsettia
/ˌpɔɪnˈsetiə ||; ˌpɔɪnˈsɛtɪə/noun [C] a tropical plant with large red or pink leaves that grow to look like flowers, often grown indoors in pots 一品红

*point¹
/pɔɪnt ||; pɔɪnt/noun
1 [C] a particular fact, idea or opinion that sb expresses 事实；构想；观点: You make some interesting pointsin your essay. 你在文章中提出了几点很有意思的看法。 I see your point but I don't agree with you. 我明白你的意思，但我不同意。 We can bring up, raise, make, argue, emphasize and illustrate a point. 我们可以提出(bring up／ raise／ make)、讨论(argue)、强调(emphasize)和说明(illustrate)一个论点(a point)。
2 the point [sing] the most important part of what is being said; the main piece of information 重点；主旨: It makes no difference how much it costs -- the point is we don't have any money! 要花多少钱无关紧要─问题是我们没有钱！ She always talks and talks and takes ages to get to the point. 她老是说个没完，说了老半天才说到点子上。
3 [C] an important idea or thought that needs to be considered （须要考虑的）要点，核心问题: ‘Have you checked what time the last bus back is?’ ‘That's a point -- no I haven't.’ “你有没有查过最后一班回程的公共汽车是在什么时候？”“那倒是个大问题─我没有查过。”
4 [C] a detail, characteristic or quality of sb/sth 细节；特点；特征: Make a list of your strong points and your weak points(= good and bad qualities). 列举一下你的长处和短处。
5 [sing] the point (of/in sth/doing sth) the meaning, reason or purpose of sth 意义；理由；目的: She's said no, so what's the point of telephoning her again? 她已经说了不行，因此再打电话给她有什么用呢？ There's no point in talking to my parents -- they never listen. 与我父母谈毫无意义─他们从来就不会听。
6 [C] (often in compounds 常构成复合词) a particular place, position or moment 地点；位置；时刻: The library is a good starting point for that sort of information. 要找那类资料的话，该先从图书馆下手。 He has reached the high point of his career. 他的事业已经达到了高峰。 the boiling/freezing point of water 水的沸点╱冰点 He waved to the crowd and it was at that point that the shot was fired. 正当他向群众挥手的时候，有人开了枪。 At one point I thought I was going to laugh. 我一度以为我会笑出来。
7 [C] the thin sharp end of sth （某物的）尖，尖端: the point of a pin/needle/pencil 大头针╱缝衣针╱铅笔的尖儿
8 [C] a small round mark used when writing parts of numbers 点；小数点: She ran the race in 11.2 (eleven point two) seconds. 她在这次赛跑中跑出了11.2秒的成绩。
9 [C] a single mark in some games, sports, etc that you add to others to get the score （某些游戏、体育比赛等的）一次得分，点: to score a point 取得一分 Rios needs two more points to win the match. 里奥斯要再取得两分就能赢这场比赛。
10 [C] a unit of measurement for certain things （作计量用的单位）点，分: The value of the dollar has fallen by a few points. 美元的币值跌了几点。
be on the point of doing sth just going to do sth 正要做某事之际；就要做某事之时: I was on the point of going out when the phone rang. 我正要出门的时候，电话铃响了。 beside the point→BESIDE have your, etc (good) points to have some good qualities 有某些优点: Bill has his good points, but he's very unreliable. 比尔固然有他的优点，但是他为人不很可靠。 make a point of doing sth to make sure you do sth because it is important or necessary 确保做某事（因为重要或有必要）: I made a point of locking all the doors and windows before leaving the house. 我离家以前总是注意锁好所有门窗。 point of view a way of looking at a situation; an opinion 观点；看法；意见: From my point of view it would be better to wait a little longer. 依我看，最好是多等一会儿。 [SYN] viewpoint or standpoint 同义词为viewpoint或standpoint E4@@Do not confuse from my point of view with in my opinion. The first means ‘from my position in life’ (= as a woman, business person, teacher, etc). The second means ‘I think’ From an advertiser's point of view, television is a wonderful medium. In my opinion people watch too much television. 不要把from my point of view与in my opinion混淆。前者的意思是“从我的立场、身分来看”（即身为一个女人、商人、教师等）；后者的意思是“我认为”﹕From an advertiser's point of view, television is a wonderful medium.从广告人的角度来看，电视是个很了不起的媒介。·In my opinion people watch too much television.我认为人们看电视看得太多了。 prove your/the case/point→PROVE a sore point→SORE¹ sb's strong point→STRONG take sb's point to understand and accept what sb is saying 明白并接受某人的论点 to the point connected with what is being discussed; relevant 切题；中肯: His speech was short and to the point. 他的演说简短而切题。 up to a point partly 部份: I agree with you up to a point. 我同意你的部份见解。
*point²
/pɔɪnt ||; pɔɪnt/verb
1 [I] point (at/to sb/sth) to show where sth is or to draw attention to sth using your finger, a stick, etc （用手指、木棒等）指，指出: ‘I'll have that one,’ she said, pointing to a chocolate cake. “我想要那个。”她指着一块巧克力蛋糕说。
2 [I,T] point (sth) (at/towards sb/sth) to aim (sth) in the direction of sb/sth 指向；对准；瞄准: She pointed the gun at the target and fired. 她把枪瞄准目标，然后开火。
3 [I] to face in a particular direction or to show that sth is in a particular direction 面向；朝向；指向: The sign pointed towards the motorway. 路标指向高速公路。 Turn round until you're pointing north. 转过身来，转到面朝北的位置。
4 [I] point to sth to show that sth is likely to exist, happen or be true 显示，表明，证明（某事物很可能存在、发生或是正确的）: Research points to a connection between diet and cancer. 有研究显示饮食与癌症有关。
point sth out (to sb) to make sb look at sth; to make sth clear to sb 使注意某事物；向某人指明某事物: The guide pointed out all the places of interest to us on the way. 途中导游给我们指出各个名胜。 I'd like to point out that we haven't got much time left. 我想指出，我们所剩的时间不多了。

ˌpoint-ˈblank
adj adv
1 (used about a shot) from a very close position （指射击）近距离（的）: He was shot in the leg at point-blank range. 他被人从近距离射中腿部。
2 (used about sth that is said) very direct and not polite; not allowing any discussion （指说话）直截了当（的），断然（的）: He told her point-blank to get out of the house. 他直截了当叫她离开那房子。

pointed
/ˈpɔɪntɪd ||; ˈpɔɪntɪd/adj
1 having a sharp end 尖的: a pointed stick/nose 尖棒；尖鼻
2 (used about sth that is said) critical of sb in an indirect way （指说话）尖锐的，有针对性的: She made a pointed comment about people who are always late. 她对老是迟到的人作了尖锐的批评。 ➔pointedly adv

pointer
/ˈpɔɪntə(r) ||; ˈpɔɪntɚ/noun[C]
1 a piece of helpful advice or information （有用的）指点，信息: Could you give me some pointerson how best to tackle the problem? 这个问题最好怎样处理，你可以给我指点一下吗？
2 a small arrow on a computer screen that you move by moving the mouse （计算机屏幕上随鼠标移动的）指针，指示字 ☞picture on page S3 见S3页插图
3 a stick that is used to point to things on a map, etc （作指示用的）棍，棒；教鞭

pointless
/ˈpɔɪntləs ||; ˈpɔɪntlɪs/adj without any use or purpose 没有用的；没有意义的: It's pointless to try and make him agree. 要想使他同意是白费力气。 ➔pointlessly adv ➔pointlessness noun [U]

poise
/pɔɪz ||; pɔɪz/noun [U] a calm, confident way of behaving 泰然自若；沉着自信

poised
/pɔɪzd ||; pɔɪzd/adj
1 not moving but ready to move 作好准备（随时行动）的: ‘Shall I call the doctor or not?’ he asked, his hand poised above the telephone. “要我叫医生吗？”他一边问道，一边把手按在电话上。
2 poised (to do sth) ready to act; about to do sth 随时可以行动；将要做（某事）: The government is poised to take action if the crisis continues. 如果危机继续下去的话，政府随时可采取行动。
3 calm and confident 冷静沉着；泰然自若

*poison¹
/ˈpɔɪzn ||; ˈpɔɪzṇ/noun [C,U] a substance that kills or harms you if you eat or drink it 毒药；毒物: rat poison 老鼠药 poison gas 毒气
poison²
/ˈpɔɪzn ||; ˈpɔɪzṇ/verb[T]
1 to kill, harm or damage sb/sth with poison （用毒药）毒死，毒害
2 to put poison in sth （在某物中）放毒: The cup of coffee had been poisoned. 那杯咖啡已被人下毒。
3 to spoil or ruin sth 破坏；毁掉: The quarrel had poisoned their relationship. 那次争吵毁了他们的关系。 ➔poisoned adj a poisoned drink 被下了毒的饮料

poisoning
/ˈpɔɪzənɪŋ ||; ˈpɔɪzənɪŋ/noun [U] the giving or taking of poison or a dangerous substance 下毒；中毒: He got food poisoning from eating fish that wasn't fresh. 他吃了不新鲜的鱼，结果食物中毒了。

poisonous
/ˈpɔɪzənəs ||; ˈpɔɪzṇəs/adj
1 causing death or illness if you eat or drink it （吃或喝会）引起中毒的
2 (used about animals, etc) producing and using poison to attack its enemies （指动物等）以毒物攻击敌人的，有毒的: He was bitten by a poisonous snake. 他给毒蛇咬了。
3 very unpleasant and intended to upset sb 令人厌恶的；恶意的；恶毒的: She wrote him a poisonous letter criticizing his behaviour. 她给他写了一封极不客气的信，批评他的行为。

poke
/pəʊk ||; pok/verb
1 [T] to push sb/sth with a finger, stick or other long, thin object （用手指、木棒或其他细长对象）捅，戳: Be careful you don't poke yourself in the eye with that stick! 当心，别把那根木棍戳到你的眼睛！
2 [I,T] poke (sth) into, through, out of, down, etc sth to move or to push sth quickly into sth or in a certain direction 插向；戳进；刺向: He poked the stick down the hole to see how deep it was. 他把木棒伸进洞里，看有多深。 A child's head poked up from behind the wall. 一个孩子从墙后探出头来。 ☞picture on page S19 见S19页插图 poke noun [C]
poke fun at sb/sth to make jokes about sb/sth, often in an unkind way 拿…开玩笑；取笑；嘲笑 poke/stick your nose into sth→NOSE¹

poker
/ˈpəʊkə(r) ||; ˈpokɚ/noun
1 [U] a type of card game usually played to win money 扑克牌戏
2 [C] a metal stick for moving the coal or wood in a fire 拨火铁棒；通条 ☞picture at fireplace 见fireplace插图

poky
/ˈpəʊki ||; ˈpokɪ/adj (Brit 英) (informal 非正式) (used about a house, room, etc) too small （指房子、房间等）狭小的: a poky little office 狭小的办公室

polar
/ˈpəʊlə(r) ||; ˈpolɚ/adj (only before a noun 只用于名词前) of or near the North or South Pole 北极的；南极的；极地的；接近极地的: the polar regions 极地地区

ˈpolar bear
noun [C] a large white bear that lives in the area near the North Pole 北极熊；白熊

polarize
/ˈpəʊləraɪz ||; ˈpoləˌraɪz/ (also -ise) verb
1 [I,T] (formal 正式) to separate or make people separate into two groups with completely opposite opinions （使）分成意见绝然相反的两派: Public opinion has polarized on this issue. 在这个问题上公众舆论南辕北辙。
2 [T] (technical术语) to make waves of light, etc VIBRATE (= move up and down with very small continuous movements) in a single direction 使（光波）偏振
3 (technical术语) to make sth have two poles(3) with opposite qualities 使两极化: to polarize a magnet 使磁铁极化 ➔polarization(also -isation) /ˌpəʊləraɪˈzeɪʃn ||; ˌpoləraɪˈzeʃən/ noun [U]

*pole
/pəʊl ||; pol/noun[C]
1 a long, thin piece of wood or metal, used especially to hold sth up 杆，柱，棒（尤用于撑住物品）: a flagpole 旗杆 a tent pole 帐篷支柱 ☞picture at ski 见ski插图
2 either of the two points at the exact top and bottom of the earth 地极: the North/South Pole 北╱南极 ☞picture at earth 见earth插图
3 either of the two ends of a MAGNET, or the positive or negative points of an electric battery 磁极；电极 ☞picture at magnet 见magnet插图

*police¹
/pəˈli:s ||; pəˈlis/noun [pl] the official organization whose job is to make sure that people obey the law, and to prevent and solve crime 警察部门；警方: Dial 999 if you need to call the police. 如要报警，拨999。 a police car 警车 Kamal wants to join the police force when he finishes school. 卡马尔毕业后想当警察。 the local police station 当地的警察分局 Police is a plural noun, always used with a plural verb. You cannot say ‘a police’ meaning one man or woman. When we are talking about the organization, we always use the There were over 100 police on duty. The police are investigating the murder. police是复数名词，总是要与复数动词连用。指一个男警察或女警察时，不能说a police。如果所指的是警察部门，就总是要用the：There were over 100 police on duty.有超过100名警察在值班。·The police are investigating the murder. 警方正调查那宗谋杀案。
 police²
/pəˈli:s ||; pəˈlis/verb [T] to keep control in a place by using the police or a similar official group 维持治安；控制秩序: The cost of policing football games is extremely high. 以警力维持足球赛事的秩序，费用十分昂贵。

poˌlice ˈconstable
(also constable) noun [C] (Brit 英) (abbr PC) a police officer of the lowest position (rank) （职级最低的）警察，警员

poˈlice officer
(also officer) (also poˈlicemanpoˈlicewoman) noun [C] a member of the police 警察

poˈlice state
noun [C] a country where people's freedom, especially to travel and to express political opinions, is controlled by the government, with the help of the police 警察国家（指政府在警察协助下限制人民自由的国家，尤指旅行及表达政治观点的自由）

*policy
/ˈpɒləsi ||; ˈpɑləsɪ/noun (plural policies)
1 [C,U] policy (on sth) a plan of action agreed or chosen by a government, a company, etc （政府、公司等的）方针，政策: Labour has a new set of policies on health. 工党在卫生方面有一套新政策。 It is company policy not to allow smoking in meetings. 会议中不准吸烟是公司的方针。
2 [C,U] a way of behaving that you think is best in a particular situation 行为准则: It's my policy only to do business with people I like. 我的准则是只与我喜欢的人做生意。
3 [C] a document that shows an agreement that you have made with an insurance company 保险单: an insurance policy 一份保险单

polio
/ˈpəʊliəʊ ||; ˈpolɪo/noun [U] a serious disease which can cause you to lose the power in certain muscles 小儿麻痹症；脊髓灰质炎

polish¹
/ˈpɒlɪʃ ||; ˈpɑlɪʃ/verb [T] to make sth shine by rubbing it and often by putting a special cream or liquid on it （用特别的软膏或液体）磨光，擦亮: to polish your shoes/a table 擦亮鞋子╱桌子 polish sth off(informal 非正式) to finish sth, especially food, quickly 迅速完成某事（尤指进食）: The two of them polished off a whole chicken for dinner! 他们两个人晚饭吃掉一整只鸡！
polish²
/ˈpɒlɪʃ ||; ˈpɑlɪʃ/noun
1 [U] a cream, liquid, etc that you put on sth to clean it and make it shine 擦亮剂；上光剂；亮光剂: a tin of shoe polish 一罐鞋油 ☞picture at bucket 见bucket插图
2 [sing] the action of polishing sth 磨光；擦亮: I'll give the glasses a polishbefore the guests arrive. 在宾客到来前，我会把那些玻璃杯擦得亮晶晶的。

polished
/ˈpɒlɪʃt ||; ˈpɑlɪʃt/adj
1 shiny because of polishing 磨光了的；擦亮了的: polished wood floors 擦亮了的木地板
2 (used about a performance, etc) of a high standard （指表演等）高水平的: Most of the actors gave a polished performance. 这些演员大多数表演很精彩。

*polite
/pəˈlaɪt ||; pəˈlaɪt/adj having good manners and showing respect for others 有礼貌的；客气的: The assistants in that shop are always very helpful and polite. 那家商店的店员总是非常乐意为顾客服务，而且很有礼貌。 He gave me a polite smile. 他礼貌地对我笑了一笑。 [OPP] impolite or impertinent 反义词为impolite或 impertinent ➔politely adv ➔politeness noun [U]

*political
/pəˈlɪtɪkl ||; pəˈlɪtɪkḷ/adj
1 connected with politics and government 政治的；与政治或政府有关的: a political leader/debate/party 政界领袖；政治辩论；政党 She has very strong political opinions. 她有很强烈的政治见解。
2 (used about people) interested in politics （指人）对政治感兴趣的
3 concerned with the competition for power inside an organization 与组织内部争权有关的: I suspect he was dismissed for political reasons. 我怀疑他因人事上的原因而给免职的。 ➔politically adv Politically he's fairly right wing. 在政治方面，他相当右倾。

poˌlitical aˈsylum
noun [U] protection given by a state to a person who has left his/her own country for political reasons 政治避难，政治庇护（某国家对因政治理由逃离本国的人所提供的保护）

poˌlitically corˈrect
adj (abbr PC) used to describe language or behaviour that carefully avoids offending particular groups of people （用于表示在语言或行为上很谨慎，避免得罪某群体的人）政治上得体或恰当 ➔poˌlitical corˈrectness noun [U]

*politician
/ˌpɒləˈtɪʃn ||; ˌpɑləˈtɪʃən/noun [C] a person whose job is in politics, especially one who is a member of parliament or of the government 政界人士；政客；政治家: Politicians of all parties supported the war. 各党派的人士都支持这场战争。

*politics
/ˈpɒlətɪks ||; ˈpɑləˌtɪks/noun
1 [U] [with.sop] the work and ideas that are connected with governing a country, a town, etc 政治；政务: to go into politics. 从政 Politics has/have never been of great interest to me. 我对政治从来不大感兴趣。
2 [pl] a person's political opinions and beliefs （一个人的）政治见解，政治信念: His politics are extreme. 他的政治见解很极端。
3 [U] [with.sop] matters concerned with competition for power between people in an organization （组织内部人与人之间的）争权夺利，钩心斗角: I never get involved in office politics. 我从来不参与办公室里争权夺利的事。
4 (US 美 Poˌlitical ˈScience) [U] the scientific study of government 政治学: a degree in Politics 政治学学位

poll¹
/pəʊl ||; pol/noun[C]
1 (also oˈpinion poll) a way of finding out public opinion by asking a number of people their views on sth 民意调查；民意测验: This was voted best drama series in a viewers' poll. 此剧在观众民意调查中获选为最佳连续剧。
2 the process of voting in a political election; the number of votes given 选举投票；投票数: The country will go to the polls (= vote) in June. 这个国家将于六月举行大选。
poll²
/pəʊl ||; pol/verb[T]
1 to receive a certain number of votes in an election （选举中）获得（选票）: The Liberal Democrat candidate polled over 3000 votes. 那位自由民主党候选人获得3000多票。
2 to ask members of the public their opinion on a subject 对（大众）进行民意调查: Of those polled, only 20 per cent were in favour of changing the law. 在那些接受民意调查的人之中，只有百分之二十是支持修改那项法律的。

pollen
/ˈpɒlən ||; ˈpɑlən/noun [U] a fine, usually yellow, powder which is formed in flowers. It makes other flowers of the same type produce seeds when it is carried to them by the wind, insects, etc. 花粉 ☞pictures at flower and on page C2 见flower及C2页插图

ˈpollen count
noun [C] [usu.sing] a number that shows how much pollen is in the air 花粉计数

ˈpollen tube
noun [C] a tube which grows when pollen lands on the top of the female part in the middle of a flower(stigma)to carry the male cell to the part that contains the female cell(ovule) 花粉管 ☞picture at flower 见flower插图

pollinate
/ˈpɒləneɪt ||; ˈpɑləˌnet/verb [T] to put a fine powder(pollen)into a flower or plant so that it produces seeds （给花或植物）传授花粉 ➔pollination /ˌpɒləˈneɪʃn ||; ˌpɑləˈneʃən/ noun [U]

polling
/ˈpəʊlɪŋ ||; ˈpolɪŋ/noun[U]
1 the activity of voting in an election （在选举中）投票: Polling has been heavy since 8 am. 自上午8时以来，投票一直很踊跃。
2 the act of asking questions in order to find out public opinion 民意测验

ˈpolling booth
(US usually 美通常作 voting booth) noun [C] a small, partly enclosed place where you stand to mark your card in order to vote in an election 投票亭

ˈpolling day
noun [U] [C] (Brit 英) a day on which people vote in an election 选举日；投票日

ˈpolling station
noun [C] (especially Brit 尤为英) a building where you go to vote in an election 投票站

pollster
/pəʊlstə(r) ||; ˈpolstɚ/noun [C] a person who makes or asks the questions in a poll¹(1) 民意调查员

pollutant
/pəˈlu:tənt ||; pəˈlutənt/noun [C] a substance that pollutes air, rivers, etc 污染物质

*pollute
/pəˈlu:t ||; pəˈlut/verb [T] to make air, rivers, etc dirty and dangerous 污染，弄脏（空气、河流等）: Traffic fumes are polluting our cities. 车辆废气正在污染我们的城市。 The beach has been polluted with oil. 海滩被原油污染了。

*pollution
/pəˈlu:ʃn ||; pəˈluʃən/noun[U]
1 the action of making the air, water, etc dirty and dangerous 污染: Major steps are being taken to control the pollution of beaches. 现正采取重要措施来控制海滩污染。
2 substances that pollute 污染物质: The rivers are full of pollution. 江河里充满污染物质。

polo
/ˈpəʊləʊ ||; ˈpolo/noun [U] a game for two teams of horses and riders. The players try to score goals by hitting a ball with long wooden hammers 马球（运动）

ˈpolo neck
noun [C] a high collar on a piece of clothing that is rolled over and that covers most of your neck; a piece of clothing with this type of collar 高圆翻领；高圆翻领衣服 ☞picture on page C6 见C6页插图

poly-
/ˈpɒli ||; ˈpɑlɪ/prefix (used in nouns, adjectives and adverbs 用于构成名词、形容词及副词) many 许多: polygamy 一夫多妻制

polyester
/ˌpɒliˈestə(r); US ˈpɒli:estər ||; ˈpɑlɪˌɛstɚ/noun [U] an artificial material that is used for making clothes, etc 聚酯纤维（一种人造物料，用于制衣等）

polyethylene
(US 美) =POLYTHENE

polygamy
/pəˈlɪgəmi ||; pəˈlɪgəmɪ/noun [U] the custom of having more than one wife at the same time 一夫多妻制 ☞Look at bigamy and monogamy. 参看bigamy及monogamy。 ➔polygamous /pəˈlɪgəməs ||; pəˈlɪgəməs/ adj a polygamous society 实行一夫多妻制的社会

polygon
/ˈpɒlɪgən ||; ˈpɑlɪˌgɑn/noun [C] a flat shape with at least three, and usually five or more, angles and straight sides 多边形；多角形 ➔polygonal /pəˈlɪgənl ||; pəˈlɪgənḷ/ adj

polymer
/ˈpɒlɪmə(r) ||; ˈpɑlɪmɚ/noun [C] (technical术语) a natural or artificial chemical compound consisting of large MOLECULES 聚合物

polyp
/ˈpɒlɪp ||; ˈpɑlɪp/noun[C]
1 (medical医学) a small lump that grows inside the body, especially in the nose. It is caused by disease but is usually harmless 息肉（尤指鼻子里的）
2 a small and very simple sea creature with a body shaped like a tube 水螅虫

polystyrene
/ˌpɒliˈstaɪri:n ||; ˌpɑlɪˈstaɪrin/noun [U] a light firm plastic substance that is used for packing things so that they do not get broken 聚苯乙烯（一种轻而坚固的塑料物质，用于包装物品以防破碎）

polythene
/ˈpɒlɪθi:n ||; ˈpɑləθin/ (US 美 polyethylene /ˌpɒliˈeθəli:n/) noun [U] a type of very thin plastic material often used to make bags for food, etc or to keep things dry 聚乙烯（一种很薄的塑料，经常用于制造食品袋和保持物品干燥的袋）

polyunsaturated
/ˌpɒliʌnˈsætʃəreɪtɪd ||; ˌpɑlɪʌnˈsætʃəˌretɪd/adj (used about fats and oils) having the type of chemical structure that is thought to be good for your health （指脂肪及油类）多不饱和的: polyunsaturated margarine 多不饱和人造黄油 ☞Look at saturated and unsaturated. 参看saturated及unsaturated。

pomegranate
/ˈpɒmɪgrænɪt ||; ˈpɑmˌgrænɪt/noun [C] a round fruit with thick smooth skin that is red inside and full of seeds 石榴

pomp
/pɒmp ||; pɑmp/noun [U] the impressive nature of a large official occasion or ceremony （官方场合或典礼的）盛况，壮观

pompous
/ˈpɒmpəs ||; ˈpɑmpəs/adj showing that you think you are more important than other people, for example by using long words that sound impressive 自大的；爱炫耀的；自命不凡的 ☞This word is used in a critical way. 这个词用于批评。

pond
/pɒnd ||; pɑnd/noun [C] an area of water that is smaller than a lake 池塘；水池 ☞picture on page C7 见C7页插图 ☞A lake is usually big enough to sail on Lake Como. A pond may be big enough for animals to drink from or may be a very small area of water in a garden We have a fish pond in our garden.
